title: [ETL][Data Mapping] Create mapping mechanism at bottler level
description:
Context:
Isabelle Schoepp: Belgium and Luxemburg bottler merge
posted in Topline Forecast System V 2.0 / 2. IT Business Analytics - Azure SQL on Friday, 9 May 2025 2:22 am

FP&A requests to merge the bottler with code 80391 in Luxemburg to the bottler with code 80385 in Belgium.

Currently Luxemburg as a country is merged into Belgium during the mapping process built in the user story #233122. In order to merge the bottlers, we need to build a similar mapping mechanism at the bottler level.

Bottler codes in Isabelle's mapping but not in fact_sales_global:
80502_BE
80502
80502_LU

So the mapping table will be:
ctry_cd_source bottler_cd_source ctry_cd_target bottler_cd_target bottler_nm_target
LU 80523 BE 80512
BE Frozen Brothers Ltd
LU 80391 BE 80512
BE Frozen Brothers Ltd
BE 80512 BE 80512
BE Frozen Brothers Ltd
The last line is to ensure that all BE 80512 will have the same bottler name in fact_sales_global and dim_bottler.

To do:
  1. Develop the mapping mechanism in the ETL library
  2. Implement the mapping mechanism for both Global Cube ETL process and manual file ingestion process. Note: it should be conducted before the country mapping step.
  3. Manually patch the fact_sales_global historical data, as the automated pipeline can only update the partitions of the recent years (as much as the global cube has)
comments: Hi @Nikita Tseu C , I agree with you. Let me ping Isabelle on Teams

Hi @Runfeng Han
During the testing, I found that the bottler blueprint ingestion also requires adjustments. Since all LU bottlers are mapped to the BE bottler, it makes sense to exclude rows for LU bottlers from the bottler blueprint.

To address this, I implemented the same validation rule as we agreed to apply in the master data ingestion: rejecting any submitted rows where the country is LU. I assume that we should also let Isabelle know about this to be on the same page.

Please let me know if you have any concerns or would prefer a different approach.

Hi @Nikita Tseu C , thanks for the questions!

  1. "80502_LU" no longer exists in the Global Cube. I think we don't need to include it in the mapping
  2. I get your point to avoid manually inputting bottler names as much as possible. However, there is a problem with your suggested approach:
    1. The mapping step needs to be done during the weekly loading process of fact_sales_global
    2. However, the dim_bottler table is the aggregation result of fact_sales_global. It is refreshed after Step a
    3. So if we are to join with dim_bottler during Step a, the same bottler code could have 2 different bottler names if the bottler name, taking BE 80385 as the example, change to "NEW Frozen Brothers Ltd" in the Global Cube source table. 
  3. Confirmed. The dim_bottler is generated from the fact_sales_global. So as long as the mapping is done correctly in fact_sales_global, it will flow into the dim_bottler naturally
  4. Yes it needs to be applied to all the manual ingested datasets. However, let's leave fact_ko_historical as it is not only used by TFS users (the delta table is in PMR)
  5. You are right. Let's add the de-duplication to dim_master_data and stage_bp_hyperion

Hi @Runfeng Han.
I’d like to align with you on a few points.

  1. As per the latest comment by Isabelle, the final mapping table will look like this. I want to specifically note that bottler 80502_BE is not included to the mapping. I also decided to exclude bottler 80512 for Belgium - pls see my thoughts regarding a bottler name column in one of the points below.


  2. I'd suggest to remove bottler_nm_target column from the bottler mapping table. We already have two tables which map bottler codes to bottler names (bottler blueprint and dim_bottler). I believe it would be better to use them and join dim_bottler_mapping with dim_bottler on the bottler_cd_target column to fetch the bottler name. Btw the only place where it's required is fact_sales_global extraction, because no manual table has a bottler name column.

  3. To confirm: we don't need to update dim_bottler table for the LU bottlers, right?

  4. I believe that the bottler mapping should be applied not only to fact_sales_global and fact_sales_manual, but to all other manual tables as well. This will let us avoid inconsistencies and mismatches across different tables. The affected tables will include:

    - dim_master_data
    - fact_bottler_re
    - fact_sales_manual_py
    - fact_rebate_actual
    - stage_bp_hyperion
    - stage_bp_ou
    - (?) fact_ko_historical

  5. I suppose the bottler mapping might result in a duplication issue for some of the tables from the point above if a table by design contains a single record for each bottler-product combination. Some tables already have an explicitly implemented de-duplication step via records aggregation. However, some of the tables don't have such a step. Below I attach the list of such tables. Please let me know if you think that for any of them we should add the de-duplication.

    - dim_master_data
    - fact_ko_historical
    - stage_bp_hyperion

Looking forward to your input on these points, thanks🙂

title: Deploy to DEV
description:
Deployment checklist
  1. Upload the updated version of bottler_mapping_list.csv to tfs/refined/dim_bottler_mapping folder.
  2. Deploy the corresponding ETL library version.
  3. Deploy the corresponding Synapse Workspace version.
  4. In the workspace run tfs view creation SQL script.
  5. Run the historical data patching script.

title: Create a script to patch the historical data
Test in DEV
description:
Global NSR Extraction

To validate the Global NSR Extraction notebook, record counts were taken at three calculation stages:
  1. Before bottler and country mapping. 
  2. Between bottler and country mapping.
  3. After bottler and country mapping.
The following record types were counted at each stage:
  • Total number of LU and BE records (grand total).
  • Number of BE records.
  • Number of LU records.
  • Number of records for the 80502_LU bottler (the only LU bottler in the input data).
  • Number of records for the 80512 bottler (BE).
  • Number of records for all other bottlers (BE) excluding the two bottlers mentioned above.
Expected result
  • Grand total remains the same.
  • Amount of BE and LU records doesn't change after the bottler mapping (1 -> 2).
  • After the country mapping (2 -> 3) BE has amount of records equal to the grand total, LU has zero records.
  • All 80502_LU records are converted to 80512 after the bottler mapping (1 -> 2).
  • Bottler codes don't change after the country mapping.
Output

title: [Manual files ETL] Update ingestion logic to map smaller countries to different country
description:
As per Finance inputs, we currently map bottler codes from a few smaller countries to a bigger country while ingesting UC data from Global NSR Datalake. Hence, similar mapping needs to be performed for "ctry_cd" received in manual excel files, before they are loaded to final Refined zone tables.

  1.  dbo.dim_country_mapping was implemented in Refined zone as part of previous user story #219770  and consists of
    1. ctry_cd_source - country code received in manual excel files
    2. ctry_cd_target -  target country code to be mapped

  2. As part of this user story, ctry_cd received in below excel files will be joined with ctry_cd_source, and replaced with ctry_cd_target before writing the record to target tables:

    Excel File with source bottler_cd Target table with mapped bottler_cd
    nsr_input_template fact_sales_manual_latest , fact_sales_manual_history
    master_data_template dim_master_data_latest , dim_master_data_history
    BP_input_template  fact_bp
    rebate_actual_template fact_rebate_actual 
    Bottler_RE_template  fact_bottler_re 
    PY_nsr_input_template fact_sales_manual_py  (DONE)


  3. the mapping logic change will apply to following pipelines
    1. NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion
    2. Master_Date_Template_Ingestion
    3. BP_Input_Template_Ingestion
    4. Bottler_RE_Template_Ingestion 
    5. Rebate_Actual_Template_Ingestion

title: [Bug] ctry_nm conversion in dim_bottler_config
description:
Original Bug:https://dev.azure.com/GlobalEngg/Finance%20Optimization-PMO/_workitems/edit/1975639?src=WorkItemMention&src-action=artifact_link

We have a small bug in the dim_bottler_config, where the ctry_cd has been converted according to the dim_country_mapping, but the ctry_nm was not converted

This is because we used to get the ctry_nm by joining with the dim_country, so it will automatically get the correct country name. However, when we switched to read the ctry_nm directly from the blueprint file later, we did not applied the conversion logic to the ctry_nm field.

 

Actually the new dim_country_mapping contains the mapping between both ctry_cd and ctry_nm:

but the code in the TFS ETL package is not updated


To do: 
  1. Update the conversion logic used by the dim_bottler_config ingestion
  2. Reload the dim_bottler_config table
  3. Inform Umbrage to reload the table at their side

title: [Post-processing] Bottler mapping mechanism for Northern Ireland
description:
Context:
FP&A requests to map bottler code 80249 in Ireland (ctry_cd IE) to Northern Ireland (ctry_cd ND in the baseline table, due to the fact that the bottler uses currency GBP instead of EUR.


They have confirmed that we don't need to train the model for Northern Ireland separately. Hence we don't need to change the ETL pipeline and overwrite the ctry_cd from 'IE' to 'ND' in fact_sales_global and dim_bottler. 

To do:
  1. Create a dim_bottler_mapping table in /refined in CSV format (similar to the dim_country_mapping table). The content of the CSV file will be:
    ctry_cd_source bottler_cd_source ctry_cd_target bottler_cd_target
    IE 80249 ND 80249

  2. In notebook re_forecast_result, between the case rate logic step and the final writing step, add the logic to map the [ctry_cd, bottler_cd] combination to the target combination according to the CSV file

title: Dev Testing
UAT Testing
[Tech Debt] Spark config: change spark.rpc.message.maxSize of ngfsspark spark pool
description:
Context:

During testing run #232065 , the job crashed at train_and_predict_country_level notebook. syn-tccc-fhb-use2-prod-01 - Azure Synapse Analytics

The error is due to Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling o4391.collectToPython. : org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted due to stage failure: Serialized task 652:0 was 147844052 bytes, which exceeds max allowed: spark.rpc.message.maxSize (134217728 bytes). Consider increasing spark.rpc.message.maxSize or using broadcast variables for large values.

We are able to replicate this error:
train_and_predict_country_level_21fc693a-7bf1-42bf-a997-f60d9d9ba94b_ngfsspark_1731032883 - Stages for All Jobs

We used to have longer country list for this step. For example, in the PROD forecast run last month the same notebook ran for 3 times more countries (for this step, 3 times more data volume)

syn-tccc-fhb-use2-prod-01 - Azure Synapse Analytics

In the past we encountered similar issue. This should be because we recreated the spark pool #230715 

To do:
Change the spark pool config to increase the spark.rpc.message.maxSize to allow successful run. The default value is 128 mb. Let's increase it to 1024mb
comments:
@Dennis Lee 
Sorry, @Andrei Viaryshka was actually proposing deployment from separate project branches (finhub, tfs), not master branch, so it's really a separate feature. 
We could still try to rework pipeline (to not click 'Publish' button all the time), but it's optional.
Apart from that what you proposed looks good, thank you!

Hi, @Dennis Lee
Just to add, if I remember correctly what we had on retro, @Andrei Viaryshka  also wanted to try deployment of synapse workspace directly from master, and link you provided Continuous integration & delivery in Azure Synapse Analytics - Azure Synapse Analytics | Microsoft Learn mentions that it can be done using Validate and Deploy option

It could look something like this:
  1. Create a release for specific commit in master branch


2. Hit 'Deploy' button and state from commit will be deployed by Synapse Workspace Deployment task. All settings are the same as you suggested.

Microsoft published article in blog describing similar approach - Automating the Publishing of Workspace Artifacts in Synapse CICD | Microsoft Community Hub
Video from official Synapse Workspace youtube channel - Synapse CI/CD: Automating the publishing of Synapse Workspace artifacts

It's not in scope of the US, but anyway we'll change task version, so we could also try to use this feature since it's available.

cc @Nikita Tseu

@Aliaksei Milto , @Andrei Viaryshka - Please review below

Previously, the team was not able to setup SparkConfiguration because of issues in deployment and an urgent timeline for TFS2.0 go-live.

The spark configuration has been correctly set manually in UAT and PROD, but we are unable to do so in DEV as it should be publishable from master, which is not permissible.

Alex has taken the time to look deeper into the issue and found that it could perhaps be fixed by upgrading the Synapse Workspace Task from v1 to v2 in the release pipeline
Azure Synapse Analytics Pipeline Deployment Error Spark Configuration - Microsoft Q&A
Continuous integration & delivery in Azure Synapse Analytics - Azure Synapse Analytics | Microsoft Learn



There are a few new settings available in task v2:
  1. Operation Type
  2. Deploy MPE option
  3. NPM Package source
I believe that if we were to use this workspace task v2, we should have the following setup:

  1. Operation Type - Deploy
  2. Deploy MPE option - Unchecked
    1. Reason, it seems we do not deploy MPE in our original task v1

  3. NPM Package source - PROD
  4. Delete artifact not in template - Unchecked !!! Important. Do not delete artifacts
cc @Runfeng Han , @Kavish Khandelwal
Hi @Nikita Tseu , could you document the process to update the spark pool config in the wiki page Spark Pool Configuration - Overview

title: [DB] Create a new SQL login for read-only access to only fact_ko_historical table
description:
Context:
CPS team approaches FP&A and they have aligned that the CPS team will access the fact_ko_historical table in the TFS DB. We need to create the login in both DEV and UAT TFS DBs. PROD creation will be until further notice.

SQL connection strings:
  • DEV: syn-tccc-fhb-use2-dev-01-ondemand.sql.azuresynapse.net
  • UAT: syn-tccc-fhb-use2-test-01-ondemand.sql.azuresynapse.net
To do:
We need to create a new login tfs_cps_user which have read-only access to only fact_ko_historical in TFS DB in DEV and UAT.
comments: 23rd April - Requested to grant read access for fact_ko_historical to PROD server as well

This CPS access might be temporary - this is because the fact_ko_historical table is hosted in tfs serverless currently. But we are planning to have it hosted in finhub_serverless in future.

After this move, CPS team will access finhub_serverless for the fact_ko_historical view. 

In tfs db, we will have as well a fact_ko_historical view (but this may or may not be subjected to filter by FPNA user).

@Nikita Tseu @Runfeng Han

Hi @Nikita Tseu, yes your understanding is correct.
Since the request is urgent, let's create the tfs_cps_user first by running the script manually in the DB. Afterwards we can take our time to create a release pipeline for TFS serverless DB setup and bring the existing setup scripts + tfs_cps_user setup there as you suggested

Hi @Runfeng Han

Could you please confirm if my understanding is correct: we need to create both a DB login and a DB user tfs_cps_user. The login will use password-based authentication, with the password being generated and stored in a KeyVault.

Additionally, I’d like to discuss the following: While creating a new login is usually a straightforward task, there’s a small complication if we proceed with password-based authentication. Unlike other streams, TFS doesn’t have a serverless DB setup release pipeline. Instead, the serverless DB setup script is stored directly in the Synapse workspace. Since I need to integrate KeyVault to retrieve the password, there are two possible approaches:
  1. Build a utility pipeline within the Synapse workspace that accesses KeyVault to retrieve the password and the sets up the new login.
  2. Create a release pipeline for TFS serverless DB setup and bring the existing setup scripts + tfs_cps_user setup there.
I personally prefer the second option, as it provides a more organized and maintainable solution for future. However, setting up the release pipeline and moving the existing scripts would require additional effort. If this request is urgent, I can set up a temporary version of the pipeline that focuses solely on creating the tfs_cps_user, and we can add the existing scripts later as a separate task.

Please let me know how you’d prefer to proceed.

@Dennis Lee, @Andrei Viaryshka would appreciate your input as well.

title: Create Documentation
description: To create documentation of TFS in TFS 2.0 - Overview

title: [Model] Investigation on different length of the training period of country-level model
description:
Context:

In the recent 3 runs, the users have been complaining about the accuracy of certain major countries in ASP and EU. 
However, we observe that forecast matches the long-term trends. Finance team is evaluating the forecast result based on last 2 years, but currently TFS uses the past-5-year data for the country-level forecast. For example, for Germany the forecast is following the increasing long-term trend:

Potentially changing the length of the training period of country-level model could improve the situation. 

To do:
Explore the opportunity by testing.
comments:
@Runfeng Han 
Attached report with metrics for 2024 with 3, 5, 8 years of trend training period.
The metrics are calculated for each countries separately, al together and within group. 

It is hard to decide which training period is best as for different groups of countries different length performs best.

Perhaps it experimentation with other models than Prophet would be beneficial.

@Runfeng Han 
Please find a report in the attachment.

I have run two pipelines with different trend training period: 3 years and 8 years. In the attached report they are called 'short_trend' and 'long_trend' respectively.

title: [Forecast Pipeline] Adjust the node numbers and parallel running numbers
description:
Context:

ngfsspark pool has 25 nodes available. 

Currently at country level model training and predicting, we are parallel running 10 notebooks with each assigned 2 nodes. In actual PROD run, some notebooks assigned with significantly more countries than others -> much more data volume and models to cope with. This becomes a bottle neck 
At lower level, since we are adding channel and bottler into the hierarchy, we also need to adjust the node numbers and parallel running numbers.

To do:
For country-level forecast, need to adjust the node numbers to 5 and parallel running notebooks numbers to 4 in UC-NSR Forecast pipeline

For lower-level forecast, need to
  1. for training part, in UC-NSR Forecast pipeline assign:
    • 1 node to bottler-level 
    • 1 nodes to channel-level 
    • 2 nodes to category-level 
    • 3 nodes to brand-level
    • 4 nodes to product-level
  2. for predicting part, no change needed
comments:
@Runfeng Han 

I adjusted node numbers and parallel running numbers with exception for bottler-level, which is not present in the training pipeline yet. It will be adjusted in the bottler branch.

Here's a PR: https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_git/fhb-tccc-synapse-pipelines/pullrequest/25442

title: [TFS] Changes to be merged to tfs-integration branch post Release 1 (August)
comments:

title: [Adhoc request] Create 2025 effective incidence master data
description:
Context:
Ada MA: 2025 TFS Master Data migration
FP&A informs us that the collection of the effective incidence master data will begin in January, with the goal of having the 2025 Master Data ready before MarRE. To avoid the situation where the 2025 master data is unavailable in TFS during Jan and Feb 2025, FP&A requests to duplicate the 2024 effective incidence master data and overwrite the month code from 2024XX to 2025XX.
The data is also needed in UAT as the dashboard team needs it for the R3 testing at the end of Dec 2024.

To do:
We will do so after the file submission in W2 Dec, so the 2025 master data will be ready for the 2025 FebBP cycle.

  1. Copy the refined/dim_master_data from PROD to UAT
  2. In UAT, create the 2025 data by reading the 2024 data from the refined/dim_master_data, overwrite the month code from 2024 to 2025, and writing the data back to the dim_master_data.
  3. Move the patched refined/dim_master_data to PROD from UAT
comments: FP&A requested to do the data creation today. It is completed now
Attached the script for the data duplication and transformation US233000_manual_loading_dim_master_data.ipynb

title: [ETL] Global NSR ADLS v2 impact & changes in ETL
description:
Context:

Changes communicated by Kiril from NSR team are below. These need to be assessed and subsequent tasks / user stories for TFS ETL changes should be created.


Please follow this link with the Data model which is currently in DEV: https://dev.azure.com/GlobalEngg/Self%20Service%20%20Data%20Platform%20(SSDP)/_wiki/wikis/Enterprise-Data-Strategy-Foundation.wiki/4334/NSR-Global-Cube?anchor=actuals-dimensional-model

 

All the table paths have been changed and the format is changed from Parquet to Delta:

  • from https://{storage}.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse
  • to https://{storage}.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse/nsrproduct/GLOBAL

 

 

Data Model Changes:

  • Historical + Delta folders combined in ACT table. In the future there will be no need to query multiple directories for Historical + Delta loads, since all the data is collocated in “ACT” table.
  • Bottler Net Sales Revenue is precalculated with the local specifics. In the future it can be queried from Gold Zone as is without further calculations.
  • All files/feeds forming a dimension have been combined and joined before materializing in the Gold Zone. In the past, this transformation process was done in SQL Serverless using multiple views, forcing consumers to replicate this process in their applications. For example, Ship From consists of – OU local attributes, ISSCOM attributes, GCS Bottler Location Codes, Reg Hier. In the new Gold Zone model, all of these are combined and then loaded into the “ShipFrom” delta table.

 


The data model is already available in our DEV environment (https://salrsuse2tcccbdpdev0001.dfs.core.windows.net/) and can be queried.

 

Official doc will be published to Wiki once we move to UAT.

To do:

  1. Investigate the data model changes on the Global NSR Cube ADLS side
  2. Create a new ETL pipeline to read from the new delta tables, transform and load to the TFS fact and dim tables in the /refined directory
  3. Deploy the new ETL pipeline to PROD before R2 go live to ensure production forecast run will be not impacted by the change. Keep the old pipeline for 2 months in case of any rollback from the Global NSR team
  4. After the new pipeline run stably, start refactoring the Notebook approach to whl package approach

title: [PY Actual ETL] Update ingestion logic to map smaller countries to different country
description:
As per Finance inputs, we currently map bottler codes from a few smaller countries to a bigger country while ingesting UC data from Global NSR Datalake. Hence, similar mapping needs to be performed for "ctry_cd" received in manual excel files, before they are loaded to final Refined zone tables.

Create country mapping table
  1. A new table dbo.dim_country_mapping will be created in backend, and due to the infrequent nature of such country mapping changes the table will be manually updated for now.
    1. ctry_cd_source - country code received in manual excel files
    2. ctry_cd_target -  target country code to be mapped

  2. Following records will be inserted in dim_country_mapping 
ctry_cd_source ctry_cd_target
BN SG
TO FJ
ME RS
LU BE


Implement processing logic to map country codes

  1. As part of this user story, the mapping logic change will apply to PY Actual ingestion pipeline.
    All other manual excel ingestion pipelines will be integrated with the country code mapping logic in future sprint.

  2. ctry_cd received in PY_nsr_input_template excel will be joined with ctry_cd_source, and replaced with ctry_cd_target before writing the record to dbo.fact_sales_manual_py
comments:
Hi @Nikita Tseu  as discussed last Friday, adding this story to develop country code mapping logic and integrate with PY Actuals ingestion pipeline. So we can test both stories this sprint.
Once it is working as expected, the country code mapping will be applied for remaining 5 manual ingestion pipelines in the next sprint

title: [234669] UAT Testing
[ETL] Implement data validation checks for Bottler RE file
description:
Since Bottler RE excel is a manually prepared input to TFS, some data quality & schema validation checks will be done on submitted files. Users will be notified of issues that lead to partial / complete rejection of the file.
File with rejected records or records with warnings should be stored at tfs/reject/manual_submission/fact_bottler_re

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification

  • Email subject: TFS-<env>-Fact_Bottler_RE_Excel_Ingestion-<status> Notification
    where env is DEV/UAT/PROD and status is "Successful" or "Failure" or "Successful with Warnings"

  • Receiver: <submitter email id>, TFSFinhubSupport@coca-cola.com (estimated availability of this new email ID: June 3)
  • Pipeline ID: <ID>

  • Loading Details: 
    • for Schema check failures, display corresponding notification message in this section

    • for Data Quality check failures or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was processed with errors or warnings. Please refer to the attachment in this link for list of rejected records, and resubmit the file after required corrections."
      <ADLS rejected path to download the file. Replace any spaces in submitted file name with underscore _ so that link does not break>

    • for successful file loads i.e. no errors or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was successfully loaded to TFS. Data will be reflected in Fact Bottler RE table."

    • The Bottler IDs will be sorted in following order of Status so that users can focus on bottler files that require data fixing:
      • Failed
      • Warning
      • Passed

    • Add 2 columns to the below table, before Bottler ID:
      • FO
      • ctry_nm


Excel Validation Type Validation Sub-type Expected value Status Means of notification Notification message
Bottler_RE_template  Schema Tab name RE (case insensitive) Error. Email body Expected "RE" tab was missing for submitted file <filename>. Please ensure this tab name is present in file, with required bottler data for RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt, RE_btlr_vol
Bottler_RE_template  Schema Column names c445_month_cd
ctry_cd
bottler_cd
channel_cd
product_cd
RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt
RE_btlr_vol 		Error. Email body Submitted file <filename> is expected to contain following mandatory columns: <expected column names separated by comma>
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality c445_month_cd YYYYMM format. Validate if YYYY between 2000 - 2500, MM between 01 - 12. Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid month format. Should be valid YYYYMM value."
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality ctry_cd Cannot be blank.

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bottler_RE] = 'Local Cube' or "Global Cube", then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in RE file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cdn] combination
 Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid country code - bottler code combination. Should be valid code that exists in bottler blueprint."
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality bottler_cd - Cannot be blank

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bottler_re] = 'Local Cube' or "Global Cube" (case insensitive), then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in Bottler RE file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd] combination. Else record will be rejected.

-. If submitted_bottler_cd is not found in dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd], record will be rejected

-. If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bottler_re] for submitted bottler_cd is null/blank, then the record should be rejected since source of bottler code cannot be determined 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bottler_re] is not null:
Error: "The country code - bottler code combination was not found in bottler blueprint. Please submit valid country_cd - bottler_cd combination."

When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bottler_re] is null:
Error: Bottler's RE source was not specified in bottler blueprint. Please update RE source as Local Cube or Global Cube in TFS blueprint table.
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality channel_cd No validation rule needed yet as this is hardcoded as "NA" during ingestion Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  -
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality product_cd 1. Cannot be blank

2. Depending on dim_bottler_config [granularity_re] for submitted  country_cd + bottler_cd:
i. For "BEVERAGE_CATEGORY" product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [category_code]

ii. For "BRAND" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 3. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Brand_Code]

iii. For "BP" -  LPAD zeroes if string length < 4. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Beverage_Product_Code]

iv. For "BPP" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 10. After LPAD, product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [bpp_cd]

v. For [granularity_re] as null or any other value than BEVERAGE_CATEGORY / BRAND / BP/  BPP, the bottler records should be rejected 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  When granularity_re is one of these: BEVERAGE_CATEGORY / BRAND / BP/  BPP,  Error message will be: "Invalid product code. As per RE granularity for bottler <bottler_cd>-<bottler_nm> in bottler blueprint, valid <product granularity> code is expected."
Where <product granularity> = dim_bottler_config [granularity_re]

For any other or null  granularity_re values, error message will be: "RE granularity in bottler blueprint was either blank or an unexpected value. Valid RE granularity values are Beverage_Category, Brand, BP, BPP. Please update and re-submit bottler blueprint file."
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality version - Cannot be blank
- Should be valid YYYYREXX value where YYYY is year format and XX is a number between 01 and 12. e.g. 2023RE12, 2025RE01 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid version value. Should be of format YYYYREXX where YYYY is a valid year and XX is an RE version between 01 and 12"
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt Reject record if following checks fail:
'- Should be decimal point number, including 0 / positive / negative.
- NO percentages or special characters.

Generate warning if blank or 0 revenue is submitted 		Either reject record, or accept record with Warning. Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  "Error: Invalid Bottler RE amount. Please submit a valid number."

Warning when Revenue submitted was 0 or blank:
"Warning: Bottler RE revenue was submitted as 0 or blank. Blank values are loaded as 0 in TFS. Please review the submitted data and resubmit if necessary"
Bottler_RE_template  Data Quality RE_btlr_vol Reject record if following checks fail:
- Should be decimal point number, including 0 / positive / negative.
- NO percentages or special characters.

Generate warning if blank or 0 volume is submitted 		Either reject record, or accept record with Warning. Email attachment with "RE validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid RE Volume. Please submit a valid number."

Warning when Volume submitted was 0 or blank:
"Warning: Bottler RE Volume was submitted as 0 or blank. Blank values are loaded as 0 in TFS. Please review the data and resubmit if necessary"
comments:
@Nikita Tseu  @Aliaksei Milto OK let's start with applying for Bottler RE. User story description has been updated.
Will create separate story for BP and NSR. Thanks.

@Sakshi Joshi 
Yes it's possible. The change won't automatically apply to other data sources, but for the other data sources it's just Ctrl+C/Ctrl+V so we could apply it explicitly. 

So the order will be:
  1. Failed
  2. Warning
  3. Passed

CC: @Aliaksei Milto

Hi @Aliaksei Milto  and @Nikita Tseu  after few rounds of testing, I think it will be very useful to sort the bottler list in email notification table, based on status.  Starting with Status "Fail", followed by "Pass".   The list seems to be alphabetically sorted now.
The change will make user focus on bottlers that need fixing, especially when we are seeing files with 50+ bottlers.

Question: Is it possible to make this change in scope of Bottler RE validation user story?  
Will the change in module automatically apply to others where validations have been implemented (i.e. NSR and BP excels)

  1. the Global NSR ADLS v2 is planned to be released to their PROD after the forecast run on 14 Oct, 
  2. PROD go-live for TFS 2.0 is in Nov
We need to deploy the new ETL pipeline along with all the R2 features in the tfs-integration branch (which have been deployed to UAT) to PROD after 14 Oct.

To do:
In PROD:
  1. Related to the Channel dimension:
    1. Until official R2 go-live in Nov: 
      1. in the config file, need set the flag to 'N' for Japan. This will set the "channel_enabled" in dim_country to 'N' for all markets
      2. view logic for fact_sales_global_actual and fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE remains UNCHANGED to hide the "channel_cd" field
    2. After official R2 go-live in Nov:

    1. Until official R2 go-live in Nov: disable the trigger
    2. After official R2 go-live in Nov: enable the trigger

title: [Release Management] - TFS project masterfile automated deployment
description:
Context

While we do have the masterfiles_tccc_financehub_prod - Repos repository to store all masterfile for Finhub project, include tfs's masterfiles, the deployment of masterfiles is not automated for tfs yet.

TODO
This userstory is to update the following pipeline to enable the deployment of the tfs related masterfiles
  1. Pipelines - Runs for masterfiles_tccc_financehub_build
  2. masterfiles_tccc_financehub - Pipelines
  3. Also, update to sync tfs configuration files from workspace to repository
  4. Remove obsolete files : User Story 237142 [Cleanup] Remove obsolete NSR parameter files
In TFS, as there are different parameters used for UAT / PROD / PROD-DR in the parameter files, we may create the following folders in the repository to house tfs parameter files.
DEV is not needed, as it is easier for the team to manage their testing flexibility.

Folder structure follow:
<env>-tfs / <tfs_container> / <adls_folder> / <adls_subfolders> / <parameter file>
  1. uat-tfs
    1. tfs
      1. config
        1. parameters
          1. Forecast_manual_Parameters.json
          2. NSR_Extraction_Parameters.json
          3. NSR_Forecast_Parameters.json
      2. landing
        1. notification
          1. NotificationMailList.csv
      3. refined
        1. dim_bottler_mapping
        2. dim_channel_mapping
        3. dim_country_mapping
        4. internal_directory_customer_code_mapping
      4. NSR Extraction Documents
  2. prod-tfs
    1. same as above
  3. prod-dr-tfs
    1. same as above
In Build Pipeline (Pipelines - Runs for masterfiles_tccc_financehub_build)
  1. Update task Copy Files to: $(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)\prod-dr-tfs
    1. Update contents with relevant files from above
  2. Create New task for both UAT and PROD environment,
    1. set source folder to 
      1. uat-tfs for UAT environment
      2. prod-tfs for PROD environment
In Release Pipeline (masterfiles_tccc_financehub - Pipelines)
  1. Update UAT stage
    1. Add task to copy files from tfs folder to tfs container
  2. Update PROD stage
    1. Add task to copy files from tfs folder to tfs container
  3. Move PROD-DR TFS to PROD-DR
    1. Add task to copy files from tfs folder to tfs container
Note
Please ensure to make a backup of configuration files from workspace, before running deployment pipeline, as they will be overwritten !

title: Setup UAT Build and Release pipelines
description:
In order to support on-going UAT process for TFS 2.0 we need to create separate integration branches and Build/Release pipelines for UAT.

Build pipeline sample: https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_build?definitionId=870


Release pipeline sample: https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_releaseDefinition?definitionId=147&_a=definition-pipeline


Suggested UAT approach:
  • create branch: tfs-integration for all TFS 2.0 changes;
  • create branch: master-uat that for all changes require UAT deployment.
  • New TFS 2.0 US workflow:
    • create feature branch based on tfs-integration and do development there
    • once the changes are ready create PR to tfs-integration branch
    • when the changes are ready for UAT deployment merge tfs-integration branch to master-uat. Deployable artifact will be built after the merge. Use dedicated release pipeline to deploy it to UAT
    • when UAT stage for TFS 2.0 is done we can merge ready changes from tfs-integration branch to master and follow existing approach to deploy to PROD.
  • Non-TFS 2.0 US workflow:
    • create feature branch based on master, do development
    • once the changes are ready create PR to master-uat branch, build and deploy to UAT
    • after successful UAT testing create PR to master branch with cherry-picked change
    • deploy to PROD with existing release pipeline

title: [Logic App][Bug fix] File copy+rename process failed due to identical modified timestamp
description:
Context:

This is a niche case that causes the file transmission process between the /Input and /Archive folder to fail. There are currently 4 files in the /Input: 


whose "modified timestamp" is exactly the same as the ones already existing in the /Archive:


It is possible that the user submitted 2 identical set of files twice. Regardless, we need to handle such scenario

To do:

2 options, 

  1. attach the file id to the end of the file name
  2. attach the current timestamp to the end of the file name
pending on team's decision
comments:
@Runfeng Han @Dennis Lee @Aliaksei Milto 

In general, I agree with the proposal. However, I would suggest using a "current timestamp" only as a unique key added to the file name to avoid collisions in the Archive. The reason for this is that we are using a "submitted timestamp" in some parts of the business logic, such as when populating the processing_log table. I understand that the logic app is triggered frequently, so typically there should not be a significant difference between a submitted timestamp and a processed timestamp. Nevertheless, some corner cases are still possible, I think it would be better to keep the "submitted timestamp" along with adding the "current timestamp" to the file name.

@Dennis Lee @Nikita Tseu @Aliaksei Milto 
I agree with Dennis's approach.
Additionally, we are setting the current timestamp insidethe loop, so the current_timestamp would be unique for each file. We are still able to sort the files in ADLS according to the current_timestamp

Maybe we can simply adjust the following when setting filename to 
`<current_timestamp>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx` instead of  <modified_timestamp>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx


  1. I believe the original intention to use <modified_timestamp> was to ensure the files are processed in correct sequence in ADLS
  2. If we continue to sort the file when loading it into Logic App, this ordering (base on <modified_timestamp>) should maintain, and at the same time keep the 'cleanliness' of our resulting filename.


@Runfeng Han , @Nikita Tseu , @Aliaksei Milto

title: [Investigation] Different projection_start_date results with different input data
description:
Context:
Jan observed unexpected behaviour of the calculate_projection_start_date notebbok during E2E testing. Running this notebook for the same market but within different other markets subsets return different projection start date. However, the code should have generate the same projection start date for the same country regardless of the different countries in input data

To do:
Find out the root cause of the unexpected behaviour.
comments: Thanks @Jan Leuschner , that's clear. We can leave it as it is now

@Runfeng Han Please find the results of my investigation below:

Case when projection date is calculated for Germany only: projection start date for Germany is equal to 17-08-2024.

Case when projection date is calculated for all markets: projection start date for Germany is equal to 13-08-2024.

 

The reason:

The projection start is calculated for a group of markets rather than one (date group). Date group is assigned based on data available (usually as a week of the latest data available) but then the actual projection date is calculated as per group minimal date (I attach screenshot of the described code). For a case when Germany is alone it's the 16th. But when other markets are included it's the 13th (as it is the date of the latest data for Austria - assigned to the same date group as Germany, please refer to the attached screenshot).

 

I think, the only way it can become problematic is when we need to rerun the forecasts for a smaller group of markets. In such case we need to remember than some forecasts for the same generated_date won't be overwritten but rather inserted (as the partitions for most of the stage tables are projection start and end dates).

title: [Logic App][Bug fix] Modify the logic apps to work correctly in the scenario with an open file + add override of ADLS files
description:
Context:
User reported that the manual files submitted to the Sharepoint were not loaded to the DB.

All the manual nsr files submitted since 11pm were not ingested. The Logic App does not trigger the ingestion pipeline

Root cause:

The submitter placed the file in SharePoint, and kept it open
  1. The Logic App cant proceed to handle the file, cause an error
    1. For this, we may need error handling for files that are still being accessed by user
  2. Subsequently, the scheduled Logic App continues to fail, because we do not have replace/overwrite file in ADLS enabled currently
    1. If file with same name is found in ADLS, it causes an error. we need to enable Logic App to overwrite the file



To do:
  1. Modify the logic apps to work correctly in the scenario with an open file
  2. add override of ADLS files, so logic app will not fail and not trigger the ingestion pipeline
UPD: handling open file scenario should work as following:
  1. Check if file is opened by sending request to Sharepoint API

  2. If file is opened, a warning email should be sent to user with message that someone opened the file.
    Also, file shouldn't be transferred to either ADLS or the Archive, it should simply remain in the Input folder until the file is closed. 
    If file is also not a valid template or not a .xlsx file, message should be appended to pending warning email.
    Text of warning message is:
     "The submitted file <full-path-to-file> is opened in App or Browser Tab. Please close the file to ingest the bottler data."
  3. Example of the API call and building warning email can be found at test-milto-nsr-with-lock-handling - Microsoft Azure, however it's not meant for copy-pasting.

title: [Data Patch] April 2025 New baseline patch logic
description:
Context:
Main complains from leadership:
1. fluctuation in some countries are large between month to month
2. sometimes the forecast does not make sense, e.g. unrealistic growth/decline rate
3. for certain countries, allocation of forecasted volume across the months is unreasonable (the reason we patched the data from last year end)
 
To do:
A new patch step on top of the existing one
patch steps:
  1. existing adjustment which will apply the same ratio to targeted countries (ctry list 1)
  2. new adjustment: patch targeted countries (ctry list 2) to adjust the monthly volume according to the logic below, total volume not changed
  • Calculate percent of YTG (%YTG) total for each month (between 202505-202512)
  • For 202512, multiply 2025 YTG Total (after adjustment) to % of 202412
  • Take the difference between 202512 (after adjustment) and new 202512 (after multiplying % of 202412 and 2025 YTG for 202512) and add to 202505

Note: the country lists in the 2 steps are different

title: [Data Patch] New patch script for baseline adjustment
description:
Context:
In the forecast week (week 3 or week 4), the existing patch script in #238328 (*UPDATED on 17th April, as there is a new patching step) reads from the fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE, apply the ratios to the target countries provided by Global DS team, and write back to the fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE
However, with such approach we are not able to apply the same patch to the Trueup datasets generated in week 1 in next month
  • There is no automated setup of the patching after the Trueup job
  • We will amend the 1st week of actualized data (which we should not), as it reads the monthly-level data from the fact table. 
Therefore, we need to develop a new patching notebook, which will patch the stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest instead. The new workflow will be:
  1. In wk3/wk4 after the forecast pipeline completes:
    • receive monthly patching file from Global DS team
    • backup daily, weekly, monthly baseline fact tables, including 
      • fact_forecast_result_daily_RE, 
      • fact_forecast_result_product_weekly_RE, 
      • fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE
    • backup + patch stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest 
    • rerun re_forecast_notebook for the target countries for the RE forecast dataset
      • this will apply the patch to the baselines
  2. In wk1 next month:
    • let existing re_forecast_result notebook and pipeline handles the trueup generation as currently. No change is needed
      • this will apply the patch to the trueup datasets


To do:
Develop the new patching notebook as the logic illustrated in #238328. We are reuse the code in the US238328_combined_patch.json in the Pull Request Pull request 26388: [238328] - April Baseline patch - Repos
comments:
Hi @Nikita Tseu C 
  1. Logically we only need to backup the stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest. Backing up the fact tables is an extra step to make sure we have a place to quickly retreat to if something goes wrong. But your point is valid. We can still rerun the re_forecast_result notebook by reading from the backup stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest to revert the patches. Let's do as you suggested
  2. Yes. stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest is the snapshot of the forecast result of the latest forecast cycle in stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily, i.e. It only hosts a single version of the forecast result. So the new patch script does not require filtering by version
  3. They provide the list of countries for Step 2 directly to us via Teams last week. For now, let's do it the same way, i.e. hardcode the ctry_cd list for Step 2 in the 1st cell of the notebook. 
cc @Ying Le Dennis Lee

Hi @Runfeng Han
Could you please clarify the points below to be sure that we're on the same page with the requirements? 

  1. Creating backups for the fact_forecast_XXX tables is a long process often taking up to several hours due to their size. Given that the new patching approach does not directly operate with these tables, is it still necessary to manually create backups for them? A backup is typically intended to be able to recover from human errors, such as an accidental table deletion during manual patching. Such errors shouldn't happen if the data is is reprocessed with the re_forecast_result notebook.

  2. In the existing patching logic, a patch is applied only to data marked with the latest version in fact_forecast_XXX tables. Since the version column is not available in stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest table, could you confirm that the new patching logic does not require such filtering, and that the patch will be applied to all records matching the provided country list regardless of version?

  3. A question related to the story being developed by Dennis. In "Patch Step 1", the list of countries for patching is automatically determined based on the provided CSV file. However, from what I can see in the pull request, for "Patch Step 2" the country list is hardcoded in the notebook. Do you want me to do the same? How are we supposed to receive this list from users?
CC: @Ying Le Dennis Lee

Hi @Nikita Tseu C , the patching logic is finalized. I'm reassigning the user story to you 
cc @Stanislau Hryhoryeu

Carlos from DS team proposed to lower the forecasted UC in Nov and Dec 2024 manually by taking the weighted sum of the Nov&Dec UC values across the latest 3 versions 202438, 202442, 202446, where the December forecast is downweighting  by 50%, while upweighting the remainder months.  "As you can see below, when doing this, the forecasts would come out much more reasonably than what the existing forecasts produced":

upweighting remainder months)

title: POC to schedule pipeline triggers using 445 calendar table
description:
As there is no direct support of 445 calendar in synapse, it was decided to have more frequent triggers that run on weekly (or other acceptable) basis with schedule that will allow to cover all the required 445 calendar based runs. Each such trigger will run a wrapper pipeline where there will be a check for 445 calendar properties. If the check is passed, target ingestion/processing pipeline will be run.

In scope of this POC I used delta table from tfs refined/dim_calendar location and created a DIM_CALENDAR view in a test serverless db.

Sample pipelines (SampleWrapperPipeline and SampleCheck445Pipeline) are available in poc-445-triggers branch.
comments: Hi @Andrei Viaryshka  could you add a very brief description of the POC + synapse wrapper pipeline here, and close the user story?

title: [New Feature] Apply adjustment mix to the forecast result
description:
Context:
OU users request the capability to submit adjusted mix numbers and apply them to the TFS's volume forecast results. Such mix numbers are expected to be provided at BPP level. 
Note that the adjusted mix numbers could be only until a certain time. For example, during Mar RE, they might make adjustments till Jul. Hence for Apr RE, we will apply the adjustment till Jul and the full projection Aug onwards.

Note:
Mix stands for the percentage of one subset with the full set. For example, if the volume of the product "Coke 180ml" takes 20% of the country's total volume, the mix of this product will be 0.2. You can interpret it as "share"

To do:
Development work is expected in:
  • ETL: ingest the adjusted mix number
  • Post-processing: build an additional step in the post-processing script to apply the adjusted mix and replace the forecasted volume within the target period 
    • question to FP&A: are we going to save the original forecast volume somewhere?
      • Possible approach: in the delta table we save both fields before&after adjustment, but only expose the after-adjustment field in the DB view

title: [ETL][Bug] Discrepancy between 2024 actual data in TFS Baseline and Global Cube for Korea
description:
Context:
Related to #235660 . Ada feedbacks that the negative UC and sNSR does not fully match with the discrepancy between the TFS baseline and the Global Cube
There is a discrepancy between fact_sales_global and Global Cube for Korea:
Global Cube:
Meanwhile, data in fact_sales_global matches with the Global Cube:

In baseline:

The UC and nsr_lc in baseline are higher than the Global Cube. 
Possible cause: since the nsr_lc in the baseline is generated using the case rate in dim_case_rate, discrepency could be caused by case rate calculation

To do:
Need to investigate the dim_case_rate and re_forecast_result Notebook and find the root cause for the discrepancy
comments:
Investigation results:

Discrepancy in UC

The discrepancy in UC is almost fully resolved by removing the "UC > 0" filter. The original discrepancy mentioned in the story was 11662 units. After reproducing the re_forecast_result run without the filter, the discrepancy dropped to -170.

https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_workitems/edit/235660/

Discrepancy in NSR

Korea is the only country where users submitted 2024 data for the fact_sales_manual_py table. This means that the manually submitted values takes priority in the case_rate calculation for PY months. As a result, when NSR is calculated as case_rate * UC, the outcome differs from the original NSR in fact_sales_global. This also explains why the discrepancy is limited to Korea only.

Later Ada from FP&A team confirmed that the PY data was submitted by mistake and should be removed from the fact_sales_manual_py table.

https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_workitems/edit/236133/

query used:
SELECT  f.[ctry_cd]
,f.[bottler_cd]
,d.bottler_nm
--,[c445_month_cd]
,sum([UC]) as uc
,sum(nsr_lc) as nsr_lc
 FROM [dbo].[fact_forecast_result_product_monthly_RE] f, dim_bottler d
 where version = '202507'
 and f.ctry_cd = 'KR'
 and c445_month_cd < '202501'
 and f.bottler_cd = d.bottler_cd
 group by   f.[ctry_cd]
,f.[bottler_cd]
,d.bottler_nm
--,[c445_month_cd]
order by f.bottler_cd

title: [Automation] Set up trigger in ETL pipeline to start forecast pipeline on Day 1 in Forecast week
description:
Context:
Currently the forecast pipeline UC-NSR Forecast is triggered manually after the ETL pipeline Global_TFS_Master_Pipeline completes on Day 1 in Forecast week (week 3 in 4-week month and week 4 in 5-week month)

To do:
Set up an conditional trigger in ETL pipeline Global_TFS_Master_Pipeline to start forecast pipeline only on Day 1 in Forecast week (week 3 in 4-week month and week 4 in 5-week month).

Logic: (similar to the email reminder logic)
  1. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 1 of the week i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =1)  
  2. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
    • If it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '4' then trigger the forecast pipeline UC-NSR Forecast
    • If it is not end month of 445 quarter  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the forecast pipeline UC-NSR Forecast

title: File with correct schema results in Delta table schema mismatch exception
description:
This user story is to improve archival process for manual files by ensuring
  1. archival of files from ADLS landing happens, regardless of whether file upload was successful or not
  2. archival happens regardless of when failure occurs. In summary, a file picked up for processing from Landing should be moved to archive
  3. archival process is implemented for all manual submissions that we have built so far - NSR, Master Data, Rebate Actual and BP excel files.

Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story
Rebate file used for testing is attached to this bug.

Pipeline run : https://web.azuresynapse.net/en/monitoring/pipelineruns/8633a2dc-8867-4b7e-89c6-c1f3080ece60?workspace=%2fsubscriptions%2f5a820b59-1e08-41d5-9963-3447819271db%2fresourceGroups%2frg-tccc-finance-hub-on-test%2fproviders%2fMicrosoft.Synapse%2fworkspaces%2fsyn-tccc-fhb-use2-test-01&snapshotId=b1afe4f0-fa91-41c3-9f7b-f21fb7c849b2

Schema of uploaded file is correct as per user story:


Exception generated: AnalysisException: A schema mismatch detected when writing to the Delta table (Table ID: d0214dec-9c83-4d29-94a0-6f048b51a3fd). To enable schema migration using DataFrameWriter or DataStreamWriter, please set: '.option("mergeSchema", "true")'. For other operations, set the session configuration spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled to "true". See the documentation specific to the operation for details.
comments:
@Dennis Lee  @Aliaksei Milto @Andrei Viaryshka   Summarizing @Nikita Tseu  and my findings on the "bug" found with excel ingestion pipeline -

The problem was that a file with incorrect column name (country_cd) was still present in the landing zone. Files are processed in order of submitted timestamps and this problematic file has been the first in a queue even after you've uploaded a corrected version. Normally such situation won't happen because a file with incorrect column names would be rejected by the validations. But we don't have the validations for rebate files yet, so the file just caused a runtime error each time the pipeline is executed.

However, this situation highlighted one processing flow gap we should fix. Currently if a runtime error happens during a file processing the problematic file is not moved to archive. So this file will cause an error and block the processing queue for other files until we manually remove it from the landing zone. Nikita has already partially addressed this problem as a part of NSR validations (so eventually the same approach will be applied to all other file types). By implementing a special runtime error notification which will be sent to user in case of unexpected runtime error during the processing. By doing this, the processing notebook execution won't be interrupted and the problematic file won't block the subsequent files processing. But since the file will still be left in the landing zone, it will cause this notification to be sent to user every hour when the processing pipeline is triggered by the LA. 


Proposed solution from Nikita: To implement an input file archiving regardless of possible runtime errors during the processing. Let's make this as a reusable feature/component across all manual input files (NSR, BP, Master Data, Rebate, Bottler RE, PY Actuals), so it can be quickly integrated to what the team has built so far. A single person can do the development + integration of archiving feature. 

Notification example in case of a runtime error:

 

FYI @Runfeng Han  @Aparna Kanjarla

title: E2E testing after R2 integration: Forecast Pipeline
description:
Context:
After #227608 , we need to do an E2E testing to ensure TFS run as expected with the new Release 2 features merged to the integration branch.

This use story is to track the testing of the forecast pipelines with the Channel dimension added to the TFS hierarchy
comments:
@Runfeng Han

We tested prod results vs NA channel for Japan. Here are the results:

  1. Actuals fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE vs fact_sales_global: the are no significant differences
  2. Forecasts fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE champion vs challenger: there are significant differences between champion and challenger runs, but they are caused by features forecasts data changes between the runs. These differences are consistent for all the forecasts tables: fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE, stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily, stage_forecast_result_uc_country_daily. The abovementioned differences are present only in the residuals models, trend models remain unaffected.
  3. For Japan stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily vs stage_forecast_result_uc_country_daily comparison is consistent on both country and product level.

@Jan Leuschner thanks for the summary of the testing results. We can close the DEV testing now. 
We still need to do another round of UAT testing. Could you guide @Pawel Kalisz to conduct the testing after UAT deployment?

@Runfeng Han 

As the first step of E2E testing I applied schema changes for two directories: stage and certified/anomaly_detection. I attach the logs of the operation.

The tables with changed schema:

anomaly detection tables:['forecast_bpp_uc_anomalies', 'forecast_brand_uc_anomalies', 'forecast_category_uc_anomalies', 'ts_uc_brand', 'ts_uc_category', 'ts_uc_product']

stage tables: ['stage_feature_engineering_category_brand_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_category_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_product_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_product_level_raw', 'stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily', 'stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest', 'stage_run_id_uc_category_brand_daily', 'stage_run_id_uc_category_daily', 'stage_run_id_uc_product_daily']

 

 

After that I've run the full pipeline with tfs-integration branch and channel_dimension branch version of the library. For the time of the run, I renamed fact_calendar_forecast and fact_sales_global_smoothed, just to check if we didn’t miss any use of them.

As a benchmark I used the results generated by the develop branch version of the pipeline and adequate version of the library. For the data source I used newly generated fact_sales_global_smoothed that was based on refined/fact_sales_global, just with channel_cd aggregated out.

 

 

As part of the user story, I performed below steps. For each step apart from the last one the results are documented in the attached report file.

 

1. I compared data range between the challenger and benchmark in the stage_feature_engineering_product_level_raw table (sheet: data range FE)

2. I checked if the country level predictions from stage_forecast_ctry_level add up to country level forecasts from stage_forecast_product_level (any bugs in normalization could be seen at this point). (sheets: ctry_lvl and product_lvl)

3. I checked the category level forecasts for a few markets. For Japan there are some major changes in the forecasted category UC but it could be expected and is a result of adding the channel dimension. For other checked markets the changes are minor (<1%)  (sheet: category)

4. I looked at the time series for channels in Japan. Overall, the forecast trends clearly make sense. (sheet: channel_cd JP)

5.1. I compared forecast_monthly_re table to the benchmark. The results are similar and any relatively higher differences (~1%) can also be seen in the stage_forecast_ctry_level table. One exception is Uruguay but here it's the benchmark forecasts that do not add up to the expected ctry level totals. (sheet: forecast_re_monthly)

5.2 I looked at the historical UC values (2023 and the first 7 months of 2024) and compared them to the values from fact sales global. Both values match quite closely. (sheet: UC YD)

6. I briefly looked at the following tables and I didn't notice anything suspicious: 'fact_forecast_driver', 'fact_driver_importance_RE', 'fact_forecast_result_daily_RE'

Script used for schema migrations:

from pyspark.sql.utils import AnalysisException
import pyspark.sql.functions as F

blob_path = "abfss://tfs@sause2tcccfhbdev0001.dfs.core.windows.net/"

stage_folder = f"{blob_path}test/channel_experiment2_benchmark"

challanger_folder = f"{blob_path}test/channel_experiment2"

files = mssparkutils.fs.ls(challanger_folder)

for fl in files:
    try:
        stage = spark.read.format("delta").load(f"{stage_folder}/{fl.name}")
        challanger = spark.read.format("delta").load(f"{challanger_folder}/{fl.name}")
    except AnalysisException:
        print(f"Skipping {fl.name}. It's not a delta table or doesn't exist in the stage folder.")
        continue
    print(f"working on the table: {fl.name}")
    stage_names = [i for i,_ in stage.dtypes]
    challanger_names = [i for i,_ in challanger.dtypes]
    res = list(set(challanger_names) - set(stage_names))
    if len(res) == 0:
        print(f"No columns to add to {fl.name}")
        continue

    res_full = [(i,j) for i,j in challanger.dtypes if i in res]

    for new_col_name, new_col_type in res_full:
        print(f"Adding {new_col_name} column to {fl.name}")
        stage = stage.withColumn(new_col_name, F.lit(None).cast(new_col_type))

    if len(set(stage_names) - set(challanger_names)) == 0:
        print(f"Updating column order in table {fl.name}")
        col_order = challanger_names
        stage = stage.select(col_order)
    elif len(set(stage_names) - set(challanger_names)) == 1 and list(set(stage_names) - set(challanger_names))[0] == 'generated_time':
        col_order = challanger_names + ['generated_time']
        stage = stage.select(col_order)
        print(f"Updating column order in table {fl.name}. Generated_time goes last.")
    else:
        cols_str = ', '.join(list(set(stage_names) - set(challanger_names)))
        print(f"There are columns missing in the {fl.name} challanger table: {cols_str}. Skiping column reordering.")
    print(f"Saving {fl.name} to {stage_folder}/{fl.name}")
    partition_cols = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE DETAIL delta.`{stage_folder}/{fl.name}`").select('partitionColumns').toPandas().loc[0, 'partitionColumns'].tolist()
    if len(partition_cols) == 0:
         stage.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").option("overwriteSchema", "true").save(f"{stage_folder}/{fl.name}")
    else:
        stage.write.format("delta").partitionBy(partition_cols).mode("overwrite").option("overwriteSchema", "true").save(f"{stage_folder}/{fl.name}")

# To assure correctness I used the script below:

def are_dfs_equal(df1, df2):
    if df1.schema != df2.schema:
        return False
    if df1.orderBy(*df1.columns).collect() != df2.orderBy(*df2.columns).collect():
        return False
    return True

main_folder = f"{blob_path}test/channel_experiment2_benchmark"
bk_folder = f"{blob_path}test/channel_experiment2_benchmark_bk/channel_experiment2_benchmark"
tables = ['stage_feature_engineering_category_brand_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_category_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_product_level', 'stage_feature_engineering_product_level_raw', 'stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily', 'stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest', 'stage_run_id_uc_category_brand_daily', 'stage_run_id_uc_category_daily', 'stage_run_id_uc_product_daily']

for table in tables:
    print(f"Checking {table}")
    main = spark.read.format("delta").load(f"{main_folder}/{table}")
    bk = spark.read.format("delta").load(f"{bk_folder}/{table}")

    cols = [i.name for i in main.schema if i.name != 'channel_cd']

    print(f"Equality check: {are_dfs_equal(main.select(cols), bk)}")

    main_pcols = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE DETAIL delta.`{main_folder}/{table}`").select('partitionColumns').toPandas().loc[0, 'partitionColumns'].tolist()
    bk_pcols = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE DETAIL delta.`{bk_folder}/{table}`").select('partitionColumns').toPandas().loc[0, 'partitionColumns'].tolist()
    print(f"Partition cols equal: {set(main_pcols) == set(bk_pcols)}")

title: [Model] Include Channel dimension into the TFS model
description:
Context:
Users goal is to introduce the Channel dimension into the TFS, at least for the top 40 markets

Estimated impact:
ETL changes
  • pipelines
  • table schemas
Model changes
  • feature engineering scripts (both)
  • underlying level forecast scripts and pipelines
    • data hierarchy change: insert the channel into the existing country->category->brand->(bottler-BPP) hierarchy
    • Cascading impact on the training and predicting script
    • new notebook invocation in the forecast pipeline for the new Channel hierarchy
Pending:
  1. External: 
    1. The source data is not yet ready. Global channels are mapped & available in the global data lake but have not yet been signed off for all markets except Japan. Additionally, while Japan is signed off, the view is not yet used by the business. ASP validations in progress, T5 countries by the end of Q4, and other markets by Q1 2024. No validation activity happening in other markets. Need push from Center (Enrique/Luciana) so OUs can action
    2. need the confirmation on which level in the Channel hierarchy to bring into the TFS
  2. Internal: need to decide on which level the channel is to be inserted into the existing data hierarchy
comments:
@Runfeng Han 

Please find attached the results of the latest experiment I run for a few random markets and Japan. In the experiment I ran the current production version on the aggragated version of the test/fact_sales_global table as benchmark.

What suprised me was that the country level predictions for countries other than japan weren't exactly the same. The difference level was very minimal, the highest was 0.14% for France in March 2024, but still unexpected. I looked into the feature_engineering tables as it's the only place where any changes were made that impact country level forecasts but I see very minor differences.

What I suspect may be happening is that prophet model parameters are estimated slightly differently for France due to minor diffreneces in feature engineering tables (that could be due to rounding errors).
Waiting @Runfeng Han final approval

@Runfeng Han 

I've uploaded the updated file as requested (category_benchmark_rerun.xlsx). Overall, the results look better for the benchmark model, the coffee nrtd category being the exception. That being said the results of channel version still aren't worse for most cases which I guess is the most important news.

For coffee nrtd category I looked into the channel version models and I see two reasons why they outperform the benchmark model:

* The drop in the UC values for whole category is caused mainly by two biggest channels: SMDD, online. For these two channels the forecast trends are negative but for the rest of channels the forecasts remain positive.

* The cumulative effect of decreases in SMDD and online channels results in more negative trend for the benchmark model than in any of the corresponding channel models. So the sum of forecasts of these two channels is still higher than the whole category in the benchmark model.

@Runfeng Han 

I've uploaded a file with a comparison. For the comparison I'm using forecasts with slightly different origin:

- channel version is backtesting run as of 2023-12-31. Actual UC values are coming from fact_global_sales table shared by Aparna.

- benchmark version is run on dev on 2023-12-16. Actual UC values are coming from current fact_global_sales from Prod.

 

Overall, apart from a few exceptions the results are better or equal for the channel version. In part it may be due to the different origin of generated forecasts (different generated dates). But still its impact should be minimal. I may conduct an additional test but for now it seems that on category level there's no negative impact on accuracy.

@Jan Leuschner thx for the quick summary. 
Yes, a comparison with the current prod code is needed. We would need to see the impact on the category-level accuracy by adding the channel to TFS (although we know that the accuracy will drop, we still need to know how much the drop will be).
@Runfeng Han I attached an excel file with both channel+category and category only monthly accuracy values. In case it's needed I can prepare a similar evaluation for the current production code.
@Runfeng Han Sure, I'll prepare similar comparison based on category forecasts today.
Hi @Jan Leuschner , could we have the accuracy comparison at the category level as well? Retionale is that we'd like to see the impact of adding channel to the category's forecast results
@Jan Leuschner thanks for the summary on the accuracy. It's okay. We can mark this as the completion of the development and testing.

@Runfeng Han 
I've uploaded the excel file with monthly accuracy assessments. Across all the channels the average monthly mape is 7.61%, but between channels it can vary a lot.

I looked at some months that have particularly bad mape values (for example Online channel and January) but I don't see any specific reason apart from model performance (or unusual drop in the UC value).

I can still look more in depth into these problematic values or experiment to try to find some other way to achieve better accuracy.
@Runfeng Han Sure, I'll run the forecasts as of 31.12.23 and evaluate accuracy on the 1st half of 2024.

@Jan Leuschner thx for the update. 

Additionally, could we have a summary of the accuracy at channel-monthly level, compared with the 1st half of 2024 actual data based on MAPE?

@Runfeng Han The pipeline with channel dimension (no_results version of pipeline) run for Japan only took 2h and 15min. The same pipeline run using current production code and february data took 1h and 11min. The difference is the biggest for training and prediction of product models. 

I'm going to rerun the channel version once again to double check as I expected the difference to be smaller.
Hi @Jan, how long does the forecast run take for Japan with the added local channel, comparing with the existing one without it?

Hi @Jan, Aparna has completed the development of the ETL changes. We could resume the testing using the actual channel data in the fact_sales_global table now. Please check with @Aparna if there's any question.
Note that we will stop using the fact_sales_global_smoothed table, which requires necessary code changes in the feature engineering code.

Hi @Jan, In our existing code, there's still lots of hard-coding related to the existing Hierarchy, including 

  • important methods used in the low-level forecast step, including Det_Aggregated_Data, generate_level_data, normalize_prediction, etc.
  • some schema definitions. e.g.

While the discussion on which channel field to bring into the model is still ongoing, we can start the testing by using a dummy value as a placeholder, so that we can test all the following steps. I've asked Aparna to prepare a test table for you

POC will be done for 3OUs: ASP, Europe, EME

Talked with FP&A on the topic of which level the channel is to be inserted into the existing data hierarchy, and their answer (at least for now) is to put it between country and category:

title: [Release 2] Add channel flag in dim_country and update NSR Datalake ETL logic
description:
TFS Release 2 ask (November go-LIVE) is to produce channel-level forecast only for Japan. However, certain changes will be implemented as part of this user story to ensure that in future, any new bottlers can be quickly configured to enable channel forecast as well as correctly process manual excel templates  (case rates / master data / bottler RE / PY Actual / BP).

I. Configuring channel enablement at country-level
  1. New column "channel_enabled" will be introduced in dim_country. Possible values are "Y" and "N". 
    1. Default value is N for all countries except JP.  The flag will be set to Y for JP.
    • "Y" - UC and case rate (in baseline forecast table) will be at channel-level regardless of source i.e from NSR datalake as well as from  manual templates for NSR, PY.  Similarly the data in Master Data, BP, Bottler RE will come in with proper channel codes vs "NA" 
    • "N" - UC and case rate (in baseline forecast table) will be at country-bottler level regardless of source i.e from NSR datalake as well as from  manual templates for NSR, PY.  Data for Master Data, BP, Bottler RE will be at country-bottler level. Where bottler is configured for excel ingestion, OUs are expected to submit "NA" channel_cd in template.
  2. Since the field will be infrequently updated, its updates will be done manually by the dev team. Business request will be the trigger for such an update.

II. Modify ETL logic for Datalake UC, NSR ingestion
  1. At the point where Trade Channel is read from global NSR ADLS, introduce a check for dim_country [channel_enabled] value:
    1. If channel_enabled = 'Y' then read  global NSR ADLS' Trade Channel value into existing channel_cd field in fact_sales_global_actual, else
    2. If channel_enabled = 'N' then insert Trade Channel value as "NA" into existing channel_cd field in fact_sales_global_actual
  2. Once the channel_cd is updated in fact_sales_global, convert to local channel  (this is existing functionality and should not be modified as part of this user story)
comments:
CSV to update channel_enabled flag will be picked up from landing/manual_submission/channel_status/channel_status.csv

It will have the following schema, and currently hold only JP information
ctry_nm ctry_cd channel_enabled
Japan JP Y
