title: [Adhoc investigation][Model] Unexpected forecasted volume drop in PH
description:
Context:
OU user spotted an unexpected forecast volume drop in the 2nd half of 2024 in the Aug RE run generated on 15th July, comparing with the July RE run.

Known:
  1. Negligible changes in the historical volume. Checked the data in /stage/stage_forecast_result_uc_country_daily/, and the trend-only forecast result changes are very small. The major impact comes from the residual model
  2. Negligible changes in the forecasted weather data. Some changes in the recent historical weather data.
  3. little changes in the macroeconomics data
To do:
Investigate why the residual model behaves so differently compared with the July RE run
comments:
For the reference I attach the code used to investigate the parameters and features used for trained models:
from next_gen_forecast.utility import utility as util
import pickle
path = "test/ph_inv_202407/models/residual_model/"
model_hash = 'ea4837b985f649f0906c7577317b7c0c' # can be found in stage_run_id_uc_country_daily
mld1 = util.import_model(blob_path,"", f'tfs/{path+model_hash}')
mld1 = pickle.loads(bytes(mld1, 'latin1'))
print(f"Features used: {mld1.regressor.steps[0][1].steps[0][1].trn_cols}\n Parameters used: Alpha: {mld1.regressor[1].alpha}, gamma: {mld1.regressor[1].gamma}")

The Main findings:
  • hyperparameter tunning on longer periods (up to 365 days of training data and 180 of test) indeed seem to be more stable across runs but not quite to the extent I was hoping for. 
  • In general changed residual models seem to drive the forecasts up, further away from trend only values, but in a stable across runs manner.
  • Still the hyperparameters chosen for July seem to be more regularized than those in June. It may be caused by trend model making better predictions in July. To explain that I'd have to further investigate.

Generally, sometimes very different parameters combinations yield very similar accuracy scores. Using larger train/test splits during optimization makes it more stable but the score results are still pretty similar so the stability is not guaranteed.

I was testing how many days of train/test sets to use during the optimization but I don't see major differences, neither in time needed to complete nor in stability. So on the base of Philippines I'd recommend increasing the train/test sets size, it's not guaranteed to completely solve the problem but it definitely makes it less likely to occur plus it doesn't seem to bring any drawbacks.

A thing that I'd still recommend doing is conducting the tests on more markets, unless we want to implement some per market values. This type of testing could be time consuming I'd suggest running all markets from at least 3 different dates.

Hi @Runfeng Han , below I provide a short summary of todays findings releted to Philippines:

 

Generally, I see that it's the behavior of June run forecasts than is stranger rather than the July one. By stranger I mean deviating more from trend only forecasts.

I looked at the two models and I see that they both use slightly different features and different hyperparameters (as both are chosen during the optimization process). After investigating I learnt that it's the hyperparameters that are causing the big difference. When I use June data and trend forecasts but with July hyperparameters I observe results that are very similar to trend only values (and hence very similar to July values).

Upon looking on exact hyperparameters values the difference make sense, the July model is strongly regularized one and the June is regularized very weakly.

There are multiple reasons why hyperparameters choice may be so different:

- hyperparameters are chosen on random subset of data

- random subset of hyperparameters is considered in every experiment (quite a lot of experiments though - 750).

Overall, I want to look further into the process cause I'd expect the hyperparameters choice to be more stable. My first guess is experimenting with train/test set values for time series cross validation used in optimization study. If it results in a long time needed to complete the study, I may need to reduce the number of experiments. So still some experimentation is needed to tune it but that could be a relatively easy fix.

-- SQL for checking external driver data
with fact as (
    SELECT
     [Date]
    ,[avg_temp]
    ,[max_temp]
    ,[min_temp]
    ,[precipitation]
    ,[CPI_growth]
    ,[Nom_GDP_growth]
    ,[RPC_growth]
    ,version
    FROM  [dbo].[fact_forecast_driver]
    where version in ('202425','202429')
    and ctry_cd = 'VN'
    and Date >= '2024-07-01'
),
fact_prev as (
    select [Date]

    ,[avg_temp]
    ,[max_temp]
    ,[precipitation] from fact where version = '202425'
),
fact_curr as (
    select [Date]

    ,[avg_temp]
    ,[max_temp]
    ,[precipitation] from fact where version = '202429'
)
select
    a.Date as Date,
    a.avg_temp as avg_temp_202425,
    b.avg_temp as avg_temp_202429,
    a.max_temp as max_temp_202425,
    b.max_temp as max_temp_202429,
    a.precipitation as precipitation_202425,
    b.precipitation as precipitation_202429
from fact_prev a
left join fact_curr b
on a.Date = b.Date
order by Date

-- SQL for checking trend-only forecast vs final forecast 
with fact as (
    SELECT
     c445_month_cd as month, proj_end_date, sum(uc_total_pred) as uc, sum(uc_total_trend_pred) as uc_trend_only
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK 'https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/stage/stage_forecast_result_uc_country_daily/',
            FORMAT = 'DELTA'
        ) AS [result]
    where proj_end_date in ('2025-12-31','2026-01-31')
    and ctry_nm = 'Philippines'
    and c445_month_cd <= '202412'
    group by c445_month_cd, proj_end_date
),
fact_prev as (
    select month, uc, uc_trend_only from fact where proj_end_date = '2025-12-31'
),
fact_curr as (
    select month, uc, uc_trend_only from fact where proj_end_date = '2026-01-31'
)
select
    a.month as month,
    a.uc as uc_202425,
    b.uc as uc_202429,
    a.uc_trend_only as uc_trend_only_202425,
    b.uc_trend_only as uc_trend_only_202429,
    b.uc/a.uc-1 diff_ratio_uc,
    b.uc_trend_only/a.uc_trend_only-1 diff_ratio_uc_trend_only
from fact_prev a
left join fact_curr b
on a.month = b.month
order by month

-- SQL for checking forecast volume
with fact as (
    SELECT
     c445_month_cd as month, version, sum(uc) as uc
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK 'https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/serverless table/fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE/',
            FORMAT = 'DELTA'
        ) AS [result]
    where version in ('202425','202429')
    and ctry_cd = 'PH'
    and c445_month_cd <= '202412'
    group by c445_month_cd, version
),
fact_prev as (
    select month, uc from fact where version = '202425'
),
fact_curr as (
    select month, uc from fact where version = '202429'
)
select
    a.month as month,
    a.uc as uc_202425,
    b.uc as uc_202429,
    b.uc/a.uc-1 diff_ratio
from fact_prev a
left join fact_curr b
on a.month = b.month
order by month

-- SQL for checking historical volume
with fact as (
    SELECT
     month, version, uc
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK 'https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/archive/fact_sales_global_weekly_archive/',
            FORMAT = 'DELTA'
        ) AS [result]
    where version in ('202425','202429')
    and ctry_cd = 'PH'
    and year >2018
),
fact_prev as (
    select month, uc from fact where version = '202425'
),
fact_curr as (
    select month, uc from fact where version = '202429'
)
select
    a.month as month,
    a.uc as uc_202425,
    b.uc as uc_202429,
    b.uc/a.uc-1 diff_ratio
from fact_prev a
left join fact_curr b
on a.month = b.month

title: [Model] Investigation of records with 0 forecasted volume in July Yemen
description:
Context

Isabelle Schoepp: EMEOU - YE - 80348 -> baseline empty in July.

posted in Topline Forecast System V 2.0 / 2. IT Business Analytics - Azure SQL on Wednesday, May 7, 2025 12:03 AM

Examples: bev_prod_cd ('A8A6051927', 'A8A6052085', 'A8A6052399', 'A8A6052845') for Yemen... These products have UC_Pred = 0 for only c445_month_cd = 202507.

Findings so far

  1. Yemen is part of data patch part 1 (adjusted base on ratio provided by DS Team)
  2. Yemen is not part of data patch part 2
  3. Looking through the backup tables we have before patching ... this UC_Pred = 0 does not seem to be introduced by our patches. And could be from the model itself
    1. https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/backup/17042025_backup/fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE
    2. https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/stage/stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily/ctry_nm=Yemen/**
      1. This table has not been patched. We patched stage_forecast_result_uc_product_daily_latest

title: [Forecast Quality] Over-forecast in version 202446
description:
Context:
Related to #232628 . The original forecast can be found in temp/fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE/ in PROD ADLS 
We are seeing the Nov and Dec 2024 volumes in the latest 202446 baseline are too high compared with the PY and the forecasts in the past 2 months. 

If we look at the YTG growth vs. YTD growth , in most of the Top 40 countries, YTG months forecast is way higher than YTD growth trend. 

Turkey for example, in the latest baseline version, UC is way higher than previous 2 baselines. With Dec month doubled.

Lots of the countries are having a higher Dec month forecast comparing to previous 2 bassline. Highlighted items are all Top40 countries, where observes a higher Dec forecast than previous baselines



Analysis:

There is no major historical patch between the two versions in the historical data before Oct 2024. However, the high actual volume in Oct 2024 could be the cause for the higher YTG result, since the ML model adjust the trend slope as the result of the increased Oct volume


To do:
  1. Investigate on the cause of the dramatic increase of the forecasted volume in Nov and Dec in version 202446. Let's look at these countries: ["China","Mexico","Brazil","Japan" ,"Turkiye"]
  2. try to find potential solution to mitigate the increase
comments: Email has been sent to Global Cube team:

Root cause is due to some of the rows columns c445_1py_day_dt, c445_2py_day_dt in 2020 and 2021 are empty in dim_calendar. 

so this join failed during the feature generation step 

that's why we are seeing the volume in 2020-2021 training data drops almost half

Quick fix: switch back to the old fact_calendar_forecast. We will only do it for the ML pipeline as dim_calendar is used by lots of ETL jobs as well

@Runfeng Han 

I've attached report comparing 202446 vs 202442 versions from PROD and 202446 from DEV.
I prepared separate tabs: 
  • only for selected countries: "Mexico", "Brazil", "Japan" , "Turkiye" 
  • all the countries, but it's a bit messy as largest differences are caused by small always unstable countries
Report contains only trend preds, because this was causing the main problem

In general the run on DEV 202446 looks good. There are some differences in respect to the baseline PROD run 202442, but it's normal as its simulated date is 4 weeks later. The differences are much lower than in case od PROD run 202446 and I would say they are on acceptable level.

The data after features generation step also looks fine after swiching to fact_calednar_forecast.

title: [Forecast Quality] Large fluctuation between Mar RE and June RE forecast
description:
Context:
During the meeting with FP&A, the user asked about the reason behind the large fluctuation between Mar RE and June RE forecast for some of the LATAM countries between Mar RE (conducted in Feb) and June RE forecast (conducted in May).

Possible direction: it could be related to the hyperparam tuning, which makes the prophet model more sensitive to the recent trend changes of the new actual data.

List of countries we applied the hyperparam tuning:
Argentina
Peru
Ecuador
Chile
South Africa
Algeria
Morocco
Kenya
India
China
Philippines
Germany
Spain
Kazakhstan
Mexico
Brazil

Need to look into the Latam countries
comments: @Jan Leuschner Just got the confirmation. Let's implement the changes to the PROD
@Jan Leuschner I'll get the final confirmation before we proceed with the actions
@Runfeng Han Sure, will you still confirm that the changes should be made? Or should I already plan it sometime soon?

@Jan Leuschner thanks for the detailed testing results. 

I think we can close this user story by concluding the action needed in the future:
  1. use default hyperparam for Ecuador and Peru by either updating or delete their records in the stage/best_hyper_params_uc_country/
  2. stop using the residual model for Uruguay. This can by done by adding the country to the additional_data_variables.py
    COUNTRY_LIST_TREND_BASED_FORECAST

@Runfeng Han 

For Uruguay case I’ve conducted an analysis and it seems that it's indeed the outliers in 2019/2020 that cause such high variation to be introduced by the residual model. I attach the results generated using the full data set and data from July 2020 onwards (no outliers) in the file: uruguay.xlsx.

Two relevant things can be seen in the results: the impact of filtered dates on trend model is marginal and the impact on residual model is very significant. Overall, removing the outliers made the final prediction to be aligned with the trend model predictions and the scale of residual model impact was significantly reduced.

Based on this analysis, however, I can't conclude why these outliers cause problems only now and not for example in the previous months. Let me know if I should continue working on finding the answer to that question. It may, however, take longer time as it's quite complex to get this kind of answers from residual models.

To potentially reduce the impact of these outliers I see possible steps:

- Verify with the users if these outliers in Uruguay should be in the data.
- Turn off the residual models for Peru.
- Filter out data from before (roughly) 07-2020 for Uruguay.


For Peru I've conducted a set of experiments using default parameters, current production ones and the ones found through tunning procedure (using three different snapshot dates: 11-23, 12-23 and 01-24).


I've also tested manually chosen sets of hyperparameters with various degrees of flexibility. Generally, they influence the model behavior quite linearly, so the results ended up somewhere on the spectrum with default parameters and current production ones being roughly the two extremes.

To summarize the results, more flexible parameters result in the greatest changes and more negative trend (apparently present in the recent months). More strict parameters keep the trend positively stable without any changes. Interestingly, in the analyzed period (last 6 up to 7 months) in formal tunning it's the stricter (default) parameters that yield more accurate forecasts.

I think, given the results, it makes sense to update the parameters to default not only for Ecuador but also for Peru.
;
The complete results are attached in the file: peru_tunning.xlsx

@Runfeng Han 

As requested, I've also looked at differences between May and June runs. I’ve uploaded plots and an excel file with the reference data (latam_investigation_05_vs_06).


For the biggest markets such as Mexico, Brazil, Colombia the observed changes aren't unusual (sheets: Half-year/monthly vs historical LATAM changes) and seems as regular model adjustments.

Two markets - Argentina and Chile stand out here, for them the recent changes are quite significant in comparison to the changes observed historically. I've analyzed the causes and described the findings below:

Argentina - Model decides to use a new changepoint (in 2022) fitting current trend as less positive. The trend parameter value decreased (Although stayed positive) resulting in lower forecast values.

Chile - Similar situation as in Argentina. New changepoint (in 2023) and decreased trend parameter value.


I've also looked deeper into some of the smaller markets with high variability: Uruguay, Peru, Venezuela. I present the findings below:

Peru - Change in the recent trend caught by the model resulting in relevant change in the estimated trend parameter. Here it seems to be caused by hyperparameters that allow the model to fit more closely to more recent trend changes. Default hyperparams version of the Peru models is stable across time with unchanged trend.

Uruguay - This is a strange case. The real reason behind the changes is residual model not the prophet one (sheet: Uruguay). Looking at the data (Uruguay data plot), there are a few outliers in 2019 and 2020. I can see how these outlying numbers can result in strange predictions by residual models. However, these were there last month so right now it's unclear why residual model is behaving strangely. As for now it seems that some of the forecasts for Uruguay may be very different than created by trend model.

Venezuela - The same thing as described in comparison between February and May. The trend in the data has changed around 2023 and the model continues to adjust the trend to more positive.

 

I think tomorrow I'll still have to investigate Uruguay case; the residual models are harder to debug and understand. I'll provide an update once I find something.

@Runfeng Han I've a taken a look at all the markets with relative difference between Feb and May runs above 5%. Below I shortly described the findings. Overall, I didn't find any issues, rather natural model adjustments.

1. Haiti - New changepoints used by the model. Overally, more negative trend in the period between January and May.
2. Guyana - New changepoints used by the model. Overally, more positive trend in the period between January and May. Minor changes to the January data.
3. Suriname - Trend adjustments due to higher UC values  in the period between January and May than anticipated. Minor changes to the January data.
4. Dominica - New changepoint was chosen by the model even though lately the trend didn't seem to change. Less stable data (due to the size probably) may explain this behavior.
5. French Guiana - Minor trend adjustments due to the higher UC values in the period between January and May.
@Jan Leuschner Thanks Jan, that's quite insightful. Let's continue the testing on Peru.

@Runfeng Han 
I've run a few experiments and confirmed that for Peru and Ecuador indeed the root cause for variability are hyperparameters. I've checked several different parameters sets and in general setting them to default or less flexible values reduce differences between February and may data.

There are several options how to approach this situation:
- run a new hyperparameters tuning for these two countries. As you propose, but that, however, doesn't guarantee that the forecasts become more stable as the hyperparams are chosen based on the accuracy of the first half a year forecasts from the prediction date. 
- Manually choose less flexible parameters - it'd require some testing but it'll definitely reduce the variability. I've already experimented with some combinations but chosen values would be arbitrary too some degree so accuracy may be not be maximized.
- Use default parameters - that may be the solution for Ecuador, results for this country have come up as unstable in the previous analysis as well. It seems that this market requires less flexible approach and hyperparameters simply overfit to the latest trend. For Peru it may be worthwhile to experiment with the two other options.


I've also looked at Venezuela. In the case of this market the trend in the data has changed around 2023 and at some date between February and January the model has decided to use a new trend changepoint. That explains the changes in forecast values.

@Jan Leuschner Thanks for the investigation.

Based on your excel file, it is good news that the main markets Mexico and Brazil are good. But I also notice that Brazil is using daily-default and Mexico is using daily-optuna with a small value of changepoint_prior_scale. Probably that's the reason why they are still stable.

Let's look into Venezuela, Peru and Ecuador as the next step. Specially Peru and Ecuador since they are currently using weekly-optuna. And the changepoint_prior_scale is set to be quite sensitive. Probably we need to run the hyperparam tuning process for them. 
"no_param" change is quite small

When we have time later, let's look into the smaller markets. I think they are fluctuating mostly because of the unstable historical data

@Runfeng Han 
I've confirmed that even though counter intuitive the results are correct. Although the rerun on dev does indeed yield a little different results than in production (which is very strange but I suspect the randomness to come from combination of spark non-determinism and sensitivity of prophet learning algorithm) but it happens only for two LATAM markets and the differences are very small.

I've also analysed more in-depth the three markets with the biggest absolute changes in UC between February and May runs: Argentina, Mexico and Brazil. I provide the findings below and I also attach plots produced during the analysis, these are very raw so if a more readable plot is needed please let me know.

Argentina - Decreased fitted trend coefficient due to lower than expected (or lower than historical values) UC values for Q1/Q2 2024. Results in lower predictions for 2024/2025 than created in February.

Brazil - Very little change percentage wise  (~0.6%) that is still noticeable from whole LATAM perspective as Brazil is a large market relatively. No relevant change in the model parameters. The change should probably be considered normal adjustment, at least from the model perspective.

Mexico - Increased fitted trend coefficient due to higher than expected UC values for Q1/Q2 2024. The trend is also a little more flexible due to hyperparameters but it doesn't seem to be the main reason. Results in higher predictions for 2024/2025 than created in February.

I think I should also have a look at the markets that have the biggest percentage changes: Venezuela, Peru and Ecuador. I'll provide similar description tomorrow.

If you want me to I could also have look at some of the smaller market that also have high relative variability: Haiti, Guyana and Suriname. But please let me know if it makes sense to concentrate on such small markets.

@Runfeng Han 
It seems that the reason behind the variability are not more flexible hyperparameters. When comparing changes of forecast values between february and may, it turns out that for most cases the changes are bigger (or equal) for forecasts generated with a model that is using default and not the tuned parameters. Please refer to the sheet details in the attached excel file. 

That finding is counter intuitive so I'll additionally regenerate the production parameters forecasts on dev just to double check that I'm not missing anything in the environment setup.

If that's the case I can look in depth into some countries that are responsible for the biggest (absolute) changes that is: Argentina, Mexico, Peru and Brazil. I've also had a look on the distribution of changes between runs in the past (sheet: historical LATAM countires) and maybe apart from Ecuador I don't see unusually big changes happening from february to may. However, smaller changes in the same direction across runs (as it's the case for Mexico or Argentina) may have similar effect looking only at the quarterly values.

title: [Forecast Quality] Test: tune the hyperparam for Philippines with recent data
description:
Context:
Related to #221681 and #228606 

User has complained about the under-estimation of the volume in the recent forecast cycles. The actual YTD volume is +9% but forecast is -1% YTG, with no change in driver data. Details can be found in the attached email from the user.

We've investigated the residual model in #228606. 

Now we need to see if re-tune the hyperparam of the Prophet model with the latest volume data can improve the forecast quality (current hyperparam was tuned at the end of last year).

To do:
In DEV, 
  1. generate the country-level forecast for PH using the default hyperparam
  2. re-tune the hyperparam of the Prophet model with the latest volume data (use the recent 5-month data for validation). Then generate the country-level forecast for PH using the new hyperparam
  3. compare the above 2 forecast volume against the recent 3 versions of the forecast result in the PROD (version 202425, 202429, 202433) to see if the default/new hyperparam will have better result
comments: @Runfeng Han As agreed I'm closing this user story. If any further questions arise please let me know.

@Runfeng Han 

I've further analyzed the data and I see very similar situation as in previous analysis for the Philippines that is it's the residual models that are responsible in largest part for the month-to-month variability. To illustrate that I attach the trend only forecasts generated using the same models. We can see a much-decreased variability between June, July and august runs.

 

The other issue is the underforcasting, or in other words not catching 2024 positive trend (seen in the attached plot but also maybe more readable in the attached email chain). It's not surprising as currently changepoint_range parameter is set to 85% which means that the trend can change only up to November 2023.

 

It seems that hyperparameters tunning doesn't help, but it is not surprising as the hyperparameters value choice is not affected by the freshest data by design (only hyperparams variant is). 

 

I suspected that manually setting changepoint_range parameter to a value higher than 90 could help but it's not the case. Only increasing both changepoint_range and the model inclination to change trend by increasing changepoint_prior_scale does the job. Such combination, however, wouldn't help with stability for sure.


I'm going to look even deeper into the trend models to try to understand the issue better.

@Runfeng Han 

I've run the tunning process with the most recent data. Overall, the most important change from the current production version is using daily instead of weekly data granularity. The chosen parameters are pretty similar to the default ones only with changepoint_range parameter (% of time series length during which a changepoint can occur) increased from 80% to 90%.

 

I've compared country level forecasts from three month on production: 2024-06, 2024-07 and 2024-08 with default and tunned parameters model versions trained as of 2024-08.

 

Overall, both default and tunned are very similar to each other and overall forecasts values for 2024 are higher than those coming from 2024-08 and 2024-07 production runs.

 

I'll dig deeper into the data and trends tomorrow but if you already see something that you consider worth checking, please let me know.

title: [ETL] Global NSR ADLS v2 impact & changes in ETL
description:
Context:

Changes communicated by Kiril from NSR team are below. These need to be assessed and subsequent tasks / user stories for TFS ETL changes should be created.


Please follow this link with the Data model which is currently in DEV: https://dev.azure.com/GlobalEngg/Self%20Service%20%20Data%20Platform%20(SSDP)/_wiki/wikis/Enterprise-Data-Strategy-Foundation.wiki/4334/NSR-Global-Cube?anchor=actuals-dimensional-model

 

All the table paths have been changed and the format is changed from Parquet to Delta:

  • from https://{storage}.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse
  • to https://{storage}.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse/nsrproduct/GLOBAL

 

 

Data Model Changes:

  • Historical + Delta folders combined in ACT table. In the future there will be no need to query multiple directories for Historical + Delta loads, since all the data is collocated in “ACT” table.
  • Bottler Net Sales Revenue is precalculated with the local specifics. In the future it can be queried from Gold Zone as is without further calculations.
  • All files/feeds forming a dimension have been combined and joined before materializing in the Gold Zone. In the past, this transformation process was done in SQL Serverless using multiple views, forcing consumers to replicate this process in their applications. For example, Ship From consists of – OU local attributes, ISSCOM attributes, GCS Bottler Location Codes, Reg Hier. In the new Gold Zone model, all of these are combined and then loaded into the “ShipFrom” delta table.

 


The data model is already available in our DEV environment (https://salrsuse2tcccbdpdev0001.dfs.core.windows.net/) and can be queried.

 

Official doc will be published to Wiki once we move to UAT.

To do:

  1. Investigate the data model changes on the Global NSR Cube ADLS side
  2. Create a new ETL pipeline to read from the new delta tables, transform and load to the TFS fact and dim tables in the /refined directory
comments:

title: [Processing] Bottler-level config table
description:
FP&A side will manually submit a config file specifying the bottler-level info, including:
  1. data_src_nsr- used to indicate whether sNSR forecast should use data from NSR Global Cube or from manual excel file. Possible values could be "global cube" and "excel", but validation rules till be built later on.
  2. currency_cd - 3-letter currency code to be used in USD and Currency Neutral calculations later e.g. "SGD", "USD"
  3. vol_nsr_granularity - applicable only for bottlers with excel data source. Indicates if bottler is sending NSR and Volume data at Category or BP or Brand or BPP level. Possible values: "Beverage_Category","Brand","BP","BPP"
  4. master_data_granularity - for bottlers' manual submitted measure including Effective Incidence Rate, Billing Rate, Yield, etc. at Category or BP or Brand or BPP level. Possible values: "Beverage_Category","Brand","BP","BPP"
  5. data_src_bp​ valid values are "excel" and "SET". Store as all lower case for "excel" to be consistent with data_src_nsr naming standard.  "SET" should be stored as all upper case as it is the acronym for System Economics Tool.
  6. bottler_cd_set_hyperion​ e.g. 9000701
We will left join dim_bottler table with the config file, and store the result in a new table "dim_bottler_config". It will be referred to in the Case Rate calculation&allcoation and the Master data allocation

dim_bottler_config will be exposed as a view in Refined zone in all 3 environments
comments: Hi @Aparna Kanjarla I have verified the changes in UAT. Please add this to deployment checklist and close the story. Thanks!
Hi @Aparna Kanjarla  this is good to go to UAT.  @Runfeng Han  has created another story in Sprint 13 to further modify bottler config schema.

@Aparna Kanjarla   please see changes required to bottler config table, highlighted in yellow in user story description.

FYI  @Runfeng Han
Hi @Runfeng Han  and @Aparna Kanjarla updated the expected values for column #3 and 4, based on naming convention aligned with FP&A.

It is still better to leave the current dim_bottler intact and create a separate bottler-level config table. 

The config table would be the result of the current dim_bottler left-joining with the manual-submitted config file. And we need a validation process when ingesting the manual file, checking if the bottlers in the manual file can be found in the dim_bottler. So if we replace the dim_bottler with the bottler-level config table, the same table will be the reference table for the validation and the target table of the ingestion process at the same time

This config table will define the bottler's information on:

Case rate and sNSR related:
  • source of the sNSR data: Global Cube vs. manual submission
  • If it is manual submission, granularity of the sNSR data: category/brand/BP/BPP. The granularity info will be used by
    1. case rate calculation process #216486 
    2. YTD actual sNSR in the baseline table [fact_forecast_result_product_monthly_RE] #216663 
Potentially: granularity of the Incidence Rate, Bill Rate and other figures submitted in manual file #216189

@Runfeng Han  created simple story to add some config parameters in existing bottler dimension table. Please add on any other column/parameter which could be relevant at this stage. Hope we can manage within existing dim table vs creating a new one.

Let's start sprint planning in tomorrow's weekly TFS call and assign to Aparna?


This table will require to be updated occasionally, whenever a new bottler is set up in the company or the configuration for existing bottler changes.
Hence an ETL pipeline is required to perform inserts / updates / deletions on dbo.dim_bottler table. I'll add separate user story for new pipeline.

title: [ETL][CR to PROD] Build Logic App flow to move blueprint (bottler config) excel file from Sharepoint to ADLS landing
description:
Context:
FP&A is submitting blueprint file quite frequently, while they used to think the upload would be only 1 or 2 time a year. 
To save ourselves from the manual work, let's build the automatic pickup mechanism
Logic App changes
  1. A new Logic App workflow "la-tccc-tfs-<env>-bottler-config-excel-ingestion" needs to be developed to drop bottler config excel file from Sharepoint to Landing zone, and trigger  Bottler_Config_Ingestion pipeline. Where env is dev/uat/prod.
  2. LA flow will run every 1 hour on production.

  3. Source location for logic app is TFS -> Manual Data Upload -> Blueprint ->  Input folder on this path for each of the 9 OUs. 
  4. Drop location for Logic App is tfs/landing/manual_submission/dim_bottler_config/

  5. When searching in sharepoint source folder, LA will pick up files with "blueprint" string in file name. Files will be picked up based on the order (time) in which they were placed on sharepoint folder. Older file to be picked up first. 
    1. If file name is missing "blueprint", do not drop file to landing. Instead, notify user to submit expected file name and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder. Use below email template.

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/Blueprint/Input

      The file was not processed due to missing "blueprint" in file name . Please amend file name and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>


  6. Checks to be performed by LA:
    1. Is file format .xlsx? If not, do not drop the file on landing. Instead, notify user to submit blueprint in .xlsx format and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder. Use below email template:

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/Blueprint/Input

      The file was not processed due to invalid format. Valid file format is .xlsx . Please amend and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

  7. File name will be renamed as <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx before dropping it on ADLS. Where submitter email is taken from sharepoint, and timestamp is when the file was uploaded on sharepoint by user.
  8. Following email notification will be sent to submitter once file is picked up from sharepoint Input folder:
    Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

    You have uploaded
    File: <original filename>
    Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/Blueprint/Input

    The file has been moved as:
    Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx
    Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

    The file will be processed in TFS, and you will receive another notification once valid data becomes available in Blueprint table.
  9. Logic app flow should move the file to Archive 
  10. Pipeline Bottler_Config_Ingestion will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up the newly submitted files from tfs/landing/manual submission/dim_bottler_config/ for processing.
comments: Hi @Aliaksei Milto , please note that we need to automate the ingestion process in the same pattern as the other manual files. I've added point 10 in the Description section

title: [Processing] dim_bottler_config: Additional fields to be added

Context:
New request from the FP&A during the workshop. The following additional info is needed in the dim_bottler_config table:
  • OU, FO, Country code, country name, bottler code, bottler name. OU and FO can be extracted from dbo.PMR_DM_PROFITCENTER in finhub_serverless db
  • Currency code
  • Granularity and source for BP/Bottler_RE/PY: these are the new manual datasets going to be ingested 
  • Bottler_code_SET

To do:
We need to add several new fields to the dim_bottler_config table. The new fields are as following: 
  1. OU: get from the dbo.PMR_DM_PROFITCENTER
  2. FO: get from the dbo.PMR_DM_PROFITCENTER
  3. ctry_nm: get from TFS dim_country
  4. bottler_nm: get from TFS dim_bottler
  5. bottling_partner
  6. data_src_bottler_re 
  7. granularity_re - for manual submitted RE data. Possible values: "Beverage_Category","Brand","BP","BPP"
  8. data_src_py 
  9. granularity_py - for manual submitted PY data. Possible values: "Beverage_Category","Brand","BP","BPP"
  10. data_src_bp
  11. granularity_bp - for manual submitted BP data. Possible values: "Beverage_Category","Brand","BP","BPP"
  12. T40_market_flag: default value to be 'N'
  13. email_SDL: will be used by the notification. Note: this column can have multiple values delimited by semicolon.  eg.  abc@coca-cola.com;xyz@coca-cola.com.  Any leading or trailing spaces before/after ; should be trimmed.
  14. email_others: will be used by the notification.  Note: this column can have multiple values delimited by semicolon.  eg.  abc@coca-cola.com;xyz@coca-cola.com.   Any leading or trailing spaces before/after ; should be trimmed.
Note: fields in green can be get by joining with the existing delta tables. Fields in yellow are from the manual file "blueprint".

title: [ETL][CR to PROD] Adjustments to the data validation rule of bottler config file ingestion
description:
Context:

The "Forzen Brothers" bottler code changed 2 times in the past 2 months in the EU countries. For example, in LT:

 

Take the LT "Forzen Brothers" as an example. FP&A needs to allow all 3 entries with different bottler codes for the same bottler "Forzen Brothers" to exist in the Blueprint. Doing so will make sure that the historical versions in the baseline table can find the matched bottler entries for the bottler "Forzen Brothers". 

However, the current validation rule will reject such entries as the obsolete bottler codes "80502_LT" and "80523" does not exist in the Global NSR currently.

Current rule:


To do:

We need to adjust the validation rule for the [ctry_cd, bottler_cd] fields in the bottler config file:

  • We will NOT reject the entry if the [ctry_cd, bottler_cd] combination is not found in the Global NSR datalake, but generate a warning message instead.
    • warning msg: "Warning: "country code - bottler code combination not found in the latest data from NSR Datalake.""

title: Test in sandbox
description:
Adjustment file


Let's review the data for Poland, which should be impacted by the patch.
  • 202504: This is a month within the YTD period. As we can see, the UC_Pred values remain unchanged, since the patch only affects YTG months.
  • 202505: This is the first month of the YTG period for the current year. The reason the UC_Pred value after the patch is less than 214.5 * 0.5 is due to the redistribution of weight in favor of the final YTG CY month (202512) during the second step of the patching process.
  • 202506: This is a standard YTG month. In this case, the adjustment factor is directly applied to the UC_Pred, resulting in a value that is exactly half of the original.
  • 202512: This is the final month of the YTG period for the current year. The UC_Pred value after the patch exceeds 550.3 * 0.5 because in the second step of the patching process weight is redistributed in favor of this final YTG month.

title: Remove products with 0 or negative current FY's total volume from RE result table
description:
2 different cases:
  1. No forecast is generated (all historical entries are 0 or negative, and the model will not generate forecasts for the product). This results in the YTD records being 0 or negative and no records for YTG
  2. The product is classified as DISCONTINUED and the model assigns 0 for all future dates. This results in the YTD records being 0 or negative and records for YTG being 0

To do:
Remove all such products

title: Re-evaluate total NSR after the patch
description:
Hi @Runfeng Han
As part of the evaluation after the data patching, I reprocessed the dim_case_rate table in PROD and compared the total NSR value for 2024 Korea from fact_sales_global with the NSR value calculated for each product as case_rate * UC, then aggregated. I've attached the query used for this analysis below. The discrepancy in NSR has significantly decreased. Please let me know if you consider this an acceptable result or would like me to do any other evaluations.

nsr_source - aggregated original NSR values
nsr_calculated - aggregated NSR values produced from case_rate and UC
delta - a difference between two metrics above
delta_relative - a relative discrepancy compared to nsr_source
comments:
WITH
sales_monthly AS (
    SELECT
        bottler_cd, 
        c445_month_cd, 
        bpp_cd,
        sum(uc) as uc_total,
        sum(nsr_lc) as nsr_lc_total
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK 'https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/refined/fact_sales_global/',
            FORMAT = 'DELTA'
        ) AS [result]
    WHERE
        ctry_cd = 'KR' 
        and c445_month_cd like '2024%'
    GROUP BY
        bottler_cd, c445_month_cd, bpp_cd
),
case_rate AS (
    SELECT
        bottler_cd, 
        c445_month_cd, 
        bpp_cd,
        case_rate
    FROM
        OPENROWSET(
            BULK 'https://sause2tcccfhbprod0003.dfs.core.windows.net/tfs/refined/dim_case_rate/',
            FORMAT = 'DELTA'
        ) AS [result]
    WHERE
        ctry_cd = 'KR' 
        and c445_month_cd like '2024%'
)
SELECT
    sum(nsr_lc_total) AS nsr_source,
    sum(case_rate * uc_total) AS nsr_calculated,
    sum(case_rate * uc_total) - sum(nsr_lc_total) as delta,
    (sum(case_rate * uc_total) - sum(nsr_lc_total)) / sum(nsr_lc_total) as delta_relative
FROM
    sales_monthly JOIN case_rate ON (
        sales_monthly.bottler_cd = case_rate.bottler_cd 
        and sales_monthly.c445_month_cd = case_rate.c445_month_cd 
        and sales_monthly.bpp_cd = case_rate.bpp_cd
    )

title: [ETL] Replace the value of c445_week_cd in dim_calendar
description:
Context:

TFS has been using the old calendar table refined/fact_forecast_driver since 2022. In this table, the c445_week_cd is in the format of YYYYWW. For example, the 4th week of June 2025 is "202425", i.e. 25th week in the year 2024.
Earlier in #218425 we introduced the dim_calendar table from the Global Cube ADLS, which is used by our pipeline's trigger scheduling, and will be exposed to the user in the TFS DB. However, the c445_week_cd field in dim_calendar uses another naming convention YYYYMMWW. For example, the 4th week of June 2025 is "20240604".
We need to replace the value of c445_week_cd in dim_calendar with the old naming convention YYYYWW for consistency.

To do:
In notebook Dim_Calendar, after the existing logic which creates the "c445_month_week_nbr" column using c445_week_cd , overwrite the c445_week_cd to the YYYYWW naming convention. 
This can be done by concatenating the c445_year_cd and c445_week_nbr.
  • Note: for single-digit c445_week_nbr, need to add a '0' in between of c445_year_cd and c445_week_nbr. E.g. 1st week of 2024, we need to concatenate '2024', '0' and '1' to get 202401' as the final value for c445_week_cd
  • the following logic could be used:
  • if len(c445_week_nbr) == 1:
        to_concat_c445_week_nbr = '0' + c445_week_nbr
comments:
Hi @Aliaksei Milto, please take this user story as the priority

  1. Since validations are not yet implemented for rebate files, there were no indication of schema mismatch error. However, in such case no records are loaded to ADLS (in fact the file is silently rejected). For now it's an expected behavior.

  2. The file is archived and removed from the landing folder. I've tested multiple scenarios including the ones with runtime errors and input file is always archived.
CC: @Aliaksei Milto

Hi @Sakshi Joshi!
  1. Thank you for letting us know, we will fix this quickly.

  2. Yes to all three points. The only case when a file is not archived is a technical issue on the Synapse side (not able to start spark pool or something like this). But I think in this particular case we shouldn't archive the file because the processing in fact isn't even started. So everything works as expected :)

@Aliaksei Milto

Hi @Nikita Tseu as per your communication that this story is ready for UAT, I tested Rebates upload today. 
  1. Attached file has incorrect header, and expected result was to see runtime exception with schema mismatch. However, it returned a different exception that seems to be a technical error. https://web.azuresynapse.net/en/monitoring/pipelineruns/216aa3ff-7bed-4aa3-a1d6-a85125c9edc4?workspace=%2fsubscriptions%2f5a820b59-1e08-41d5-9963-3447819271db%2fresourceGroups%2frg-tccc-finance-hub-on-test%2fproviders%2fMicrosoft.Synapse%2fworkspaces%2fsyn-tccc-fhb-use2-test-01

  2. Could @Aliaksei Milto  or you confirm if this user story covers below implementation?  If not, please ensure the scope includes - 
    1. archival of files from ADLS landing regardless of whether file upload was successful or not
    2. archival happens regardless of when failure occurs. In summary, a file picked up for processing from Landing should be moved to archive
    3. archival process is implemented for all manual submissions that we have built so far - NSR, Master Data, Rebate Actual and BP excel files.

title: [Release 2] BP, RE - Update excel ETL to check channel flag and ingest channel-level data
description:
TFS Release 2 ask (November go-LIVE) is to produce channel-level forecast only for Japan. However, certain changes will be implemented as part of this user story to ensure that in future, any new bottlers can be quickly configured to enable channel forecast as well as correctly process manual excel templates  (case rates / master data / bottler RE / PY Actual / BP).


channel_enabled flag was introduced in dim_country as part of user story #226381 . The scope of current user story is to update processing logic for manual excel templates based on that flag.


I. For countries where channel_enabled="Y", read channel code from excel files instead of hardcoding as "NA" for templates. These files include:
  1. BP 
  2. Bottler RE
So channel_cd in refined zone tables for above files will be sourced from excel input files. These tables include:
  1. fact_bp
  2. fact_bottler_re

Ii. Modify aggregation logic for excel templates
  1. If dim_country [channel_enabled] = "Y" then aggregation logic for duplicate records should be updated as below:
    1. When ingesting BP_input_templatet, group by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + CHANNEL_CD + PRODUCT_CD when summing up sum up BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and BP_btlr_vol 
    2. When ingesting RE excel to fact_bottler_re, group by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + CHANNEL_CD  + PRODUCT_CD when summing up sum up RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and RE_btlr_vol 
III. Modify partitioning logic (if needed) for excel-based fact tables
  1. Firstly assess the initial partitioning approach that was implemented for 
    1. fact_bp
    2. fact_bottler_re

  2. If dim_country [channel_enabled] = "Y" then partitioning in above tables (where is currently implemented) should be modified to include Channel_cd.

title: [Release 2] NSR, Master Data, PY - Update excel ETL to check channel flag and ingest channel-level data
description:
TFS Release 2 ask (November go-LIVE) is to produce channel-level forecast only for Japan. However, certain changes will be implemented as part of this user story to ensure that in future, any new bottlers can be quickly configured to enable channel forecast as well as correctly process manual excel templates  (case rates / master data / bottler RE / PY Actual / BP).


channel_enabled flag was introduced in dim_country as part of user story #226381 . The scope of current user story is to update processing logic for manual excel templates based on that flag.


I. For countries where channel_enabled="Y", read channel code from excel files instead of hardcoding as "NA" for templates. These files include:
  1. nsr input
  2. master data
  3. manual PY 
So channel_cd in refined zone tables for above files will be sourced from excel input files. These tables include:
  1. fact_sales_manual_latest
  2. fact_sales_manual_history
  3. dim_case_rate
  4. dim_case_rate_history
  5. dim_master_data
  6. dim_master_data_latest
  7. dim_master_data_history
  8. fact_sales_manual_py

II. Modify aggregation logic for excel templates
  1. If dim_country [channel_enabled] = "Y" then aggregation logic for duplicate records should be updated as below:
    1. When ingesting NSR_input_template to fact_sales_manual_latest, group by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + CHANNEL_CD + PRODUCT_CD when summing up sum up AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and btlr_vol 
    2. When ingesting PY excel to  fact_sales_manual_py, group by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + CHANNEL_CD  + PRODUCT_CD when summing up sum up AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and AC_btlr_vol 
III. Modify partitioning logic (where implemented so far) for excel-based dim/fact tables
  1. Firstly assess the initial partitioning approach that was implemented for 
    1. dim_master_data
    2. dim_master_data_latest
    3. dim_master_data_history
    4. fact_sales_manual_py
    5. fact_sales_manual_latest
    6. fact_sales_manual_history
    7. dim_case_rate
  2. If dim_country [channel_enabled] = "Y" then partitioning in above tables (where is currently implemented) should be modified to include Channel_cd.
comments:
@Stanislau Hryhoryeu I see. If adding channel_cd to partition key can cause potential data corruption, the downside outweighs benefit, which was more efficient data processing.  So I agree to not modify the partitioning logic.

@Aliaksei Milto @Nikita Tseu @Andrei Viaryshka

Hi @Sakshi Joshi! We would like to clarify the part of requirements regarding partitioning. With current approach, partitioning is used to identify bottlers and replace their data with whats coming from excel in case it gets updated within a month. Adding channel_cd to partitioning key could lead to data corruption after enabling cannels for the first time for a particular country, because the system will not find and replace previous bottler data saved with channel_cd "NA". With that in mind, would 

ctryA, bottlerA, channelA

logically be the same bottler as 

ctryA, bottlerA, channelB

If its logically the same bottler, we would propose to leave partitions as they are rn, unless there is deeper reason beyond of what i can see from description. Could you please give more context around modifying partitions and why is that necessary from business logic POV? Thanks!

cc @Aliaksei Milto  @Nikita Tseu  @Andrei Viaryshka

@Stanislau Hryhoryeu 

Hi, i have loaded the dim_country table with the channel_enabled flag. 

Currently only JP has channel_enabled = 'Y'

@Sakshi Joshi 
>How is stage_case_rate_py partitioned currently?
Currently it is C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD

Hi @Runfeng Han you are familiar with dim_stage_case_rate_py notebook and NSR Extraction master pipeline. Can you clarify Stan's question please?

@Stanislau Hryhoryeu The key point here is - all tables which have channel_cd should get values populated from excel depending on channel_cd. So you have to identify the list of tables with channel_cd and trace back if 3 excel files mentioned in user story feed data to that table. I have not looked through notebooks as that is part of investigation during story implementation.
How is stage_case_rate_py partitioned currently?

@Sakshi Joshi Hi! Currently working on identifying resources that require changes and just noticed PY_NSR_Template_Ingestion pipeline has Dim_Satge_Case_Rate_PY notebook at the end which writes  stage_case_rate_py table. With that in mind i have two questions:

1) Is stage_case_rate_py at all related to dim_case_rate? From what i can see in NSR_Extraction_Master_Pipeline, actual dim_case_rate(one of the story's subjects) is calculated from NSR data and not from PY NSR.
2) Will i need to also adjust partitioning in stage_case_rate_py? 

@Dennis Lee Hi, Dennis! Please, ping me when dim_country.channel_enabled is available on DEV environment.

Thanks!

Hi @Dennis Lee  as we spoke on Friday, ETL changes to read channel_cd from excel files vs hardcoding NA based on channel_enabled flag have been split into 2 stories.  Stan can start on processing changes for  nsr, master data and PY excel files.

Hi @Stanislau Hryhoryeu  I think we need to wait for part of Dennis's #226381  to be implemented, for you to start on this story's changes.

title: 2. Run TFS ETL pipeline in UAT
4. Validate Forecast Result
comments:
@Runfeng Han I've checked fact_global_sales again (last time I must have copied the same file twice by mistake).
I've found differences in the actuals data between UAT and PROD (please see the report attached). Mostly differences aren't high, but enough to cause trends discrepancy. 
The worst case is with South Korea, where difference is up to 100% for the last few months

@Runfeng Han I investigated the differences in forecasts on UAT and PROD and so far the findings are following:
  • Residual models: the pandemic data on PROD and UAT are not alligned: for the forecast period there are significant differences in death_rate and StringencyIndex. Some derivatives of these features are used in residual models and this can lead to discrepancy between UAT and PROD forecasts

  • Trend models: I wasn't able to find any difference in the input data, so the trend forecasts should be identical. The absolute differences are not high, as you can see on the chart below for Gambia (one of the most affected markets), so perhaps they can be related to some numerical precision differences.

    I ran the experiment on DEV to check whether trend forecasts are fully deterministic (they should be as we are using fixed random seed): I launched champion - challenger pipeline with two identical runs and compared them. Both gave same results.

    The last idea at this point is that different versions of libraries like numpy, pandas, Spark on UAT and PROD can cause the discrepancy.
    My proposal would be to align libraries versions on both UAT and PROD and make sure, that the same computation clusters are used on both. Then re-run the pipelines.

title: 1. Sync the raw NSR data from PROD to DEV
[Processing][Case Rate] Change the calculation logic for average case rate
description:
Context:
Currently we calculate average case rate by getting the average value of all the BPPs' case rates in the country, i.e. sum(case_rate)/#of BPPs. However, FP&A has request to change the logic to sum(nsr_lc) /sum(uc)
This impacts the calculation for both country monthly average case rate and PY average case rate

To do:
In Dim_Case_rate Notebook:
  1. For country monthly average case rate, need to change the code:
  2.  For PY average case rate, need to
    add uc and nsr_lc fields to stage_case_rate_py
    and change the code:
  3. *NEW* applying rounding to the total UC to 1 demical point. This is due to the floating point causes sum of UC sometimes to be a very small number, resulting in a huge case rate. Additionally, the sum result varies between different runs (sometime sum=0, sometimes sum=0.00000XXXX). .e.g

For country monthly average case rate, need to change the code from 
# calculating country average case rate

)

    .withColumn(

            col("case_rate") > (15* col("ctry_avg_case_rate")),
            True
        )
        .otherwise(False)
    )
)

title: [Processing] Case rate calculation for PY
description:
Context:
To bring in the PY data for the following purposes:
  1. For dashboard consumption of UC & case rate in PY from the baseline table. Need:
    1. change the starting date filter from only CY to PY+CY (1 year earlier)
    2. inserting PY case rate at BPP-monthly level to the dim_case_rate -> covered by the existing dim_case_rate Notebook
  2. For the outlier handling in the weekly refresh of dim_case_rate
    1. by looking up to the new reference table, stage_case_rate_py

For all bottlers in the scope of Release 1 (regardless of sourcing from manual files or Global Cube), the PY data to be provided by the FP&A team (as attached). Note: the PY granularity could be different from the monthly-submitted manual sNSR

Solution approach:


To do:
  1. Create a new notebook to prepare the reference table stage_case_rate_py, where the granularity is according to the "vol_nsr_granularity" in the dim_bottler_config, i.e. [445_month_cd, ctry_cd, bottler_cd, product_cd]
  2. In the existing dim_case_rate Notebook, refer to the stage_case_rate_py to get the PY case rate by joining on [445_month_cd, ctry_cd, bottler_cd, product_cd] to:
    1. allocate the case rate from product_cd level to BPP level for the PY
    2. provide the PY case rate values to calculate the PY average case rate for outlier handling
    3. The notebook will be attached to Nikita's PY ingestion pipeline
  3. In the post-processing Notebook re_forecast_result, need to extract the PY actual data from the fact_sales_global (2PY if it is Janurary).
  4. (Low priority) During step 2 summary report of the PY data: 
    • abnormal actual case rate
      • case rate<=0 while UC>0
      • case rate > positive THRESHOLD
      • case rate < negative THRESHOLD
      • (THRESHOLD = 15 times of the country average of that year)
    • compare (PY global cube UC * Case Rate) VS. provided PY sNSR. If too much discrepancy, flag them out and we will discuss with FP&A

title: [ETL] Manual file ingestion: PY Actual file
description:
Synapse pipeline changes
  1. A new excel ingestion pipeline PY_NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion will be built under TFS - ETL - Manual Ingestion folder on synapse workspace. 

  2. Pipeline will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up files from tfs/landing/manual_submission/PY_Actual/ for processing.
  3. If Logic app detects multiple files inside an OU folder, it will drop them to landing and trigger Synapse pipeline to sequentially process these files, starting from oldest timestamp.

Processing and ADLS changes:
  1. PY_nsr_input_template excel can have data for multiple countries and bottlers, which will likely belong to same OU. 

  2. "PY_nsr_input_template" will be ingested to following tables on Refined zone tfs db - dbo.fact_sales_manual_py. 
  3. Data should be read from "SNSR" tab (case insensitive) in BP_input_template excel.
  4. Storage locations:

    Landing zone: tfs/landing/manual_submission/PY_Actual/<filename>.xlsx

    Stage zone: tfs/stage/manual_submission/PY_Actual/fact_sales_manual_py/<PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP>/<Parquet file>

    Raw zone: tfs/raw/manual_submission/PY_Actual/fact_sales_manual_py(Delta table)

    Refined zone: tfs/refined/manual_submission/PY_Actual/fact_sales_manual_py(Delta table)

    Archive zone: tfs/archive/manual_submission/PY_Actual/<filename>.xlsx

  5. fact_sales_manual_pyschema will be as follows. Both table and overlying view should be created.
    Reading of excel columns should be case insensitive.
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd -  similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA  
    6. AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt - float
    7. AC_btlr_vol  - float
  6. Partitioning of data in fact_sales_manual_py can be by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD combination.

  7.  fact_sales_manual_py table will be updated on Refined zone when C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD from excel file already exists in table. Else new record will be inserted.

  8. fact_sales_manual_pyschema will be as follows. 
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd - 
      1. When dim_bottler_config [data_src_py] = 'SET', the bottler_cd submitted in BP file is dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd_set_hyperion].  Corresponding bottler_cd value needs to be picked up from dim_bottler_config by joining on bottler_cd_set_hyperion, before writing to fact_bp. 
      2. When dim_bottler_config [data_src_py] = 'Excel', the bottler_cd submitted in BP file is dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd]. 
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt  - float
    7. AC_btlr_vol  - float
    8. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    9. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    10. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    11. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    12. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    13. AC_data_source : take dim_bottler_config [data_src_py]
  9. Null or blank AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt , AC_btlr_vol   should be stored as zero in Refined.
  10. fact_sales_manual_py table will be upserted with new, valid records every time a new PY_nsr_input_template excel is submitted. Records that fail validation checks will not be added there. Validation checks and user email notification will be implemented as part of separate user story.
  11. Handling of duplicate records in excel ​: If multiple records exist in excel for same C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + PRODUCT_CD, then AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt, AC_btlr_volcolumns will be respectively summed up. 
  12. After the processing the input file should be moved to the corresponding archive folder on ADLS: tfs/archive/manual_submission/PY_Actual

title: [ETL] Implement data validation checks for PY file
description:
Since PY NSR excel is a manually prepared input to TFS, some data quality & schema validation checks will be done on submitted files. Users will be notified of issues that lead to partial / complete rejection of the file.
File with rejected records or records with warnings should be stored at tfs/reject/manual_submission/fact_bp

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification

  • Email subject: TFS-<env>-Fact_PY_NSR_Excel_Ingestion-<status> Notification
    where env is DEV/UAT/PROD and status is "Successful" or "Failure" or "Successful with Warnings"

  • Receiver: <submitter email id>, TFSFinhubSupport@coca-cola.com 
  • Pipeline ID: <ID>

  • Loading Details: 
    • for Schema check failures, display corresponding notification message in this section

    • for Data Quality check failures or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was processed with errors or warnings. Please refer to the attachment in this link for list of rejected records, and resubmit the file after required corrections."
      <ADLS rejected path to download the file. Replace any spaces in submitted file name with underscore _ so that link does not break>

    • for successful file loads i.e. no errors or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was successfully loaded to TFS. Data will be reflected in Baseline Forecast table.
    • A summary table consisting of status for all submitted bottlers will be placed inside email body.  The Bottler IDs will be sorted in sequence of Failed, Warning, Passed statuses.






Excel Validation Type Validation Sub-type Expected value Status Means of notification Notification message

ctry_cd

channel_cd
product_cd
AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt
AC_btlr_vol 		Error. Email body Submitted file <filename> is expected to contain following mandatory columns: <expected column names separated by comma>

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_py] = 'SET', then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in BP file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd_set_hyperion] combination

title: [ETL][Hotfix] Fix acceptable data source values for RE validations
description:
According to the latest changes, acceptable values for data_src_bottler_re column in the bottler blueprint were updated to EXCEL and GLOBAL CUBE instead of LOCAL CUBE and GLOBAL CUBE as a part of #230920.
Unfortunately, these updates were not correctly reflected in the RE data validations and the old set of values is still used there. As a result, the bottler blueprint already contains the updated values, but the RE data validations still expect the old values, causing a validation failure.

An input file, along with the file containing data check results, has been attached to the story for reference.

Pipeline run ID (PROD): 99fd4a68-b224-437b-9e48-4b3ba4f42647

title: [UAT] - Testing & Development
[ETL] Manual file ingestion: BP
description:
Synapse pipeline changes
  1. A new excel ingestion pipeline BP_Input_Template_Ingestion will be built under TFS - ETL - Manual Ingestion folder on synapse workspace. 

  2. Pipeline will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up files from tfs/landing/manual_submission/bp/ for processing.
  3. If Logic app detects multiple files inside an OU folder, it will drop them to landing and trigger Synapse pipeline to sequentially process these files, starting from oldest timestamp.

Processing and ADLS changes:
  1. BP_input_template excel can have data for multiple countries and bottlers, which will likely belong to same OU. 

  2. "BP_input_template" will be ingested to following tables on Refined zone tfs db - dbo.fact_bp . 
  3. Data should be read from "BP" tab (case insensitive) in BP_input_template excel.
  4. Storage locations:

    Landing zone: tfs/landing/manual_submission/bp/<filename>.xlsx

    Stage zone: tfs/stage/manual_submission/bp/fact_bp/<PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP>/<Parquet file>

    Raw zone: tfs/raw/manual_submission/bp/fact_bp (Delta table)

    Refined zone: tfs/refined/manual_submission/bp/fact_bp (Delta table)

    Archive zone: tfs/archive/manual_submission/bp/<filename>.xlsx

  5. fact_bp schema will be as follows. Both table and overlying view should be created.
    Reading of excel columns should be case insensitive.
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd -  similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt - float
    7. BP_btlr_vol  - float
    8. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    9. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    10. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    11. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    12. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
  6. Partitioning of data in fact_bp can be by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD combination.

  7.  fact_bp table will be updated on Refined zone when C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD from excel file already exists in table. Else new record will be inserted.

  8. fact_bp schema will be as follows. 
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd - 
      1. When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'SET', the bottler_cd submitted in BP file is dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd_set_hyperion].  Corresponding bottler_cd value needs to be picked up from dim_bottler_config by joining on bottler_cd_set_hyperion, before writing to fact_bp. 
      2. When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'Excel', the bottler_cd submitted in BP file is dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd]. 
      3. bottler_cd submitted in BP file is dim_bottler_config [bottler_cd_set_hyperion].  Corresponding bottler_cd value needs to be picked up from dim_bottler_config before writing to fact_bp. 
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt  - float
    7. BP_btlr_vol  - float
    8. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    9. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    10. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    11. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    12. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    13. BP_data_source : take dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp]
  9. Null or blank BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt , BP_btlr_vol   should be stored as zero in Refined.
  10. fact_bp table will be upserted with new, valid records every time a new BP_input_template excel is submitted. Records that fail validation checks will not be added there. Validation checks and user email notification will be implemented as part of separate user story.
  11. Handling of duplicate records in excel ​: If multiple records exist in excel for same C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + PRODUCT_CD, then BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt, BP_btlr_vol  columns will be respectively summed up. 
  12. After the processing the input file should be moved to the corresponding archive folder on ADLS: tfs/archive/manual_submission/bp

@Runfeng Han  @Nikita Tseu

Hi @Sakshi Joshi

To sum our discussion points from yesterday.

For BP file processing (after validation), we will be performing the following:

When referencing dim_bottler_config. Let's name the resolved bottler code from dim_bottler_config as resolved_bottler_code
  1. if BP_DATA_SOURCE == 'SET', then use '9xx' hyperion bottler code -> resolved_bottler_code= '9xx'
  2. if BP_DATA_SOURCE == 'EXCEL', then use '8xx' datalake bottler code -> resolved_bottler_code= '8xx'
  3. if BP_DATA_SOURCE <> 'SET' or BP_DATA_SOURCE <> 'EXCEL', -> resolved_bottler_code= NULL
When joining fact_bp with dim_bottler_config on [ctry_cd, dim_bottler_config.resolved_bottler_code= fact_bp.bottler_code]
  1. Happy cases where join succeeds:
    1. resolved_bottler_code= '9xx', fact_bp has '9xx' hyperion bottler code
      1. Retrieve '8xx' bottler_code
    2. resolved_bottler_code= '8xx',  fact_bp has '8xx' datalake bottler code
      1. No need to map, proceed to use '8xx' as-is
  2. Unaccepted cases, where join fails:
    1. resolved_bottler_code= '9xx', fact_bp has '8xx' datalake bottler code
      1. SET fact_bp's bottler code to NULL
    2. resolved_bottler_code= '8xx', fact_bp has '9xx' hyperion bottler code
      1. SET fact_bp's bottler code to NULL
    3. resolved_bottler_code= NULL, fact_bp has '8xx' or '9xx' bottler code
      1. SET fact_bp's bottler code to NULL
Decisions made:
  1. fact_bp will only have '8xx' bottler code OR NULL
  2. However, we will prevent as much as possible NULL values from going into fact_bp table by handling them in fact_bp's data validation
cc @Runfeng Han @Nikita Tseu

@Dennis Lee  
  • dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] - The idea was to standardize to upper case before loading to backend, but this will be done as part of bottler config ingestion pipeline in future.   For now, can you  convert and store them in upper case in Refined zone bottler config table? 'EXCEL' and 'BPP'.
  • Missing bottler codes in latest bottler config file -  While R1 development is in progress, IF we get bottler codes in BP excel which are missing from config, please flag to @Runfeng Han who can get those details from FP&A (Finance).   Once Master Data validation + email story is done, we can discuss how to auto-notify Isabelle and Ada about data issues  (e.g.  ask them to directly upload files on UAT sharepoint so they can get email alerts)

title: [ETL] Manual file ingestion: Bottler RE
description:
Synapse pipeline changes
  1. A new excel ingestion pipeline Bottler_RE_Template_Ingestion will be built under TFS - ETL - Manual Ingestion folder on synapse workspace. 

  2. Pipeline will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up files from tfs/landing/manual_submission/bottler_re/ for processing.
  3. If Logic app detects multiple files inside an OU folder, it will drop them to landing and trigger Synapse pipeline to sequentially process these files, starting from oldest timestamp.

Processing and ADLS changes:
  1. Bottler_RE_template excel can have data for multiple countries and bottlers, which will likely belong to same OU.  File for ASPOU is attached.

  2. "Bottler_RE_template" will be ingested to following tables on Refined zone tfs db - dbo.fact_bottler_re . 
  3. Data should be read from "RE" tab (case insensitive) in Bottler_RE_template excel.
  4. Storage locations:

    Landing zone: tfs/landing/manual_submission/bottler_re/<filename>.xlsx

    Stage zone: tfs/stage/manual_submission/bottler_re/fact_bottler_re/<PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP>/<Parquet file>

    Raw zone: tfs/raw/manual_submission/bottler_re/fact_bottler_re (Delta table)

    Refined zone: tfs/refined/manual_submission/bottler_re/fact_bottler_re (Delta table)

    Archive zone: tfs/archive/manual_submission/bottler_re/<filename>.xlsx

  5. fact_bottler_re schema will be as follows. Both table and overlying view should be created.
    Reading of excel columns should be case insensitive.
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd - similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or BP or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt - float
    7. RE_btlr_vol - float
    8. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    9. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    10. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    11. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    12. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
  6. Partitioning of data in fact_bottler_re : c445_month_cd + country_cd + bottler_cd

  7.  fact_bottler_re table will be updated on Refined zone when C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD from excel file already exists in table. Else new record will be inserted.
  8. Null or blank RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and RE_btlr_vol should be stored as zero in Refined.
  9. fact_bottler_re table will be upserted with new, valid records every time a new Bottler_RE_template excel is submitted. Records that fail validation checks will not be added there. Validation checks and user email notification will be implemented as part of separate user story.
  10. Handling of duplicate records in excel ​: If multiple records exist in excel for same [c445_month_cd,ctry_cd,bottler_cd,channel_cd,product_cd], then RE_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and RE_btlr_vol  column will be respectively summed up. 
  11. After the processing the input file should be moved to the corresponding archive folder on ADLS: tfs/archive/manual_submission/bottler_re
