title: [Model] Enhancements to the hyperparameter tuning process
description:
Context:
FP&A and the global data science team decided to modify the existing country list for the hyperparam tuning process. Detailed rationale is as attached email.
Changes made:
  1. country list is modified. 
    1. Countries removed from the list: Brazil, Germany, Mexico, Morocco, Philippines, South Africa, Spain
    2. Countries added: Japan, Malaysia, Pakistan, Thailand
  2. minor changes of the tuning process in the Python codebase. Changes are in branch /qy_test in fhb-tccc-tfs-synapse-lib

To do:
  1. Review the code changes, making sure there is no change to the other parts of the codebase except for the tuning-related codes
  2. Merge the code changes
  3. Modify the tuning pipeline in the Synapse workspace. Currently the pipeline uses snapshot_date to identify the dataset for the targeted countries in /stage_feature_engineering_country_level delta table. This requires us to manually prepare the training data before triggering the tuning process. We need to
    1. include the data preparation part into the tuning pipeline
      1. new input params to the pipeline, expecting: 
        1. country_list
        2. actual_data_end_date, and 
        3. number of months for verification
    2. parameterize the tuning country list into the config/parameters/NSR_Forecast_Parameters.json
  4. Qing's latest /best_hyper_params_uc_country delta table for the new country list is in abfss://tfs@sause2tcccfhbdev0001.dfs.core.windows.net/test/20241025 in DEV, copy & paste the delta table to stage/best_hyper_params_uc_country in PROD for the November forecast run
comments:
@Runfeng Han 
I added calculate_projection_start_dates in the pipeline, because feature_generation_country_level notebook requires proj_start and proj_end to create input to stage_feature_engineering_country_level delta table, which is used for hyperparams optimization. 

Also I've found, that proj_start is actually a good indicator where the valid data ends for the given country. This approach is currently used (proj_start - 1 month originally, after change proj_start) to determine the end of the evaluation set.

If we use fixed actual_data_end_date (manual input or minimum of the data ends for all the selected countries), then we risk that non valid data will be used (missing data from some bottlers) in the test set or we ignore few weeks of valid data.

@Pawel Kalisz 
Thx for the update. 

I don't think we need to run the part circled in blue. The calculate_projection_start_date is to get the most available date of the actual data for each bottler. It is used by the monthly scheduled forecast run, because the data availalbility of the bottlers are different, e.g. bottler A's data is till 10th Sep, while bottler B's data is till 20th Oct. With this process we could set different projection start date for the countries to improve model performance.
  1. However, in the tuning process we usually use the recent n-months actual data for validation. For example, we set 2024-11-01 as the actual_data_end_date and n_test_months=5 for all the countries. It implies for all the countries, the dataset used for cross validation is upto 2024-06-01, and the data from 2024-06-01 to 2024-11-01 will be used for accuracy evaluation. Hence
    - the part circled in blue is not needed
    - the part circled in yellow should only call the notebook once, instead of the For Loop

@Runfeng Han 
The following changes are done in the Synapse pipeline:
  1. In the Hyperparameters_optimization pipeline I added few steps to update stage_feature_engineering_country_level with the current generation_date (which is later passes to snapshot_date for filtering)

      2. Added input parameters: country_list (with the updated countries list as default) and n_test_months



      3. Notebooks are modified to ingest new input parameters

@Runfeng Han 
The following changes are done in the library code:
  1. In prophet_hyper_params_optimization funcion:
    1. added parameter n_test_months defining how many months before projection_start_date test set should start (instead of hardcoded value)
    2. removed 1 month offset from projection_start_date, so test set ends with this date
    3. modified changepoint_prior_scale searching range and step (as in global DS changes)
    4. added seasonality_prior_scale and holidays_prior_scale

comments: @Dennis Lee Ok, I will proceed with manual copy.

@Pawel Kalisz 

To keep it simple, I suggest to perform a manual copy of the dim_country table from UAT to DEV. 

Currently, Japan should be the only country with channel_enabled == 'Y'

cc @Runfeng Han , @Nikita Tseu

@Nikita Tseu @Dennis Lee @Runfeng Han Thank you for advice. I think I will proceed with dim_country then. It would be better to get data from a single source.

[Edit] I see there is a discrepancy between dim_country and channel_status.csv on DEV



Can these two tables be synchronized to test it on DEV before deployment?

On UAT both tables are aligned

Hi @Pawel Kalisz,
I agree with Dennis's viewpoint, and I'd like to add a few points that might be helpful for you in making the decision.
  • From the perspective of further data consumption, it's perfectly fine to use the dim_country table instead of the channel_status.csv. Essentially, this is just about the source from which the data is being read, so it wouldn’t affect any subsequent logic.

  • The data in the dim_country table is synchronized with the channel_status.csv, so these two data sources are equivalent from the perspective of data consistency and there's no reason to favor the csv file over the table.

  • A properly managed table is generally a more reliable data source comparing to a csv file, which could potentially be accidentally manually changed.

  • The dim_country table would provide us a single point of reference instead of spreading the data across multiple sources. This helps to maintain an overall consistency.
CC: @Runfeng Han, @Dennis Lee
Thanks for the input, @Dennis Lee @Nikita Tseu! @Pawel Kalisz depending on the changes needed for using the dim_country table or the config file, you could decide which approach to take

@Pawel Kalisz 

I think it would be better to use dim_country table so we have a single source of reference for all our ETL.

dim_country is updated with information from channel_status.csv each time data ingestion is performed in NSR_Dim_Country_Bottler notebook.

cc @Nikita Tseu @Runfeng Han

title: Sandbox Testing
description:
All files are attached to the task.
Testing included two parts - use-case testing + data consistency testing.

Data consistency testing

To test the data consistency three PY files were ingested. After that I compared the following metrics in Excel vs Backend table (excluding all invalid records from the excel):
  1. Total revenue
  2. Total volume
  3. Number of records
Results are matching exactly for row count and total volume, however there's a minor discrepancy in total revenue. After some additional research I'm sure this is just a cumulative error coming from an aggregation of floating point numbers. To check the results please refer to the input_merged.xlsx file.

Backend table query: 
SELECT
    COUNT(*) as CNT,
    SUM(AC_BTLR_NET_SLS_REV_AMT) as TOTAL_REV, 
    SUM(AC_BTLR_VOL) as TOTAL_VOL
FROM 
    [tfs].[dbo].[fact_sales_manual_py]
WHERE
    PIPELINE_RUN_ID = '9ef07331-7235-4ca4-b931-de5d6d2e6098'

Use-case testing

Case 1

20240611193601_ntseu@coca-cola.com_nsr_py_1_FULL.xlsx

  4. TFSFinhubSupport@coca-cola.com recipient also receives the notification

title: [ETL] Build Logic App flow to move BP excel file from Sharepoint to ADLS landing
description:
Users would like to upload BP (Business Plan) excel to TFS database, for all country-bottler combinations. They will submit the file on Sharepoint folder, and upon ingestion and processing, the data will become available on Refined zone table / view for dashboard usage.

Logic App changes
  1. A new Logic App workflow "la-tccc-tfs-<env>-bp-excel-ingestion" needs to be developed to drop BP excel file from Sharepoint to Landing zone, and trigger  BP_Input_Template_Ingestion pipeline. Where env is dev/uat/prod.
  2. LA flow will run every 30 min on production. Sample BP file is attached to this story.

  3. Source location for logic app is OU -> BP -> Input folder on this path for each of the 9 OUs
    https://groups.coca-cola.com/sites/FinanceHub/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?csf=1&web=1&e=8zWJXf&cid=fa4b2f81%2D1eda%2D4ec3%2Db99c%2D127648a70296&FolderCTID=0x0120002281E8E9D9FBD24D934910BD09D78388&id=%2fsites%2fFinanceHub%2fShared%20Documents%2fTFS%2fNSR%20and%20Master%20Data%20Upload%2fASPOU%2fBP%2fInput&viewid=8c55e7cf%2D7a5b%2D4720%2D89af%2Dca986f33d62f
    So LA has to recursively check BP folder inside each of the OUs at above path.
  4. Drop location for Logic App is tfs/landing/manual_submission/bp/

  5. When searching in sharepoint source folder, LA will pick up files with "BP_input_template" or "bp_input_template" string in file name. Files will be picked up based on the order (time) in which they were placed on sharepoint folder. Older file to be picked up first. 
    1. If file name is missing "BP_input_template" or "bp_input_template", do not drop file to landing. Instead, notify user to submit expected file name and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template.

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/BP/Input

      The file was not processed due to missing "bp_input_template" in file name . Please amend file name and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>


  6. Checks to be performed by LA:
    1. Is file format .xlsx? If not, do not drop the file on landing. Instead, notify user to submit nsr_input_template in .xlsx format and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template:

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/BP/Input

      The file was not processed due to invalid format. Valid file format is .xlsx . Please amend and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

  7. File name will be renamed as <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx before dropping it on ADLS. Where submitter email is taken from sharepoint, and timestamp is when the file was uploaded on sharepoint by user.
  8. Following email notification will be sent to submitter once file is picked up from sharepoint Input folder:
    Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

    You have uploaded
    File: <original filename>
    Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/BP/Input

    The file has been moved as:
    Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx
    Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

    The file will be processed in TFS, and valid data will be available in monthly forecast table upon next forecast run.
  9. As a very last step, Logic app flow should move the file to Archive sub-folder of that OU - BP path. 
    https://groups.coca-cola.com/sites/FinanceHub/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?csf=1&web=1&e=8zWJXf&cid=fa4b2f81%2D1eda%2D4ec3%2Db99c%2D127648a70296&FolderCTID=0x0120002281E8E9D9FBD24D934910BD09D78388&id=%2fsites%2fFinanceHub%2fShared%20Documents%2fTFS%2fNSR%20and%20Master%20Data%20Upload%2fASPOU%2fBP%2fArchive&viewid=8c55e7cf%2D7a5b%2D4720%2D89af%2Dca986f33d62f

title: [Email reminder] Upload Bottler RE template
description:
This story is part of developing a Synapse pipeline (started in #218559)  that will eventually be used to send multiple email reminders to users -
    • For different manual excel types (NSR, Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE)
    • For excel file submission summary by OU i.e. which all bottlers were submitted and processed sucessfully, which had warnings, which were not submitted at all 
    • At different schedules e.g. reminder for certain file type will be sent on W3D1 but reminder for another file type will be sent on W3D3
  1. The focus of this user story is to send email reminders  to OUs for Bottler RE template submissions. Excel upload reminder email will be sent at each OU level. So 8 emails are supposed to be sent out, for each of distinct dim_bottler_config [OU].
  2. Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
  3. Content: 
    1. Email subject: <OU> TFS Data Submission Reminder - Bottler RE 
      where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Data Submission Reminder - Bottler RE
    2. Content: This is an automated reminder to submit Bottler RE data (by country and bottler) to TFS. As per Blueprint configuration aligned with OU & FP&A , please refer to attachment for list of Country/bottlers where manual Bottler RE information is supposed to be submitted via excel input. 
      Important steps to successful submission: 
      • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain Full Year information by months. All granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
      • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain bottler_re_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
      • Submission :  use the <upload link> for Bottler RE excel template submission.
      • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.
  4. Upload links for each file type and environment are specified here. During UAT/PROD deployment, the paths in email should be automatically updated to reflect upload path for respective environment.
  5. Recipients:  There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
    1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] 
    2. Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Sakshi) alignment with Finance.
    3. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Bottler_RE_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv
  6. Attachment:  For each OU, attach an excel file containing list of OU - Ctry_nm - bottler_cd - bottler_nm from dim_bottler_config where [data_src_bottler_re] = 'LOCAL CUBE'
  7. Scheduling
    1. Same pipeline will be used to send out the first monthly file upload reminder emails for different excel templates (NSR, Bottler RE, Bottler Rebates, Master Data).
    2. Set Synapse pipeline trigger for every Monday and check following conditions.
    3. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 1 of the 445 month i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =1)  
    4. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
      • If above condition is satisfied i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
      • If above condition is not satisfied  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '2' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
    5. Time of sending NSR upload reminder (TBC with Finance by Sakshi): 
      1. 9am Singapore time (UTC +8) for GCMOU, ASPOU, JSKOU
      2. 10am India time (UTC + 5:30)  for INSWA, EMEOU
      3. 9am UTC for EOU, EOU 
      4. 9am Eastern Time for LAOU

title: [Email reminder] Upload Effective Incidence Master Data template
description:
This story is part of developing a Synapse pipeline (started in #218559)  that will eventually be used to send multiple email reminders to users -
    • For different manual excel types (NSR, Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE)
    • For excel file submission summary by OU i.e. which all bottlers were submitted and processed sucessfully, which had warnings, which were not submitted at all 
    • At different schedules e.g. reminder for certain file type will be sent on W3D1 but reminder for another file type will be sent on W3D3
  1. The focus of this user story is to send email reminders  to OUs for Master Data template submissions. Excel upload reminder email will be sent at each OU level. So 8 emails are supposed to be sent out, for each of distinct dim_bottler_config [OU].
  2. Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
  3. Content: 
    Email subject: <OU> TFS Data Submission Reminder - Effective Incidence Master Data
    where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Data Submission Reminder - Effective Incidence Master Data

    Content: This is an automated reminder to submit Effective Incidence Master Data (by country and bottler) to enable their Rebate (Price) Adjustment calculation in TFS. Please refer to attachment for list of Country/bottlers with BPPs having UC data in NSR Datalake this month, which did not exist before for that bottler. Please ignore this email if you have already submitted effective incidence master data for those new BPPs.

    Important steps to successful submission: 

    • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain Full Year information by months. The configured granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
    • Master Data includes Yield, Billing_price_su, effective_incidence_rate, incidence_coverage_rate
    • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain master_data_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
    • Submission :  use the <upload link> for effective incidence excel template submission.
    • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.

  4. Upload links for each file type and environment are specified here. During UAT/PROD deployment, the paths in email should be automatically updated to reflect upload path for respective environment.
  5. Recipients:  There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
    1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] 
    2. Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Sakshi) alignment with Finance.
    3. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Master_Data_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv
  6. Attachment: For each OU, attach an excel file with 5 columns - OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, bpp_cd. Each OU's excel should contain its respective country list only, as per bottler config table.
    1. Attachment name will be  <OU>-NSR-<monthname>-<bottlers-effectiveincidence-masterdata-submission> where monthname example is July2024
    2. The logic for identifying such Country X bottler X new BPP codes that have UC volume in latest month but not in previous months, has been previously implemented in "New_bpp" tab of tfs_post_validation excel, which is generated in TFS -> Forecast -> Output_validation pipeline -> Output_validation notebook. The same logic should be reapplied.
  7. Scheduling
    1. Same pipeline will be used to send out the first monthly file upload reminder emails for different excel templates (NSR, Bottler RE, Bottler Rebates, Master Data).
    2. Set Synapse pipeline trigger for every Monday and check following conditions.
    3. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 1 of the 445 month i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =1)  
    4. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
      • If above condition is satisfied i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
      • If above condition is not satisfied  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '2' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
    5. Time of sending NSR upload reminder (TBC with Finance by Sakshi): 
      1. 9am Singapore time (UTC +8) for GCMOU, ASPOU, JSKOU
      2. 10am India time (UTC + 5:30)  for INSWA, EMEOU
      3. 9am UTC for EOU, EOU 
      4. 9am Eastern Time for LAOU
comments:
Note that in Output_Validation we are comparing the current batch of baseline baseline data with the previous batch last month at [ctry, bpp] level. 
However, in this user story we need to compare at [ctry, bottler, bpp] level

@Aliaksei Milto @Vanessa Ma

Hi @Aliaksei Milto 
  1. There is no change required to the logic for identifying new BPPs. Latest and Previous baseline forecast versions (not month) should be compared to identify which BPPs with sales are new.  If existing logic is performing this check using data from fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE then that logic stays as well. 
    Please connect with @Aparna Kanjarla  or @Runfeng Han for current logic if needed. Also note that we are introducing Trueup version# in Release 1, but for identifying new BPPs we will continue to compare BPP list in latest vs prior baseline versions .
  2. In attachment we should send only list of new BPPs together with OU, country and bottler to which they belonged, no matter, were they already submitted or not - Yes. As per Finance when a new product is launched in market, its incidence rate etc is decided around that time. So it is unlikely they will pre-upload master data for these products before their actual sales becomes available in datalake.

Hi @Aparna Kanjarla @Sakshi Joshi 

I checked a tab where BPP codes are identified


  1. If I understand notebook tab correctly, we basically compare current version of two full snapshots (current and previous) of sales data (both actual and predicted) and find new BPPs. How exactly should this check be implemented in our case? For instance, should we compare current month fact_sales_manual data against previous month data to find BPPs? Or should we compare entire fact_sales_manual snapshots (current and previous)?

title: [Notification][Case Rate] Case rate report: Global Cube actual UC*case rate vs. manually submitted sNSR
description:
Context:
Runfeng Han: Abnormal Case Rate Detection on Day 4 Week 2

As discussed in the meeting with FP&A, the RDC side will start to build a scheduled job to detect and report case rate outliers:

  1. compare the actual sNSR in baseline table VS. manual input sNSR (only for countries submitting sNSR data manually according to the Blueprint, i.e. in dim_bottler_config where [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL'). 
  2. Job to be scheduled on 9am SG time day 4 week 2

Note:

  1. The actual sNSR in baseline table equals to the actual UC in the Global Cube * case rates calculated based on the manual submitted data, i.e. (UC aggregated at monthly level in fact_sales_global) * (case_rate in dim_case_rate)
  2. we are to check the actual across the same period as the baseline, i.e. PY and CY
  3. for the country/bottler whose data granularity is NOT at bpp level, e.g. at BP level, we will do the comparison at the specified granularity level in dim_bottler_config
To do:
  1. Create a new notebook Case_Rate_Based_sNSR_Report
  2. Create a new pipeline, where run the below in sequence
    • Existing notebook Dim_Case_Rate
    • New notebook Abnormal_Case_Rate_Detection
    • Send email to FP&A
    • Email :
      • Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
      • Email subject: 
         
        <OU> TFS Notification - AC SNSR Input Validation Report
        where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Notification - AC SNSR Input Validation Report

        Content: This is an automated report on the comparison of the actual sNSR between manually submitted data and TFS Baseline. Please review the attached Excel file. 
    • Recipient:
      • There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
        1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] and [email_others]
        2. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Case_Rate_Report'.  The csv is maintained at landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv

    • Attachment:
      1. an excel file with the following columns - [OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, channel_cd, bpp_cd, c445_month_cd, case_rate, NSR_manaul_submission, NSR_baseline, variance]. 
        1. Attachment name will be Abnormal Case Rate Report-<monthname> where monthname example is July2024
        2. variance = NSR_baseline/NSR_manaul_submission - 1
    • Scheduling: 9 am SG time on Day 4 of Week 2 in a 4-week 445 month, or 9 am SG time on Day 4 of Week 3 in a 5-week 445 month

title: [Email reminder] Add additional tracking information to emails
description:
The recent testing of the reminder emails has uncovered some gaps in the email design that complicate email traceability. The purpose of this story is to refine the reminder email format to include additional information that will help the dev team in troubleshooting. Specifically, the following two updates are needed:
  1. Add the environment name to the email subject. 
  2. Add the pipeline run ID into the email body.
Updated email subject: [DEV/UAT/PROD] <OU> TFS Data Submission Reminder - <data type>
For example: [PROD] INSWAOU TFS Data Submission Reminder - Bottler RE

Updated message (email body):
Execution Pipeline ID: <pipeline run ID>

This is an automated reminder to submit ...

title: [Email reminder] Generate Summary email for manual files processing status
description:
Context:
A single, consolidated submission status sent to SDLs of ALL OUs to show of the latest submission status for following TFS datasets:
    1. NSR_input_template
    2. rebate_actual_template
    3. bottler_re
Email body to indicate red vs green OU-countries, attachment will have bottler level detail.
Logic: 
At bottler level, query the fact tables for their latest file submission timestamp. 
  • If it is within the current 445 month, it means the data for this bottler has been submitted on time. Do nothing
  • if not, flag it out and put the record into the attachment
send notification to 8 OU SDLs + FP&A team separately

To do:
  1. The focus of this user story is to send a single, consolidated submission status email to OUs for the 3 datasets listed in Context. Excel upload reminder email will be sent at each OU level. So 8 emails are supposed to be sent out, for each of distinct dim_bottler_config [OU]. 
  2. Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
  3. Content: 
    1. Email subject: <OU> TFS Data Submission Status Summary <c445_month_cd>
      where 
      1. OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] 
      2. c445_month_cd is the c445_month_cd in dim_calendar
      3. e.g. ASPOU TFS Data Submission Status Summary 202408
    2. Content: This is an automated summary of the submission status of TFS datasets. Please find bottler-dataset level submission status in the attached file.
      3. FO Country Name  Status Action
      South ASP
      		New Zealand All Submitted No action required
      South ASP Nauru Missing Submission Please submit the missing files flagged in the attachment

  4. Recipients:  There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
    1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] 
    2. Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Runfeng) alignment with Finance.
    3. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Submission_Summary'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv
  5. Attachment:
    1. file name: <OU> TFS Missing Submission <c445_month_cd>
    2. 3 tabs "missing_NSR_submission", "missing_rebate_submission", "missing_bottler_re_submission"
    3. In each tab, header: FO - Ctry_nm - bottler_cd - bottler_nm from dim_bottler_config 
      1. for "missing_NSR_submission, list the bottlers where [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL' in dim_bottler_config and the [SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP] of the bottler in fact_sales_manual_latest not within the current 445 month (from dim_calendar)
      2. for "missing_rebate_submission, list the bottlers in dim_bottler_config (no filter as the rebate file is supposed to be submitted by all bottlers) and the [SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP] of the bottler in fact_sales_manual_latest not within the current 445 month (from dim_calendar)
      3. for "missing_bottler_re_submission, list the bottlers where [data_src_nsr] = 'LOCAL CUBE' in dim_bottler_config and the [SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP] of the bottler in fact_sales_manual_latest not within the current 445 month (from dim_calendar)
  6. Scheduling
    1. Same pipeline will be used to send out the first monthly file upload reminder emails for different excel templates (NSR, Bottler RE, Bottler Rebates, Master Data).
    2. Set Synapse pipeline trigger for every Monday and check following conditions.
    3. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 3 (different from the reminder sending date, which is Day 1) of the 445 month i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =3)  
    4. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
      • If above condition is satisfied i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
      • If above condition is not satisfied  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '2' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
    5. Time of sending NSR upload reminder (TBC with Finance by Runfeng): 
      1. 9am Singapore time (UTC +8) for GCMOU, ASPOU, JSKOU
      2. 10am India time (UTC + 5:30)  for INSWA, EMEOU
      3. 9am UTC for AOU, EOU 
      4. 9am Eastern Time for LAOU
comments: @Aliaksei Milto @Nikita Tseu Yes you are right, we need to change it to "EXCEL". Thanks for flagging it out!

Hi @Runfeng Han 
We might need to change RE reminder #223460, currently we remind all bottlers where DATA_SRC_BOTTLER_RE is 'LOCAL CUBE', however after User Story 230920: [ETL][CR to PROD] Adjustments to the data validation rule of bottler config file ingestion for bottler_re - Boards (azure.com) this value is not valid anymore, so we won't be able to remind about any bottler at all.

cc @Nikita Tseu

@Aliaksei Milto FP&A's group email: toplineoptimization@coca-cola.com
Let's add it to the recipients for UAT, and PROD in the future
Hi @Aliaksei Milto , about the group email address for FP&A, I've checked with Isabelle and she will work on creating the group email address.

title: [Email Notification] Flag out missing BPPs in Effective Incidence Master Data against Global Cube
description:
Context:
FP&A requests to have warning messages on missing BPs/BPPs in Effective Incidence Master Data and manually submitted sNSR to send out to Genpact teams in each OU.
Aligned with Ada that we will check against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data in the recent 4 months in Global Cube.

Logic:
The same logic will be applied to the checking process on both Effective Incidence Master Data and manually submitted sNSR
  1. Effective Incidence Master Data: 
    • which bottlers to check: according to the 'master_data_granularity' field in dim_bottler_config, perform the check for the bottlers where master_data_granularity IS NOT NULL
    • where to check: 
      • CURRENT YEAR in refined/manual_submission/master_data/dim_master_data_latest for Effective Incidence Master Data
      • past-4-month data in refined/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_global for actual data in Global Cube
    • what to check: 
      • distinct list of BP/BPP from both sides, flag out the BP/BPPs missing in the dim_master_data_latest 
        • whether it is at BP or BPP level depends on the "master_data_granularity" field in dim_bottler_config
          • if vol_nsr_granularity = 'BPP', simply get the distinct list of bpp_cd directly from fact_sales_global 
          • if vol_nsr_granularity = 'BP', need to get the distinct list of BPs by joining fact_sales_global with the dim_isscom_prod_mapping, on bpp_cd, to get the "
            beverage_product_code" as the BP code
    • Result dataframe: contains the missing BP/BPP. [OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, product_cd, granularity]
    • Email :
      • Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
      • Email subject: <OU> TFS Notification - Missing Product Codes in Effective Incidence Master Data
        where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Notification - Missing Product Codes in Effective Incidence Master Data

        Content: This is an automated notification on the missing BPs/BPPs in Effective Incidence Master Data. Please review the missing BPs/BPPs in the attached Excel file. Please resubmit the Effective Incidence Master Data (by country and bottler) with these missing BPs/BPPs. 

        Important steps to successful submission: 

        • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain Full Year information by months.The configured granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
        • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain master_data_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
        • Submission :  use the <upload link> for Effective Incidence Master Data excel template submission.
        • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.

    • Recipient:
      • There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
        1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] and [email_others]
        2. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Master_Data_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv

    • Attachment:
      1. For each OU, attach an excel file with 5 columns - OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, product_cd. Each OU's excel should contain its respective country list only, as per bottler config table.
        1. Attachment name will be <OU>-missing-product-Effective Incidence Master Data-<monthname> where monthname example is July2024
    • Scheduling: on Day 1 of Week 1 and Week 2 in 445 month, after the completion of pipeline Global_TFS_Master_Pipeline
comments:
Hi @Nikita Tseu, I did not include the handling logic for BRAND and BEVERAGE_CATEGORY as currently "BP" and "BPP" are the only 2 values for vol_nsr_granularity and master_data_granularity:
 
But you are right. We can add the logic for BRAND and BEVERAGE_CATEGORY to be prepared for such cases in the future. It will use similar logic to get the distinct list of category_codes/brand_code by joining fact_sales_global with the dim_isscom_prod_mapping, on bpp_cd, to get the "category_code"/"brand_code"

Hi @Runfeng Han! 
During the PR review @Aliaksei Milto raised a good point about possible product granularities (both for NSR and for Masterdata).

In the user story, there’s a clear description how to handle bottlers marked with BP or BPP granularity in the bottler blueprint. However, there are two more possible granularity values - BRAND and BEVERAGE_CATEGORY. With the current setup, bottlers with these granularities would be ignored, as there isn't any explicit conversion of brand or beverage category to BPP codes. 

Should I add some extra logic to process such bottlers?

@Nikita Tseu 
Thanks for flagging these points. You are correct. I've updated the description accordingly.
  1. email body changes according to your suggestion
  2. Attachment name will be <OU>-missing-product-Effective Incidence Master Data-<monthname> where monthname example is July2024
  3. yes, the column name has been changed from 'bpp_cd' to 'product_cd'
  4. yes, please add the granularity column

@Runfeng Han 
After testing the story I noticed a couple of things which could be fixed/improved. Could you please review and share your opinion?

Notification email
Seems like the wording has been copied from the NSR story and sometimes doesn't match with what we currently have for Masterdata. The difference is in the Data Preparation and the File Naming Convention points. Below I provided how these points should look like if we take them from the Masterdata submission email (the differences are highlighted by green).
  • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain Full Year information by months. The configured granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
  • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain master_data_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
Attachment filename
Could you please confirm that the NSR part in the attachment filename is not a mistake?
<OU>-NSR-<month_name>-missing-product-Effective-Incidence-Master-Data-submission

Attachment schema
  1. BPP_CD column name in the attachment seems to be not very precise since this column contain not only BPP codes, but BP codes as well. Wouldn't it be better to rename it to PRODUCT_CD?

  2. Since both BPP and BP codes are stored in the same column I propose to add an additional column GRANULARITY to the attachment. This column will serve to differentiate between two types of codes and for each bottler it will contain either "BP" or "BPP" string.
Copied with all links from User Story 231509

title: [Email Notification] Enhancements to the missing product reports
description:
Context:
Isabelle Schoepp: TFS Notification - missing product Codes in Master data & sNSR
FP&A have several feedbacks:
  1. 32% (table 1) of listed products do have no AC in 2024 and no baseline (202502) in the missing product report. They request to remove such entries from the report. 
    1. This is because the current logic is to check the submitted data against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data in the recent 4 months in Global Cube. We can enhance the rule to checking against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data with actual volume >0.
  2. There are many missing product not being flagged out in the report.
    This could be due to the fact that 4-month actual data is not sufficient. We can increase the range of the actual data in the Global Cube for comparison purpose from 4 months to longer period, so that more products will be checked against.
  3. They want to have the same new columns ["product_nm, brand_nm, uc_current_fy"] to be added to the sNSR missing product report as we did in #233372 
  4. They spotted the "uc_current_fy" field is 0 in this month's report since there was no actual data in 2025 yet. They requests to use the actual data in the last year if the current month is January.

To do:
  1. For the missing product reports for both Master Data and Manual sNSR, enhance the rule to checking against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data with actual volume >0
  2. (Pending on confirmation) For both reports, increase the range of actual data used for comparison from 4 months to 8 months
  3. For the Manual sNSR report, add the same new columns ["product_nm, brand_nm, uc_current_fy"]
  4. For the "uc_current_fy" field both reports, use the PY actual UC if the current month is January
comments: @Nikita Tseu let's simply change the 4 months to 8 months and leave the existing logic as it is, i.e. excluding the current month

Hi @Runfeng Han!
One quick question which appeared after the testing. Should the "past 8 months" period include the current month?
For example, given that the current month is Feb 25, which of the options below should be considered as the "past 8 months" period:
  1. Jul 24 - Feb 25
  2. Jun 24 - Jan 25

Hi @Nikita Tseu 
  1. The idea is that we will ignore the BPs/BPPs whose sum of UC in the past 8 months <=0, since there are cases when the UC could be negative
  2. Yes for Master Data. For sNSR, the range will change to 8 months on both sides (fact_sales_global and fact_sales_manual_latest) (thanks for asking 😊)
  3. We can directly source the PY data from fact_sales_global, as the UC number in the Global Cube is trusted

Hi @Runfeng Han! I have a few questions regarding the requirements.
  1. For the missing product reports for both Master Data and Manual sNSR, enhance the rule to checking against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data with actual volume >0.
    I'm a bit confused with metrics names here. Am I right that we want to ignore all fact_sales_global records where a product has a UC value equal to 0?

  2. For both reports, increase the range of actual data used for comparison from 4 months to 8 months.
    This affects only the fact_sales_global side of comparison, right? For Master Data and sNSR the range remains the same, which is the current year and 4 months respectively.

  3. For the Manual sNSR report, add the same new columns ["product_nm, brand_nm, uc_current_fy"].
    All clear here, I'll add the fields.

  4. For the "uc_current_fy" field both reports, use the PY actual UC if the current month is January.
    Should I source the PY data from fact_sales_manual_py? Or just aggregate the UC for the past year directly from the fact_sales_global?

@Nikita Tseu Isabelle agreed to test with increasing the range of actual data used for comparison from 4 months to 8 months
Isabelle Schoepp: Thanks a lot Runfeng Han, this is really helpful NSR :  Point ...
posted in Topline Forecast System V 2.0 / 2. IT Business Analytics - Azure SQL on Thursday, 23 January 2025 7:45 pm

title: [ETL] Sort bottler list in email body based on file processing status
description:
A summary table consisting of status for all submitted bottlers is currently placed inside email body.  
In the table, bottler IDs are sorted alphabetically.

  1. As part of this user story, the Bottler IDs will be sorted in following order of Status so that users can focus on bottler files that require data fixing:

    2. Warning
    3. Passed

For cases where submitted bottler_cd was not found in dim_bottler_config and record was rejected, such Bottler ID, FO and Country Name should be labelled as "Undefined" in the email table.  Reason and Action would be as "Undefined bottler code submitted. title: [Email Notification] New fields to add to the missing BPPs report for master data
description:
Context:
Isabelle Schoepp: BPP Missing product codes in Master data

FP&A requested to add 3 new fields to the missing BPP report of the master data: 
  1. product description (get from the refined/dim_isscom_product_mapping)
    1. use the field beverage_product_name if master_data_grandularity is BP
    2. use the field bpp_nm if master_data_grandularity is BPP
  2. Brand Name (get from the field brand_name in refined/dim_isscom_product_mapping)
  3. impacted UC of the BPP in the current FY (get from refined/fact_sales_global)
To do:
Add 3 new fields to the report ["product_nm, brand_nm, uc_current_fy"] with the logic in the Context.
comments:
Hi @Nikita Tseu ,

  1. Yes, the uc_current_fy will be the sum of the uc values for the records of that certain category/brand/BP/BPP for the specific bottler in the current FY (you can use the year_cd in the fcat_sales_global table, which is from the 445 calendar)
  2. we can assume the granularity will always be below the category level. If a bottler reports data at a BEVERAGE_CATEGORY level, the brand_nm field will be blank
  3. Yes. it's also possible to use brand_name and category_name from dim_isscom_product_mapping if a bottler reports data at the corresponding granularity levels

Hi @Runfeng Han!

I'd like to align the calculation logic for the uc_current_fy column with you to be on the same page. For each product reported as missing in the reminder, we should find all appearances of this product in the fact_sales_global table for the current financial year (financial year is defined by the 4-4-5 calendar, not the Gregorian calendar). The value for uc_current_fy will be the sum of the uc values for these records.

It's important to note that the total uc will be calculated based on the master_data_granularity for each specific bottler. For instance, if a bottler reports data at a BRAND level, we will calculate the total uc for that particular missing brand, not for the bpp.

Additionally, could you please confirm that, despite the 4-month lookback period used to identify missing products, the uc_current_fy should be calculated for the entire financial year? Does it make sense from the business perspective?

There are also a couple of corner-cases related to different possible product granularities.
  1. It's not possible to fill the brand_nm column if a bottler reports data at a BEVERAGE_CATEGORY level, since one beverage category usually includes multiple brands.

  2. For product_nm it's also possible to use brand_name and category_name from dim_isscom_product_mapping if a bottler reports data at the corresponding granularity levels, right?

Thank you, look forward to your thoughts on this.

title: [Email reminder] Upload Rebate Actual template
description:
This story is part of developing a Synapse pipeline (started in #218559)  that will eventually be used to send multiple email reminders to users -
    • For different manual excel types (NSR, Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE)
    • For excel file submission summary by OU i.e. which all bottlers were submitted and processed sucessfully, which had warnings, which were not submitted at all 
    • At different schedules e.g. reminder for certain file type will be sent on W3D1 but reminder for another file type will be sent on W3D3
  1. The focus of this user story is to send email reminders  to OUs for Rebate Actual template submissions. Excel upload reminder email will be sent at each OU level. So 8 emails are supposed to be sent out, for each of distinct dim_bottler_config [OU]. 
  2. Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
  3. Content: 
    1. Email subject: <OU> TFS Data Submission Reminder - Rebate Actual  
      where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Data Submission Reminder - Rebate Actual
    2. Content: This is an automated reminder to submit Rebate Actual data (by country and bottler) to TFS. 
      Important steps to successful submission: 
      • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain YTD Year information by actuals months. Country & bottler split should be included.
      • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain rebate_actual_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
      • Submission :  use the <upload link> for Rebate Actual excel template submission.
      • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.
  4. Upload links for each file type and environment are specified here. During UAT/PROD deployment, the paths in email should be automatically updated to reflect upload path for respective environment.
  5. Recipients:  There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
    1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] 
    2. Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Sakshi) alignment with Finance.
    3. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'Rebate_Actual_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv
  6. Attachment: Note: unlike the other 3 templates where we need to list the specific bottlers to submit the files in the attachment, all bottlers need to submit the Rebate Actual template. Hence email attachment is NOT REQUIRED.
  7. Scheduling
    1. Same pipeline will be used to send out the first monthly file upload reminder emails for different excel templates (NSR, Bottler RE, Bottler Rebates, Master Data).
    2. Set Synapse pipeline trigger for every Monday and check following conditions.
    3. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 1 of the 445 month i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =1)  
    4. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
      • If above condition is satisfied i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
      • If above condition is not satisfied  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '2' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
    5. Time of sending NSR upload reminder (TBC with Finance by Sakshi): 
      1. 9am Singapore time (UTC +8) for GCMOU, ASPOU, JSKOU
      2. 10am India time (UTC + 5:30)  for INSWA, EMEOU
      3. 9am UTC for EOU, EOU 
      4. 9am Eastern Time for LAOU

title: [Email Notification] Flag out missing BPPs in manual sNSR against Global Cube
description:
Context:
FP&A requests to have warning messages on missing BPs/BPPs in master data and manually submitted sNSR to send out to Genpact teams in each OU.
Aligned with Ada that we will check against the BPs/BPPs appears in the actual data in the recent 4 months in Global Cube.

Logic:
The same logic will be applied to the checking process on both master data and manually submitted sNSR
  1. manually submitted sNSR: 
    • which bottlers to check: according to the 'data_src_nsr' field in dim_bottler_config, perform the check for the bottlers where data_src_nsr='EXCEL'
    • where to check: 
      • past-4-month data in refined/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_manual_latest for manually submitted sNSR
      • past-4-month data in refined/fact_sales_global for actual data in Global Cube
    • what to check: 
      • distinct list of BP/BPP from both sides, flag out the BP/BPPs missing in the fact_sales_manual_latest 
        • whether it is at BP or BPP level depends on the "vol_nsr_granularity" field in dim_bottler_config
          • if vol_nsr_granularity = 'BPP', simply get the distinct list of bpp_cd directly from fact_sales_global 
          • if vol_nsr_granularity = 'BP', need to get the distinct list of BPs by joining fact_sales_global with the dim_isscom_prod_mapping, on bpp_cd, to get the "
            beverage_product_code" as the BP code
    • Result dataframe: contains the missing BP/BPP. [OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, product_cd, granularity]
    • Email :
      • Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>
      • Email subject: <OU> TFS Notification - Missing Product Codes in SNSR assumption
        where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Notification - Missing Product Codes in SNSR assumption

        Content: This is an automated notification on the missing BPs/BPPs in SNSR assumption. Please review the missing BPs/BPPs in the attached Excel file. Please resubmit the system NSR and UC data (by country and bottler) with these missing BPs/BPPs to enable their case rate calculation in TFS. 

        Important steps to successful submission: 

        • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain YTD information by months. All granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
        • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain nsr_input_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
        • Submission :  use the <upload link> for system NSR and UC excel template submission.
        • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.

    • Recipient:
      • There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
        1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] and [email_others] where [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL'
          Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Sakshi) alignment with Finance.
        2. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'NSR_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv

    • Attachment:
      1. For each OU, attach an excel file with 5 columns - OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm, bpp_cd. Each OU's excel should contain its respective country list only, as per bottler config table.
        1. Attachment name will be <OU>-NSR-<monthname>-<missing-product-manual-sNSR-submission> where monthname example is July2024
    • Scheduling: on Day 1 of Week 1 and Week 2 in 445 month, after the completion of pipeline Global_TFS_Master_Pipeline

title: [Email reminder] Upload SNSR template
description:
This email is meant to remind users to submit manual excel files, every month. Depending on 445 month, the reminders will be send in either Week 2 (for non-quarter-end month) or Week 3 (quarter-end). Same Synapse pipeline will be used for reminders of different excel templates such as Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE.

  • This story is part of developing a Synapse pipeline that will eventually be used to send email reminders to users:
    • For different manual excel types (NSR, Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE)
    • For excel file submission summary by OU i.e. which all bottlers were submitted and processed sucessfully, which had warnings, which were not submitted at all 
    • At different schedules e.g. reminder for certain file type will be sent on W3D1 but reminder for another file type will be sent on W3D3
  • The focus of current story is to send users reminders to upload excel NSR templates. NSR upload reminder email will be sent at each OU level. So 8 emails are supposed to be sent out, for each of distinct dim_bottler_config [OU].

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification <x39605@coca-cola.com>

  • Content: 
Email subject: <OU> TFS Data Submission Reminder - System NSR and UC
where OU is distinct dim_bottler_config [OU] e.g. ASPOU TFS Data Submission Reminder - NSR and UC
Content: This is an automated reminder to submit system NSR and UC data (by country and bottler) to enable their case rate calculation in TFS. As per Blueprint configuration aligned with OU & FP&A , please refer to attachment for list of Country/bottlers where manual input case rate information is supposed to be submitted via excel input.

Important steps to successful submission: 

  • Data preparation: use the official template to prepare your input with the agreed granularity, it will contain YTD information by months. All granularity* (products or brand or category) should be included (*granularity dependent of the agreed blueprint).
  • Strict file naming convention: please use the official naming convention (file name should contain nsr_input_template) saved in .xlsx format and add user ID or country/FO at the end of file name.
  • Submission :  use the <upload link> for system NSR and UC excel template submission.
  • Review:  note that upon file submission, the submitter will be automatically notified by mail of processing outcome including any data issues that need to be reviewed. You will need to review data issues and fix it by re-submitting the data again with correction.
  • Upload links for each file type and environment are specified here. During UAT/PROD deployment, the paths in email should be automatically updated to reflect upload path for respective environment.
  • Recipients:  There will be 2 categories of email recipients:   
    1. Email ID specified in in dim_bottler_config [email_sdl] where [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL'
      Note: notification for email_sdl is to be enabled in PROD env only, upon confirmation from Product Owner's (Sakshi) alignment with Finance.
    2. Email ID specified in "EmailID" column of NotificationMailList.csv where Source = 'NSR_reminder'.  The csv is maintained at  landing/notification/NotificationMailList.csv
    3. Note: in future, there might be an ask from Finance to include dim_bottler_config [email_others] in recipient list, which needs to be parsed as semicolon-separated field. This parsing logic will be developed as part of current user story, but is to be disabled until further ask from Finance.
  • Attachment: For each OU, attach an excel file containing list of OU - Ctry_nm - bottler_cd - bottler_nm from dim_bottler_config where [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL'

  • Scheduling: 
    1. Same pipeline will be used to send out the first monthly file upload reminder emails for different excel templates (NSR, Bottler RE, Bottler Rebates, Master Data).
    2. Set Synapse pipeline trigger for every Monday and check following conditions.
    3. Check whether the pipeline run date (Monday) falls on Day 1 of the 445 month i.e. check if (dim_calendar [day_of_week] =1)  
    4. If above condition is satisfied then check if it is end month of 445 quarter i.e. c445_month_nbr is 3,6,9 or 12
      • If above condition is satisfied i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 3 or 6 or 9 or 12, AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '3' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
      • If above condition is not satisfied  i.e. if c445_month_nbr is 1,2,4,5,7,8,10,11 AND if c445_month_week_nbr = '2' then trigger the email reminder for NSR template
    5. Time of sending NSR upload reminder (TBC with Finance by Sakshi): 
      • 9am Singapore time (UTC +8) for GCMOU, ASPOU, JSKOU
      • 10am India time (UTC + 5:30)  for INSWA, EMEOU
      • 9am UTC for EOU, EOU 
      • 9am Eastern Time for LAOU
comments: Hello @Nikita Tseu One small change request - please update the highlighted red part from All granularity* to The configured granularity*

Hi @Nikita Tseu  please see the changes I made to user story description, and let me know for questions if any.  All changes are in email message/text. 
Plus I added the details from our previous comment for which columns will go in excel attachemtn.

Hi @Nikita Tseu , let me know if clear. Or we can get into a short call your today AM.


Questions related to OUs:
  1. There seems to be no reminder schedule for AOU in the story description. - Added. Note the change in scheduling of OUs. 

  2. Should we implement a dynamic fetching of OUs from the bottler config? By this, I mean should we fetch all unique OUs dynamically based on the contents of the bottler config and send a separate email for each of the discovered OUs? If so, we would need a "default" reminder schedule for unknown OUs. As an alternative, we could hardcode the existing eight OUs and send reminders only for them. - 
    1. Fetch all unique OUs dynamically based on the contents of the bottler config and send a separate email for each of the discovered OUs. 
    2. Dynamically fetch OUs from bottler config and set default time for new OUs as 9am Eastern Time. My expectation and definition of new OUs is - those which are discovered in bottler config but for which we have not set explicit triggers.


Questions related to reminder content:
The story appears to lack a specific details on what exactly should be included into the reminder. To clarify this, I'd like to ask a few questions.
  1. Should the report be an attachment, or should we present the data right in the email body, similar to how data processing notifications are built? If the report is to be an attachment, should it be a directly attached file or a download link?  - Which report are you referring to? The story ask is to send an attachment containing bottlers for respective OU, to which the email is being sent. Or are you referring to something else?



  2. What should be the structure of the presented data? Are we just providing a list of bottler ids (BOTTLER_CD + CTRY_CD)? Or do we need to send more detailed information?  In Attachment excel, there will be be 4 columns - OU, ctry_nm, bottler_cd, bottler_nm. 

  3. Should the reminder only include bottlers that have not been submitted in the current month? Or should it be a summary of all existing bottlers with their submission statuses? - I have deliberately omitted the ask /complexity from current user story to check for submission status of bottlers.  This will be the first email reminder sent to OUs to submit data, regardless on when they last submitted it. There will be separate user story to track submission status, and the tracking email will be sent to OUs 3 working days after initial reminder email.  If you foresee any linkage between the 2 that could impact your current development, let me know what more details are needed, although I think the current story already has sufficient details for its scope.

  4. Am I correct in assuming that the C445_MONTH_CD for submitted bottlers doesn't need to be considered when generating the reminder content? In other words, in the context of this functionality, are we only interested in whether a particular bottler has been submitted, irrespective of the associated C445_MONTH_CD? Again, in this story we are not tracking whether a bottler has been submitted in current 445 month. However, you are correct that we will be checking C445_MONTH_CD in the future Submission Status user story to check whether bottler data was submitted in current month or no.

Hello @Sakshi Joshi! 

After I started working on this story, several questions have arisen. For clarity, I've split them into two logical groups. Will appreciate your answers!

Questions related to OUs:
  1. There seems to be no reminder schedule for AOU in the story description. 

  2. Should we implement a dynamic fetching of OUs from the bottler config? By this, I mean should we fetch all unique OUs dynamically based on the contents of the bottler config and send a separate email for each of the discovered OUs? If so, we would need a "default" reminder schedule for unknown OUs. As an alternative, we could hardcode the existing eight OUs and send reminders only for them.

Questions related to reminder content:
The story appears to lack a specific details on what exactly should be included into the reminder. To clarify this, I'd like to ask a few questions.
  1. Should the report be an attachment, or should we present the data right in the email body, similar to how data processing notifications are built? If the report is to be an attachment, should it be a directly attached file or a download link? 

  2. What should be the structure of the presented data? Are we just providing a list of bottler ids (BOTTLER_CD + CTRY_CD)? Or do we need to send more detailed information? 

  3. Should the reminder only include bottlers that have not been submitted in the current month? Or should it be a summary of all existing bottlers with their submission statuses? 

  4. Am I correct in assuming that the C445_MONTH_CD for submitted bottlers doesn't need to be considered when generating the reminder content? In other words, in the context of this functionality, are we only interested in whether a particular bottler has been submitted, irrespective of the associated C445_MONTH_CD?

Hi @Nikita Tseu  broadly the requirements for email reminders to users have been documented in this story for NSR template. The flow will more or less remain the same. Difference will be in conditions to be met for other templates like Master Data, Rebates, Bottler RE etc. e.g.  [data_src_nsr] = 'EXCEL' will not apply to Master Data.

title: [Logic App] Disable an email notification for skipped ingestion runs
description:
Currently, for each type of input file, if there are no files to ingest, an email notification is sent to the TFS Support team. Given that we deal with 6 types of files across 3 environments, and these pipelines are mostly triggered on an hourly basis, this results in an overwhelming number of notifications. Additionally, these notifications do not provide any valuable information to the development team, as we do not utilize data about skipped runs.

TODO: Remove the activity that triggers skipped run notifications from all six manual file ingestion logic app workflows. This will reduce unnecessary email traffic and streamline our notification process.

Currently the manual file ingestion submission only notify our team and the submitter.

TODO

title: [ETL] Build Logic App flow to move Rebate Actual excel file from Sharepoint to ADLS landing
description:
Logic App changes
  1. A new Logic App workflow "la-tccc-tfs-<env>-rebate-excel-ingestion" needs to be developed to drop NSR excel file from Sharepoint to Landing zone, and trigger  Rebate_Actual_Tempate_Ingestion pipeline. Where env is dev/uat/prod.
  2. LA flow will run every 1 hour on production.

  3. Source location for logic app is TFS -> Manual Data Upload -> <OU> -> Rebate Actual -> Input folder on this path for each of the 9 OUs. for example,   Input folder for ASPOU
    So LA has to recursively check "Rebate Actual"  folder inside each of the OUs at above path.
  4. Drop location for Logic App is tfs/landing/manual_submission/rebate/

  5. When searching in sharepoint source folder, LA will pick up files with "rebate_actual_template" string in file name. Files will be picked up based on the order (time) in which they were placed on sharepoint folder. Older file to be picked up first. 
    1. If file name is missing "rebate_actual_template", do not drop file to landing. Instead, notify user to submit expected file name and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template.

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/Rebate Actual/Input

      The file was not processed due to missing "rebate_actual_template" in file name . Please amend file name and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>


  6. Checks to be performed by LA:
    1. Is file format .xlsx? If not, do not drop the file on landing. Instead, notify user to submit nsr_input_template in .xlsx format and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template:

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/Rebate Actual/Input

      The file was not processed due to invalid format. Valid file format is .xlsx . Please amend and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

  7. File name will be renamed as <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx before dropping it on ADLS. Where submitter email is taken from sharepoint, and timestamp is when the file was uploaded on sharepoint by user.
  8. Following email notification will be sent to submitter once file is picked up from sharepoint Input folder:
    Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

    You have uploaded
    File: <original filename>
    Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/Rebate Actual/Input

    The file has been moved as:
    Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx
    Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

    The file will be processed in TFS, and valid data will be available in monthly forecast table upon next forecast run.
  9. As a very last step, Logic app flow should move the file to Archive sub-folder of that OU - Rebate Actual path. example, Archive for ASPOU
comments:
Hi @Aliaksei Milto I made a mistake in user story description. Could you please update the message for successful upload to below? Sorry for the re-work.

The file will be processed in TFS, and valid data will be available in Rebate Actual table in TFS backend database.

title: Create dbo.PMR_FACT_RATES view on tfs db
description: TFS dashboard requires FX rates for currency calculations, and the rates will be sourced from PMR_FACT_RATES view that will be made available in tfs db as part of this user story.
comments:
@Dennis Lee 

Taking into account that tfs db setup script is outdated and is not idempotent I would suggest not to modify it in order to avoid risk of breaking anything in the existing setup.
Let's proceed with separate idempotent script you've created.

cc @Sakshi Joshi @Aparna Kanjarla @Runfeng Han

SQL script for reference

USE tfs;

-- Init
DECLARE @SQLString NVARCHAR(MAX);
DECLARE @current_environment NVARCHAR(10);
DECLARE @data_source_location NVARCHAR(250);

-- Get ServerName
DECLARE @ServerName NVARCHAR(128) = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('ServerName') AS NVARCHAR(128));

-- Get current_environment
SET @current_environment = (
    SELECT value
    FROM STRING_SPLIT(@ServerName, '-', 1)
    WHERE ordinal = 5
)
PRINT @current_environment

-- Set data_source_location
SET @data_source_location = CASE @current_environment
    WHEN 'dev' THEN 'sause2tcccfhbdev0001'
    WHEN 'test' THEN 'sause2tcccfhbtest0001'
    WHEN 'prod' THEN 'sause2tcccfhbprod0003'
    WHEN 'proddr' THEN 'sausctcccfhbproddr0003'
END
PRINT @data_source_location

-- Create external data sources
IF NOT EXISTS(
    SELECT name
    FROM sys.external_data_sources
    WHERE name = 'external_data_source_refined'
)
BEGIN
    SET @SQLString =
        'CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE external_data_source_refined WITH (LOCATION = '
        + QUOTENAME('abfss://refined@' + @data_source_location + '.dfs.core.windows.net', '''')
        + ', CREDENTIAL = SynapseIdentity)';
    EXEC sp_executesql @SQLString;
END

@Runfeng Han 
  1. View creation script for pmr_fact_rates has been added to `tfs view creation.sql`
  2. for consistency with existing tfs views, i have set the schema, and view name to dbo.pmr_fact_rates

  4.  Currently, I see there is a predeployment script `tfs db setup`. ​However ...
    1. ​This script does not seem to be the latest, and holds old secrets
    2. The script is as well not idempotent
    3. As part of this user story, I've created a new external_data_source_refined to point to Finhub's refined zone and read from the delta table there
      1. This new idempotent script can be found currently in `tfs_2_create_new_external_data_source`
Question
  1. I do not wish to deviate from TFS's routine and introduce new scripts for predeployment. 
    1. Do you prefer the new script snippet to be appended into `tfs db setup`, but I include annotation to indicate to run ONLY selective snippet in the higher environment
cc @Sakshi Joshi , @Aparna Kanjarla

Note that the view will point to the delta table outside of the TFS container. We need to grant access to the read access AD group.

Or we can replicate the delta table and place the copy in TFS ADLS container

title: [DB View] Implement customized view logic for dbo.pmr_fact_rates
description:
From Jean:
In order to have 12 months of rates for both current year and outer year,  I recommend you leverage "RE" as defined by the DimPMRSCENARIO  "SC_FLAG" column.
You would need to join the Rates FACT table using the RT_SC_ID column to the DimScenario table on the SC_ID column, then filter the SC_FLAG = RE.

The only caveat would be Feb BP submission cycle where we do not have RE but only BP.  The logic we use elsewhere is if RE, use RE esle BP.

Analysis:


To do:
Need to implement customized view logic for dbo.pmr_fact_rates
so that the delta table pmr/OTHERS/FACT_RATES (tbl_fact)
left join on the delta table behind [dbo].[PMR_DM_SCENARIO] (tbl_scenario)
on tbl_fact.RT_SC_ID = tbl_scenario.SC_ID
where SC_FLAG in ('RE','BP')
comments:
The below query for reference:
With rate as (
SELECT *
FROM 
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK N'pmr/OTHERS/FACT_RATES/',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'external_data_source_refined',
        FORMAT='DELTA'
    )  AS [result]
),
scenario as (
SELECT *
FROM 
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK N'pmr/DIM/DM_SCENARIO/',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'external_data_source_refined',
        FORMAT='DELTA'
    )  AS [result]
)
select  rate.* FROM
rate
LEFT JOIN scenario
on rate.RT_SC_ID = scenario.SC_ID
where SC_FLAG in ('RE','BP')

title: [ETL] New column "version" to add to the BP template
description:
Context:
Isabelle Schoepp: BP 2025 data availability and generation
FP&A requests to add a new column "version" the template of the BP file, so that they could compare between different versions of BP data. The values for the "version" field will be provided in the file, with the convention of year+period+BP (3 digit of month), e.g.
  • 2025SepBP
  • 2025AugBP
  • 2025FebBP
