title: [ETL] Apply BP-based case rate to Hyperion BP Data
description:
Context:
Isabelle Schoepp: Official BP - UC & sNSR - data collection & transformati...
We have implemented the BP data allocation mentioned in Isabelle's step1. We need to work on her step2 where we will apply BP-based case rate to Hyperion Data at BPP level.
The existing ingestion & allocation process of the BP files remains unchanged, except for the destination table path. Instead of writing the data to the final table fact_bp, we need to write the processed data to a new staging table stage_bp_ou. 
We need to build a new ingestion & allocation & calculation process for the BP file submitted by FP&A, which is extracted from Hyperion ("Hyperion BP file").
  1. ingestion: file will be ingested to stage_bp_hyperion directly without transformation. There will be UC values only. 
  2. allocation: triggered by new incoming data to the stage_bp_ou. Allocation logic refers to the "Logic" section below
  3. calculation: after allocation to BPP level, use the BPP level UC and sNSR in stage_bp_ou to calculate the case rate and apply the case rate to the Hyperion UC to generate the sNSR.
  4. Finally write the result data to fact_bp

Logic:
  1. Allocate volume from BP to BPP according to dim_bottler_config
    1. if manual submission of BP data is at BPP level, allocate the volume according to the ratio of actual UC in refined/manual_submission/bp/stage_bp_ou
    2. if manual submission of BP data is at BP level, allocate the volume according to the ratio of actual UC in recent 6 months (same as the existing BP allocation logic) in refined/fact_sales_global (if step1 manual submission is at BP level)
  2. Apply the bpp-level case rate from stage_bp_ou to the records in Hyperion Data
Plot: 
Existing logic:
New logic:

Note:
  1. Hyperion BP file will use the same template as the existing BP file
  2. stage_bp_ou and stage_bp_hyperion will use the same table schema as fact_bp, so we can reuse the ingestion code.
 
To do:
  1. change the destination table path for the existing BP file ingestion and allocation process from /refined/manual_submission/bp/fact_bp to refined/manual_submission/bp/stage_bp_ou
  2. a new manual submission pipeline for the Hyperion BP files. Hyperion BP files will be submitted to a new sharepoint folder
    1. logic app changes. Either modify the existing logic app job for BP file, or create a new one. Trigger frequency will be the same as the existing BP job
      1. <*update> Stan chose to create a new SharePoint folder. the path is: Manual Data Upload/FP&A/HyperionBP
      2. the file name should contain "bp_hyperion_input_template"
    2. Synapse pipeline changes.
  3. <*NEW> We will use the same validation process #218498 as the existing BP file for the new Hyperion BP file with 1 exception 
    1. Exception: for the validation logic of the "product_cd" field. Since the Hyperion dataset will always be at BP (beverage product) level, we will not need to refer to the "granularity_bp" field in dim_bottler_config, but always treat the "product_cd" as a BP code
  4. a new notebook (?) for allocating the Hyperion BP data from BP level to BPP level. The process is triggered after new OU BP file is ingested and allocated, and write final BP data into fact_BP (Need input from the developer: whether to create a new notebook or build the process in the existing BP_Data_Allocation notebook)
  5. create 2 views for stage_bp_ou and stage_bp_hyperion
comments:
About the technical columns:
'PIPELINE_RUN_ID', - it should be from either stage_bp_hyperion or stage_bp_ou, depending on which submission triggers the allocation process
'PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP', - it will be the time when the allocation process takes place
'SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP', - it will be SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP from the from stage_bp_ou 
'SUBMITTED_BY', - it will be SUBMITTED_BY from stage_bp_ou
'SOURCE_FILE', - it will be SOURCE_FILE from stage_bp_ou
'BP_DATA_SOURCE' - it will be BP_DATA_SOURCE from stage_bp_ou

Hi @Stanislau Hryhoryeu 
  1. She means that the OU could submit the manual BP file (not the Hyperion NP file) for some countries multiple times, where the latter submission will override the existing one. it is the same as the existing BP file ingestion process. 
  2. Your assumption is not true, if by "as full snapshot" you mean it will be a full reload of the delta table every time they submit the Hyperion BP file. As I mentioned in the previous comment:However, if by "as full snapshot" you mean a full snapshot of a partition [C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD, VERISON], then your assumption is correct.
  3. The sequence in your description is correct. 
    1. for your point 4, you are correct. As I stated in the previous comment, 
  4. yes, all the volume and sNSR will be assigned to a single BPP

Hi @Runfeng Han! Want to clarify some questions on this ticket:
1) In the discussion thread with Isabelle, Ada replied about the upload order of OU and Hyperion files. 

What does she mean by "OU BP will override when necessary"? 

2) During implementation i made assumption that Hyperion data will always be submitted as full snapshot. Is this assumption correct?

3) Want to confirm final order of data upload and allocation:
As of now the sequence is
  1. FP&A submit Hyperion data first and we do not run allocation, and data is accumulated in stage_bp_hyperion the same way as in stage_bp_ou, by replacing/creating partitions [C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD, VERISON]
  2. BP ou data is submitted next and at this point we run allocation according the the logic
    1. I assumed that we do the allocation only for the latest submitted Hyperion data, using only the latest submitted OU data. Is this assumption correct?
  3. If PB OU data gets resubmitted, we repeat step 2
  4. If Hyperion data gets resubmitted, i assume we take from stage_bp_ou only the [C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD, VERISON] that exist in the latest Hyperion data snapshot. Is this correct?
4) Regarding your previous answer

Im i correct, thinking that after this process BP from Hyperion data, that dosent have allocation data in stage_bp_ou or fact_sales_global, will have just a single BPP after allocation?

Hi @Nikita Tseu @Stanislau Hryhoryeu 

  1. We will use the same ingestion approach as the current manual BP file, i.e. incremental ingestion by overwriting the partitions. The partition columns are the same set of columns as the existing fact_bp, i.e. [C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD, VERISON]
  2. Same as the current manual BP file, it will be in Excel
  3. You are right, I asked FP&A about the sequence previously and they did not reply to it. let me ask them again. 
    1. Ideally the Hyperion BP file should be submitted before the manual BP files. But in case of resubmission of the Hyperion BP, the allocation process needs to be triggered upon Hyperion BP file submission, too. The allocation process will be ran for the impacted [C445_MONTH_CD, CTRY_CD, BOTTLER_CD, VERISON]
  4. Your understanding is correct. The objective is to use the volume in the Hyperion BP data as the baseline, from where we allocate the volume to the BPP level, and calculate the sNSR at the BPP level. So stage_bp_ou will provide the info for
    1. list of BPPs
      1. uc ratios of the BPPs
    2. case rate of the BPPs
  5. We should ignore those BPPs
  6. For the BP in the Hyperion file that have no underlying BPPs in stage_bp_ou or fact_sales_global, we will allocate its volume to the 1st available BPP code under the BP in dim_isscom_product_mapping
  7. I'm asking FP&A for their advice here. For now, for cases where the BP only exists in the Hyperion data, but there is no corresponding BP/BPPs in the OU data, we will set the case rate as 0 (so the sNSR will be 0 in fact_bp).

Hi @Runfeng Han
I have a few questions regarding this story and would appreciate your clarification.

  1. What is the agreed ingestion approach for Hyperion BP data? Is it a full reload, incremental ingestion, or a full reload by year? 

  2. What is the input file format - Excel or CSV?

  3. ⁠The user story mentions that the allocation for Hyperion data should be triggered each time the manual OU BP data is ingested. But what about the Hyperion data ingestion itself? It should also include the allocation step, right?

  4. With the introduction of Hyperion data, it seems that the only use of OU BP data is to get UC ratios for the allocation and case_rate values for the sNSR calculation. Is that correct? Or does the stage_bp_ou table serve any other purpose?

  5. ⁠During the allocation it's possible that some BPP codes are missing in the stage_bp_ou or fact_sales_global tables but the corresponding BP-BPP combination exists in dim_isscom_product_mapping. Should such BPP codes be included to the fact_bp table with zero UC and NSR values, or should they just be ignored?

  6. How to handle a scenario when a product is present in Hyperion data, but stage_bp_ou or fact_sales_global don't have any records to do the allocation for this product?

  7. How to handle a scenario when it's possible to do the allocation for a product (for example based on fact_sales_global data), but case_rate values for this product are not available in stage_bp_ou.
CC: @Stanislau Hryhoryeu
@stanis
I think both approaches should be fine, but we need the user to give a file name with bp_hyperion_input_template, to differentiate from the original bp_input_template
We will treat this as low priority,as the BP submission happens only 1 to 2 times a year

@Dennis Lee @Nikita Tseu @Aliaksei Milto when you have time please review the use story. Do you think we should 
  1. have a separate Sharepoint folder outside of the existing /BP directory, and create a new logic app, or
  2. create a new subfolder inside /BP directory, e.g. /BP/Hyperion, and reuse the existing logic app to pick up the file and place it to ADLS

title: [ETL] Implement data validation checks for BP file
description:
Since BP excel is a manually prepared input to TFS, some data quality & schema validation checks will be done on submitted files. Users will be notified of issues that lead to partial / complete rejection of the file.
File with rejected records or records with warnings should be stored at tfs/reject/manual_submission/bp

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification

  • Email subject: TFS-<env>-BP_Excel_Ingestion-<status> Notification
    where env is DEV/UAT/PROD and status is "Successful" or "Failure" or "Successful with Warnings"

  • Receiver: <submitter email id>, apac-mep-support@coca-cola.com
  • Pipeline ID: <ID>

  • Loading Details: 
    • for Schema check failures, display corresponding notification message in this section

    • for Data Quality check failures or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was processed with errors or warnings. Please refer to the attachment in this link for list of rejected records, and resubmit the file after required corrections."
      <ADLS rejected path to download the file. Replace any spaces in submitted file name with underscore _ so that link does not break>

    • for successful file loads i.e. no errors or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was successfully loaded to TFS. Data will be reflected in Fact BP table."

Excel Validation Type Validation Sub-type Expected value Status Means of notification Notification message
BP_Input_Template Schema Tab name BP (case insensitive) Error.
Reject entire file 		Email body Expected "BP" tab was missing for submitted file <filename>. Please ensure this tab name is present in file, with required bottler data for BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt, BP_btlr_vol
BP_Input_Template Schema Column names c445_month_cd
ctry_cd
bottler_cd
channel_cd
product_cd
BP_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt
BP_btlr_vol
 Error.
Reject entire file 		Email body Submitted file <filename> is expected to contain following mandatory columns: <expected column names separated by comma>

Columns found missing:

Please ensure all mandatory columns are included in BP tab and resubmit the file.
BP_Input_Template Data Quality c445_month_cd YYYYMM format. Validate if YYYY between 2000 - 2500, MM between 01 - 12. Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "BP validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid month format. Should be valid YYYYMM value."
BP_Input_Template Data Quality ctry_cd Cannot be blank.
- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'SET', then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in BP file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd_set_hyperion] combination

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'EXCEL', then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in BP file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd] combination
 Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "BP validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid country code - bottler code combination. Should be valid code that exists in bottler blueprint."
BP_Input_Template Data Quality bottler_cd - Cannot be blank

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'SET', then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in BP file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd_set_hyperion] combination

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] = 'EXCEL', then ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in BP file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd] combination

- If dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] is null/blank, then the record should be rejected since source of bottler code cannot be determined
 Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "BP validation" tab.  When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] is not null:
Error: "The country code - bottler code combination was not found in bottler blueprint. Note that if bottler is configured to use SET as BP data source, mapping between SET and NSR Datalake bottler codes should be provided in bottler blueprint. This bottler is configured to use <dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp]> for BP submission."

When dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] is null:
Error: Bottler's BP source was not specified in bottler blueprint. Please update BP source as Excel or SET in TFS blueprint table.
BP_Input_Template Data Quality channel_cd No validation rule needed yet as this is hardcoded as "NA" during ingestion Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "BP validation" tab.  -
BP_Input_Template Data Quality product_cd 1. Cannot be blank

2. Depending on dim_bottler_config [granularity_bp] for submitted  country_cd + bottler_cd:
i. For "BEVERAGE_CATEGORY" product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [category_code]

ii. For "BRAND" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 3. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Brand_Code]

iii. For "BP" -  LPAD zeroes if string length < 4. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Beverage_Product_Code]

iv. For "BPP" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 10. After LPAD, product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [bpp_cd]

v. For [granularity_bp] as null or any other value than BEVERAGE_CATEGORY / BRAND / BP/  BPP, the bottler records should be rejected 		Error.

As per BP granularity for bottler <bottler_cd>-<bottler_nm> in bottler blueprint, valid <product granularity> code is expected."
Where <product granularity> = dim_bottler_config [granularity_bp]

For any other or null  granularity_bp values, error message will be: "BP granularity in bottler blueprint was either blank or an unexpected value. Valid BP granularity values are Beverage_Category, Brand, BP, BPP. Please update and re-submit bottler blueprint file."

'- Should be decimal point number, including 0 / positive / negative.
- NO percentages or special characters.

"Warning: BP revenue was submitted as 0 or blank. Blank values are loaded as 0 in TFS. Please review the submitted data and resubmit if necessary"
BP_Input_Template Data Quality BP_btlr_vol Reject record if following checks fail:
- Should be decimal point number, including 0 / positive / negative.
- NO percentages or special characters.

"Warning: BP Volume was submitted as 0 or blank. Blank values are loaded as 0 in TFS. Please review the data and resubmit if necessary"

title: [Hotfix][Processing] Null volume BP allocation due to records with 0 volume
description:
Context:
Nikita Tseu [C]: BP data allocation - handling a corner case

There's a scenario where a product has data over the past 6 months, yet the UC for all entries is zero. Our standard allocation logic is not able to handle such cases, as the total UC over the 6 months is zero which makes it impossible to compute a UC weightage required for the allocation. Currently this leads to an issue with such products having NULL NSR and UC values in the final table.

Solution: 
we should remove such BPPs from the list of BPPs for allocation. If there is no other BPP under this product (at BP level) after the removal, use the same logic which handles products without 6-month historical data (i.e. innovation product, use the dummy BPP code provided by FP&A #233370 )
To do:
Code changes to be done in notebook BP_Data_Allocation

title: [Processing] BP data allocation
description:
The new requirement from FP&A on 30th May's meeting.

BP datasets from SET are always at the BPP level. However, the BP datasets submitted manually could be at other granularities (category, brand, BP)

Updated: alignment with FP&A on the allocation logic:
Allocating the volume according to the ratio of actual UC in the latest month in the datalake (at BPP level).
  1. special case: in January when the BP data is submitted, there could be newly launched Brands/BPs in the BP dataset where all the underlying BPPs do not exist in the December actual.
    1. solution: simply assign the average volume to all underlying BPPs for such cases
For sNSR, apply the same case rate to calculate the sNSR

Do the allocation after the existing ingestion notebook in the same pipeline. 
Code flow:
  1. reading from the fact_bp
  2. calculate the case rate at higher level
  3. allocating the higher level UC to BPP only for those bottlers according to the dim_bottler_config
  4. apply the case rate the the allocated UC to have the sNSR
  5. write the data back to the fact_bp to overwrite the [C445_MONTH_CD,CTRY_CD,BOTTLER_CD] partition
comments: Hi @Aparna Kanjarla, the user has provided the test file. Please find the file attached

Hi @Aparna Kanjarla  we received the following from Finance for BP allocation testing:
  1. Attached BP_input_template with bottler records having BP, BPP, Brand codes and UC only,  since Release 1 has Volume in scope from Finance perspective. However, I added a few mock revenue data to rows to enable our case rate testing.
  2. BP_granularities_for_DEV_Testing.xslx containing ctry_cd - bottler_cd - BP granularity records for bottlers in BP_input_template. For the purpose of our testing, think we need to temporarily/manually update BP granularity on DEV dim_bottler_config. @Nikita Tseu , this is doable I believe?
    Please take backup and ensure to revert dim_bottler_config to its current state after testing is completed on DEV.  
Needless to say, this data should be used only for DEV testing. UAT should remain untouched 😊

cc @Runfeng Han
Hi @Aparna, we've aligned with FP&A on the allocation logic. Please see the updated description

Possible approaches have been proposed to FP&A. Development is pending on their alignment.

We are proposing 2 possible approaches for the allocation to bring such BP datasets to the same grain as the others at BPP level:
  1. In the meeting it was mentioned that if a country is planning at BP (beverage product) or Brand level, they don't do analysis at BPP level BP (biz plan) data. In this case, is it needed to allocate the UC & sNSR to specific BPPs?
    • Approach 1: if not needed, we can simply assign all the UC & sNSR of the brand/beverage product to 1 single underlying BPP 
  2. Approach 2: If detailed BPPs are needed, we have to allocate the total UC & sNSR to every BPP. Currently I can only think of allocating it according to the ratio of actual UC in the previous year in the datalake (at BPP level).
    1. But such logic will fail for the new BPPs in the current year's business planning.

title: [ETL][Hyperion Data] Step 1: create delta table and load historical data in flat files
description:
Context:
We are to build the ETL pipeline to extract data from the Hyperion data in FinHub and store it in TFS. However, since the Hyperion data in FinHub only covers 2024, we need to create a new delta table in TFS and load the historical data from flat file into it.

To do:

    SC_ID Year Month Profticenter Planning_Partner BP_Code Unit Case
    OEP_ACTUAL 2024 JAN PC_10282 PP_0101 BP_0001 45645

title: [TFS] [Finhub] Fix disappearing permissions for the CPS user
description:
Context:
Whenever the "tfs view creation" script is executed, it drops and recreates the fact_ko_historical view, which resets all permissions for this view. Consequently, tfs_cps_user repeatedly loses select permissions on the fact_ko_historical view.

TODO:
Modify the "tfs view creation" script to verify the existence of the tfs_cps_user and grant select permissions on the fact_ko_historical view if the user exists. Feel free to use the code snippet below to speed up the work.
 


IF NOT EXISTS(
    SELECT *
    FROM sys.database_principals
    WHERE name = 'tfs_cps_user'
)
BEGIN
    GRANT SELECT ON fact_ko_historical TO [tfs_cps_user]
END;

title: [ETL] Manual file ingestion: Rebate Actual file
description:
Synapse pipeline changes
  1. A new excel ingestion pipeline Rebate_Actual_Template_Ingestion will be built under TFS - ETL - Manual Ingestion folder on synapse workspace. 

  2. Pipeline will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up files from tfs/landing/manual_submission/rebate/ for processing.
  3. If Logic app detects multiple files inside an OU folder, it will drop them to landing and trigger Synapse pipeline to sequentially process these files, starting from oldest timestamp.

Processing and ADLS changes:
  1. rebate_actual_template excel can have data for multiple countries and bottlers, which will likely belong to same OU.  File for ASPOU is attached.

  2. "rebate_actual_template" will be ingested to following tables on Refined zone tfs db - dbo.fact_rebate_actual . 
  3. Data should be read from "Rebate" tab (case insensitive) in rebate_actual_template excel.
  4. Storage locations:

    Landing zone: tfs/landing/manual_submission/rebate/<filename>.xlsx

    Stage zone: tfs/stage/manual_submission/rebate/fact_rebate_actual/<PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP>/<Parquet file>

    Raw zone: tfs/raw/manual_submission/rebate/fact_rebate_actual (Delta table)

    Refined zone: tfs/refined/manual_submission/rebate/fact_rebate_actual (Delta table)

    Archive zone: tfs/archive/manual_submission/rebate/<filename>.xlsx

  5. fact_rebate_actual schema will be as follows. Both table and overlying view should be created.
    Reading of excel columns should be case insensitive.
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd -  similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. version - String. Either "AC" or "BP" always, which will be checked as part of separate data validation story
    5. rebate_amt  - float
    6. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    7. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    8. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    9. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    10. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
  6. Partitioning of data in fact_rebate_actual : Developer to discuss if partitioning can be done simply on C445_MONTH_CD.  Since each C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD combination will have exactly one record.

  7.  fact_rebate_actual table will be updated on Refined zone when C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD from excel file already exists in table. Else new record will be inserted.
  8. Null or blank rebate_amt  should be stored as zero in Refined.
  9. fact_rebate_actual  table will be upserted with new, valid records every time a new rebate_actual_input_template excel is submitted. Records that fail validation checks will not be added there. Validation checks and user email notification will be implemented as part of separate user story.
  10. Handling of duplicate records in excel ​: If multiple records exist in excel for same C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD, then rebate_amt  column will be respectively summed up. 
  11. After the processing the input file should be moved to the corresponding archive folder on ADLS: tfs/archive/manual_submission/rebate
comments:
@Aliaksei Milto 
  • column name in excel should be ctry_cd
  • "Rebate" tab (case insensitive) should be read for data
Revised file is attached. There were changes to template made by Finance, since I last uploaded it.

@Nikita Tseu

Hi @Sakshi Joshi!

In file as I can see column with country code is named CTRY_CD, but in file it's COUNTRY_CD, which name should we use?
And what is expected Sheet name? Or we can keep 'Sheet1'?

cc @Nikita Tseu

title: [ETL] Implement data validation checks for Rebate file
description:
Since Rebate excel is a manually prepared input to TFS, some data quality & schema validation checks will be done on submitted files. Users will be notified of issues that lead to partial / complete rejection of the file.
File with rejected records or records with warnings should be stored at tfs/reject/manual_submission/bp

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification

  • Email subject: TFS-<env>-Rebate_Excel_Ingestion-<status> Notification
    where env is DEV/UAT/PROD and status is "Successful" or "Failure" or "Successful with Warnings"

  • Receiver: <submitter email id>, apac-mep-support@coca-cola.com
  • Pipeline ID: <ID>

  • Loading Details: 
    • for Schema check failures, display corresponding notification message in this section

    • for Data Quality check failures or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was processed with errors or warnings. Please refer to the attachment in this link for list of rejected records, and resubmit the file after required corrections."
      <ADLS rejected path to download the file. Replace any spaces in submitted file name with underscore _ so that link does not break>

    • for successful file loads i.e. no errors or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was successfully loaded to TFS. Data will be reflected in Fact Rebate table."

    • A summary table consisting of status for all submitted bottlers will be placed inside email body.  The Bottler IDs will be sorted in sequence of Failed, Warning, Passed statuses.

  • Validation rules -

bottler_cd
version
rebate_amt
 Error.

Columns found missing:

Please ensure all mandatory columns are included in Rebate tab and resubmit the file.

- ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in Rebate file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd] combination
 Error.

rebate_actual_template Data Quality bottler_cd - Cannot be blank.

- ctry_cd - bottler_cd combination submitted in Rebate file should exist in dim_bottler_config's [ctry_cd] - [bottler_cd] combination

- valid value is "AC" 		    Error: "version cannot be left blank."

title: [ETL] Build Logic App flow to move bottler Bottler RE excel file from Sharepoint to ADLS landing
description:
Logic App changes
  1. A new Logic App workflow "la-tccc-tfs-<env>-bottlerre-excel-ingestion" needs to be developed to drop Bottler RE excel file from Sharepoint to Landing zone, and trigger  Bottler_RE_Template_Ingestion pipeline. Where env is dev/uat/prod.
  2. LA flow will run every 1 hour on production.

  3. Source location for logic app is TFS -> Manual Data Upload -> <OU> -> Bottler RE -> Input folder on this path for each of the 9 OUs on this path 
    So LA has to recursively check Bottler RE folder inside each of the OUs at above path.
  4. Drop location for Logic App is tfs/landing/manual_submission/bottler_re/

  5. When searching in sharepoint source folder, LA will pick up files with "Bottler_RE_template" string in file name. Files will be picked up based on the order (time) in which they were placed on sharepoint folder. Older file to be picked up first.

  6. Checks to be performed by LA:
    1. is file format .xlsx? If not, do not drop the file on landing and notify user to submit Bottler_RE_template in .xlsx format.

  7. File name will be renamed as <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx before dropping it on ADLS. Where submitter email is taken from sharepoint, and timestamp is when the file was uploaded on sharepoint by user.
  8. Following email notification will be sent to submitter once file is picked up from sharepoint Input folder:
    Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

    You have uploaded
    File: <original filename>
    Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/Manual Data Upload/ASPOU/Bottler RE/Input

    The file has been moved as:
    Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx
    Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

    The file will be processed in TFS, and you will receive email notification upon completion of processing.
  9. As a very last step, Logic app flow should move the file to Archive sub-folder of that OU - Bottler RE path.  https://groups.coca-cola.com/sites/FinanceHub/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?csf=1&web=1&e=7yGeQP&cid=4cef093a%2D88ea%2D485f%2D9d57%2Df5dc887b6193&FolderCTID=0x0120002281E8E9D9FBD24D934910BD09D78388&id=%2fsites%2fFinanceHub%2fShared%20Documents%2fTFS%2fManual%20Data%20Upload%2fASPOU%2fBottler%20RE%2fArchive&viewid=8c55e7cf%2D7a5b%2D4720%2D89af%2Dca986f33d62f
comments: Completing Pull Request 23769 and the associated work items.

Hi @Runfeng Han  given there are simply too many (7) manual excel files in TFS 2.0, we need to split ADO refinement between the 2 of us. Each excel file has 3 related stories:
  • Move from sharepoint to landing and trigger synapse pipeline
  • Ingestion and store to tfs table/view
  • data quality validations
4 have been refined or developed so far (NSR, Incidence master data, BP and Rebate Actual).  
Can you refine Bottler RE and Hyperion RE?  I'll take PY. Files provided by FP&A at template with test data need to be attached on story.

Please take any earlier Excel story as example and provide similar level of detail / standard naming convention for columns and table etc. The team shared feedback during Monday's estimation that they need to have that level of detail in story, to be able to accurately estimate and also keep proper documentation of the change.

title: [Post processing] Data patch for products start to have actual after proj_start_date
description:
Context:
In the final table, we observe there are products that only have a few lines of records. For example:


Root cause:
The products start to have actual after proj_start_date of the country. 

In the above example, for version 202338 (forecast run in September), the proj_start_date for Austria is 2023-07-01 (calculated based on the data availability across the different bottlers). Hence for the product 0001053651, there was no forecast conducted. 
However, in the post processing, we have the rule to use as much actual data as possible based on the data availability of the bottlers. 
(Code doing this: )


Therefore, we are seeing there are records only for the actual volume for 0001053651 in the final tables.

Objective:
In the final tables (monthly, weekly, no need for the daily table), to have the dummy records with UC value 0.0001 (ZERO_SUBSITUTE = 0.0001) until end of the current year. For example, for 0001053651, in the fact_forecast_result_monthly_RE it will have 3 new records with c445_month_cd '202310', '202311', '202312'.

How to do:
2 possible approaches to identify such products for you to choose @Aparna Kanjarla 
  1. similar approach as we did for #129884 . The bpps marked as "OTHER" are actually the products that only have actual but no forecast. 
  2. If the max(c445_month_cd) < the last month of the current year, then populate the dummy records until end of the current year.
comments:
Query:

SELECT [ctry_cd]
,[bottler_cd]
,[bev_prod_cd]
,[c445_month_cd]
,[UC]
,[nsr_lc]
,[version]
 FROM [dbo].[fact_forecast_result_product_monthly_RE]
 where bev_prod_cd = '0001053651'
 and ctry_cd = 'AT'
 and bottler_cd = '80231'
 and version = '202338'
 order by c445_month_cd

title: [ETL] New info table to store latest version number
description:
Note: NOT related to the Release 2 changes, need to merge to the dev_integration branch

Context:
The "version" filed in the existing TFS baseline table is the c445_week_cd of the day when running the re_forecast_result table. It has always been a numeric value. However, with the introduction of Trueup process, the "version" field has to be treated as a string value as it can be a string like "202425_1" and "202425_2".

Needed changes:
  1. Instead of concatenating the current c445_week_cd with "_1"/"_2", need to use the same version number as the current forecast run. E.g. if the current forecast number is 202425, the following 2 trueup datasets generated 2 weeks later will be "202425_1" and "202425_2" (currently it will be "202427_1" and "202427_2")
  2. Such change will fail the existing logic where we try to get the max value of the version number, e.g. in Notebook Output_Validation:We need to have a config table to store the version number of the latest forecast dataset, and the 2 trueup datasets
To do:

Create a new info table baseline_run_info in /refined with only 2 records on the version numbers of the latest forecast dataset, and the latest trueup datasets. The table will be like this:
TYPE CURRENT_VERSION PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP PREVIOUS_VERSION
Forecast 202425 6/17/2024 21:00 202420
Trueup 202425_2 6/30/2024 21:00  



Running re_forecast_result will update only one of the records, depending on the purpose of the run.  

  1. Code changes expected:
    • in re_forecast_result notebook, 
      • update the records in baseline_run_info, depending on the purpose of the run (forecast vs. day1 trueup vs. day2 trueup). 
        • if it is a forecast trigger run (isTrueUp=false), in the baseline_run_info table we need to update the CURRENT_VERSION and PREVIOUS_VERSION fields
      • if isTrueUp=true, instead of using the current c445_week_cd, need to query the CURRENT_VERSION in baseline_run_info to get the version number of the latest forecast and only update the CURRENT_VERSION field
        • current:
    • change the Trueup_Master_Pipeline accordingly
      • Instead of concatenating the current c445_week_cd with "_1"/"_2", need to use the same c445_week_cd as the latest forecast. E.g. if the latest forecast number is 202425, the following 2 trueup datasets generated 2 weeks later will be "202425_1" and "202425_2" (currently it will be "202427_1" and "202427_2")
  2. create view for baseline_run_info 
    • hide the "PREVIOUS_VERSION" field to avoid confusing the frontend team

title: [Processing][Case Rate][April 2025] New outlier handling logic for YTG case rate
description:
Context:
Ada MA: hi Runfeng Han, getting back on the case rate outlier rule,    we did so...
posted in Topline Forecast System V 2.0 / 2. IT Business Analytics - Azure SQL on Friday, 4 April 2025 12:40 am
 

FP&A is requesting to modify the existing outlier handling logic for YTG case rate. Old logic: #233929
New logic:
  1. For the recent 3 months: if exceeding 2 times of past 12 months avg. or below 1/2 of past 12 months avg. it's outlier, if it's outlier, go for the month before last month. (replicate that up to last 3 months) .
  2. If step 1 failed, For the recent 3 months: check if price is exceeding 15 times of country avg. of the current checking month or less than 1/15 times of country avg. it's outlier. If it's outlier, go to PY avg. case rate at product level. (This is the original logic in #212659, we can reuse the logic in its PR)
  3. If step2 failed, check if PY avg. case rate is exceeding 15 times of country avg. in PY or less than 1/15 times of PY country avg. it's outlier, make case rate equal to 0, otherwise, take PY avg. case rate.
Note:
  1. average of last 12 month = sum(nsr across 12mths)/sum(uc across 12months) at the product level
  2. current month exclusive
  3. need to loop through the recent 3 months two times for Step 1 and 2 check step 1 and 2 are done within 1 single loop

To do:
  1. In dim_case_rate notebook, modify the logic accordingly
  2. Update the case rate outlier logic in https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_wiki/wikis/Product---Marketing-Analytics.wiki/3934/Global_NSR_Extraction_Master_Pipeline?anchor=dim_case_rate
comments: @Nikita Tseu additionally, could you update the wiki page for case rate outlier handling logic once complete the testing: https://dev.azure.com/BIA-Platform/Product%20-%20Marketing%20Analytics/_wiki/wikis/Product---Marketing-Analytics.wiki/3934/Global_NSR_Extraction_Master_Pipeline?anchor=dim_case_rate

Hi @Nikita Tseu ,
  1. I read through Ada's post, and "prior month" is the month where the case rate originates. The context is that we are checking the "last month case rate"To avoid confusion, I've amended the user story description
  2. If the metric is invalid, we will treat the check as failed. So if the 3 checks all failed, the final case rate for the YTG will be filled with 0
  3. it is okay to leave the logic as it is

Hi @Runfeng Han
After working on the story for a while, I’ve successfully implemented most of the required functionality. However, I need clarification on a few points to ensure the implementation is correct and complete and to finalize the remaining details accurately.

  1. In step 2, a case rate is supposed to be compared against the "prior month" country average case rate. However, after reflecting on this, I’m uncertain about the exact meaning of "prior month". Taken literally, "prior month" would mean comparing the current case rate to the average case rate of the previous calendar month. For example, if the current month is April (excluded from the calculation), we would try to take a case rate value from March and compare it to the country average case rate from February.

    At the same time, on the diagram provided by Ada in the very first green square the term "prior month" seems to indicate a month from which the case rate originates. Could it be that "prior" doesn't actually mean the calendar month before, but instead points to the same month from which the case value originates? If we go back to the example, this would mean taking a case rate value from March and comparing it to the country average case rate from March. And to me personally this seems to be much more "apple to apple" comparison then stepping a month back for a country average value.

  2. I implemented the checks such that if any of the comparison metrics (country average, past 12-month average, or PY country average) are invalid (null or negative or zero), the respective check will be skipped. However, the remaining checks among the three described in the story can still be applied, provided their comparison metrics are valid. My reasoning is that if it’s not possible to apply a particular check accurately (due to invalid metrics), the default behavior should be to accept the given case rate value as is. Please let me know if you agree with this approach.

  3. There’s a small inconsistency in the user story description. While the description specifies using the recent 3 months, the diagram shows 4 months (from the prior month to the prior month-3, inclusive). At the moment, the implemented approach is a hybrid between the two. We check for case rate for up to 4 months back, but only use the 4th month (PM-3) if the prior month (PM) case rate is not available. In other words, we check either from PM to PM-2, or from PM-1 to PM-3, depending on the availability of data for each particular product. Would it be ok to leave this logic as is, or would you prefer me to adjust it?
Hi @Nikita Tseu, the user story has been refined and put into the backlog

title: [Processing] Case Rate: calculation and allocation to monthly-BPP level
description:
The config file on granularity at the bottler level specifies the required level to calculate the case rate, regardless of the sNSR of the bottler from manual files or Global Cube. 

Steps:
  1. Calculation: Calculate the case rate at varying granularities  - Category / Brand / BP / BPP level, according to the config file
    • Based on the following rules
      • for YTD months (i.e. prior to the bottler's data availability date), case_rate =nsr_lc/UC
      • for YTG months (i.e. months left after the bottler's data availability date in the current year), case_rate should be populated using the most recently available month
        • the prior month's (current month -1) UC and nsr_lc.    case_rate = nsr_lc/UC
        • YTG calculation - If bottler-bpp does not have valid UC and nsr_lc data for the prior month then take UC and nsr_lc from (current month -2), or lastly, (from current month - 3). Invalid data includes
          • no record was found for Bottler-BPP code and the prior month
          • NULL values for UC and nsr_lc, or
          • or 0 UC 
  2. <New> Handling outliers and determine the YTG case rate:
    • A negative or 0 case rate is invalid, need to go to the next most recent month
    • If all the case rates in the prior 3 months are invalid, then use PY average case rate (i.e. Jan to Dec in last year) for that Category/brand/BP/BPP 
    • If NSR/UC is over 15 times of country average (i.e. sum(sNSR)/sum(UC) ),  ignore and use the prior month's case rate
  3. Allocation: Apply the same case rate to all BPPs under the same Category / Brand / BP
  4. The result will be stored in a new dimension table dim_case_rate, containing the case_rate at [ctry_cd, bottler_cd, channel_cd, bpp_cd, c445_month_cd] level
  5. The result will also be archived in dim_case_rate_history with the 445_week_cd as the version number 

Job Scheduling:
(Updated 26 Apr) The calculation and allocation of case rate for manual data and cube data will be conducted within the same notebook run, scheduled weekly with the data extraction from the Global Cube (so that the dim_case_rate table is always updated with the latest data from both the Global Cube and the manual files)

Calculation and allocation of case rate for manual data and cube data will be conducted by the same pipeline but 2 different triggers, writing data to 2 stage tables. 

Note:
  1. the bottler's data availability date: as the data availability varies among different countries and bottlers. For example, we could have a bottler who has not submitted any data for more than 1 month. So the cutoff dates are different for different countries. We used to call them "data availability date". Before this date, the baseline table contains the actual values. After this date, the baseline table contains the forecasted values
  2. channel_cd will be hardcoded as 'NA', acting as a placeholder

title: [Processing] [Case Rate] change logic of the outlier threshold: replace 15x country average with 2x average of last 12 month at BPP level
description:
Context:
FP&A has requested to change the logic of the outlier threshold: replace 15x country average with 2x average of last 12 month at the provided product level.
Note:
  1. average of last 12 month = sum(nsr across 12mths)/sum(uc across 12months)
  2. current month exclusive
  3. Need to cope with innovation products, which is defined by no historical data in the last 12 months.
New logic to define if a month's case rate is outlier:

  1. If average of last 12 month at product level is positive:
    1. check against 2x average of last 12 month at product level
      • if passed the check, i.e. less than 2x average of last 12 month at product level, then it is not an outlier. Use the case rate as the future case rate
      • if failed the check
        • if there exists historical data for the product in last 12 month, then it is flagged as an outlier. Continue the check on the next recent month
  2. If the average of last 12 month at product level is negative:
    1. check against 5x country average
      • if passed the check, i.e. less than 5x country average, then it is not an outlier. Use the case rate as the future case rate
      • if failed the check
        • it is flagged as an outlier. Continue the check on the next recent month


To do:
Code changes required in dim_case_rate notebook
comments:
@Nikita Tseu @Aparna Kanjarla 
I just discussed with Ada from FP&A. For such cases where average of last 12 month at BPP level is negative, we need to compare the case rate with 5xcountry average. If it is less than 5xcountry average, we will accept it.
I've updated the logic in the description.

@Runfeng Han
There's a case which is not covered in the story description. Currently if 2x average of last 12 month is negative, any positive case rate will be considered as outlier even if it's a reasonable value. We need to agree how to deal with the negative average of last 12 month. I can propose two possible options:
  1. Either to compare a case rate with the absolute value of the 12 month average.
  2. Or to ignore the check if the 12 month average is negative and automatically accept a case rate value for such products. Currently in the same way I handle a scenario when for some reason the 12 month average is NULL - the check ignored and the product is accepted.
Thanks, looking forward to your input.

CC: @Aparna Kanjarla
@Nikita Tseu I've discussed with @Aparna Kanjarla , and agree with your proposal. I've created a new user story #234639

Hi @Runfeng Han,
It seems that our Dim_Case_Rate notebook currently don't cover a case rate calculation for innovation products. Innovation products by definition only have records for the current month, while all existing calculations in the notebook start from the previous month. And building an outlier detection logic for innovation products doesn't seem practical without first implementing the case rate calculation.

If you are good with that, for the scope of the current story, I propose just replace the existing '15x country average' logic with a '2x average across 12 months' logic, without the innovation part. Meanwhile, we can determine how best to handle innovation products moving forward.

CC: @Aparna Kanjarla

title: DEV Testing
description:
Here’s a detailed description of the DEV Testing for the NSR and Masterdata user stories. These were tested concurrently due to the similarity in their structure, though they differ in specific business rules.

Sandbox Setup
To do this testing a sandbox was created. This sandbox environment included copies of all relevant tables, modified to cover a broad range of use cases. A detailed flow of how the sandbox was built will be included below.

Bottler Blueprint
  1. VOL_NSR_GRANULARITY was set to BP for bottler 80505 and to BPP for all others.
  2. MASTER_DATA_GRANULARITY was set to BP for bottler 80505, to NULL for 80498 and to BPP for all others.
  3. DATA_SRC_NSR was set to GLOBAL CUBE for bottler 80498 and to EXCEL for all others.
FACT_SALES_GLOBAL
Below you can find a screenshot with the content of FACT_SALES_GLOBAL table. The last column for each bottler is its number for an easier reference here. Expected/not expected means whether the corresponding bottler is expected to be included to the reminder attachment or not.
  1. [Expected] This bottler has BP granularity an was added to test the BPP -> BP conversion.
  2. [Expected] This bottler has BP granularity an was added to test the BPP -> BP conversion.
  3. [Not expected] This bottler has BP granularity an was added to test the BPP -> BP conversion. In the same time the corresponding BP code will be present within of the lookback period for the manual table, so it's not expected to be included into the reminder.
  4. [Expected] Rows 4 and 5 have the same bottler and product to check if the system correctly identifies duplicates and that the code will appear in the reminder only once.
  5. [Expected] Rows 4 and 5 have the same bottler and product to check if the system correctly identifies duplicates and that the code will appear in the reminder only once.
  6. [Not expected] This product is not expected to appear in the reminder because it has not allowed datasource for NSR data and not allowed (empty) granularity for MASTERDATA.

  7. [Not expected] FACT_SALES_GLOBAL lookback period if 4 months. Given that the testing is conducted in November (202411), this row is outside the lookback period so the product won't be included into the reminder.
  8. [Not expected] Date 20240628 in the last day of the 6th month according to the 4-4-5 calendar. So this day is right on the edge of the lookback period (excluded).
  9. [Expected] Date 20240629 in the first day of the 7th month according to the 4-4-5 calendar. So this day is right on the edge of the lookback period (included) and the product will be included to the reminder.

  10. [Not expected] The reminder email is generated by OU. All other bottlers are selected to be from EOU, however this one has intentionally been taken from other OU (ASPOU). This product are not supposed to be included into the EOU reminder.

  11. [Not expected] Products 11 and 12 are not supposed to be included into the EOU reminder because they are present in the manual table data.
  12. [Not expected] Products 11 and 12 are not supposed to be included into the EOU reminder because they are present in the manual table data.


FACT_SALES_MANUAL_LATEST
  1. FACT_SALES_MANUAL_LATEST lookback period if 4 months. Given that the testing is conducted in November (202411), this row is inside of the lookback period so the product won't be included into the reminder.

  2. FACT_SALES_MANUAL_LATEST lookback period if 4 months. Given that the testing is conducted in November (202411), this row is inside of the lookback period so the product won't be included into the reminder.
  3. This product is not in FACT_SALES_GLOBAL so won't be in the reminder.
  4. This row is added to test BPP -> BP conversion. For this BP there's a record with suitable BPP code in the FACT_SALES_GLOBAL. But if the conversion is done correctly, the system will recognize that the BP code is the same, so the product from FACT_SALES_GLOBAL won't be in the reminder.
  5. This product is present both in FACT_SALES_GLOBAL and FACT_SALES_MANUAL_LATEST. However, in FACT_SALES_MANUAL_LATEST it's outside of the lookback period so will be included to the reminder.


DIM_MASTER_DATA_LATEST
  1. DIM_MASTER_DATA_LATEST lookback period if current year. Given that the testing is conducted in November (202411), this row is inside of the lookback period so the product won't be included into the reminder.

  2. DIM_MASTER_DATA_LATEST lookback period if current year. Given that the testing is conducted in November (202411), this row is inside of the lookback period so the product won't be included into the reminder.
  3. This product is not in FACT_SALES_GLOBAL so won't be in the reminder.
  4. This row is added to test BPP -> BP conversion. For this BP there's a record with suitable BPP code in the FACT_SALES_GLOBAL. But if the conversion is done correctly, the system will recognize that the BP code is the same, so the product from FACT_SALES_GLOBAL won't be in the reminder.
  5. This product is present both in FACT_SALES_GLOBAL and DIM_MASTER_DATA_LATEST . However, in DIM_MASTER_DATA_LATEST it's outside of the lookback period so will be included to the reminder.


RESULTS
The resulting Excel files are attached to the task. The contents is as expected.

EMAILS



HOW TO BUILD THE SANDBOX
To this task I've attached an utility Jupyter notebook which could be imported to a Synapse workspace. However, the same notebook is included to the PR so most likely it could be found in the workspace even without an explicit import. So to build the sandbox you need to follow the steps below.
  1. Go to tfs_build_reminder_emails notebook and a folder name to the end of tfs_root_path ("nt_test" in my case). This will be your sandbox folder.
  2. In tfs_build_reminder_emails notebook add a new cell before the last cell where the output value is returned. Add the following code to the newly added cell replacing "nt_test" by your sandbox folder name. 
    for obj in reminder_emails:
    obj['reminder_attachment_blob_name'] = 'nt_test/' + obj['reminder_attachment_blob_name']
  3. In the utility notebook replace "nt_test" by your sandbox folder name. Run the notebook to generate test tables with data.
  4. In Monthly_Reminder pipeline go to the Send reminder activity and change EmailTo parameter value from dynamic to your email. 

  5. Trigger Missing_Products_Reminder_Wrapper in Debug mode setting ignore_schedule parameter to true.

title: Dev Testing
description:
dim_bottler_processing_log

This is a new service table created to store a log of submitted bottlers with their statuses. While mostly the column are self-explanatory, some of them might require a bit of clarification:
  1. STATUS - this column serves as an indication of the bottler processing status and might be changed several times in the same processing cycle. However, currently this column has only one possible value - "Submitted". In future we will cover more processing states and the corresponding statuses will be added to the table as well.

  2. SUBMITTED_MONTH_CD_445 - this column is derived from the submitted timestamp. One of the main purposes of this table is to provide all necessary info for end user reminders. The reminders are sent according to the 4-4-5 calendar so we need to maintain this column because Gregorian and 4-4-5 submitted month value won't always be the same.

Now let's consider a particular example which I used for the testing of this story. The file below was submitted to the system twice. I also manually added an additional record to the dim_bottler_processing_log pretending that there was some data submitted a couple of months early.



On the screenshot below you could see how the dim_bottler_processing_log looks after these manipulations. There are three groups of records:
  1. Green group contains four bottlers with data_src_nsr = "EXCEL" which have been submitted in July (7th month). It also contains multiple bottlers for the same OU (J&KOU) just to check that such scenario is handled correctly.
  2. Orange group is identical to the green (to show that the reminder will work correctly even if the same bottler appears multiple times in the dim_bottler_processing_log).
  3. Yellow group contains one bottler with data_src_nsr = "EXCEL" which have been submitted in May (5th month) - to show that it will still be included into the reminder for July.


In the case of J&KOU I managed to cover different countries and different data_src_nsr values. The expected result here is that bottlers 80148, 80176, 80185 won't get to the reminder attachment since they have already been submitted to system. Bottler 80149 won't get to the reminder because it has data_src_nsr = "GLOBAL CUBE" (only bottlers with data_src_nsr = "EXCEL" could potentially be included to the attachment). Bottler 80309 should be included to the reminder regardless of the fact that it's recorded in the dim_bottler_processing_log, because months don't match.

Ant the resulting reminder looks exactly as we could expect - it include bottlers 80302, 80309 and 80349.



In the case of ASPOU I didn't bother so much with different processing scenarios. The purpose of this OU was mostly to check that the functionality works correctly with multiple OUs processed together. So bottler 80465 is the only one submitted for ASPOU. And indeed, in the reminder we see 19 out of 20 bottlers present in the bottler config.


Overall look of the attachment

Here we should test at least the following points:
  1. Correct topic (including the OU)
  2. Correct recipient (TFSFinhubSupport@coca-cola.com but for DEV testing I used my personal email)
  3. Correct sender
  4. Correct attachment name (OU, data source, month)
  5. Correct message text
  6. Correct data upload link
There was also an additional test to check the behavior in case of an unexpected failure (the reminder should be sent to TFSFinhubSupport@coca-cola.com)

title: Final testing
description:
This is to perform sort of end-to-end testing including post deployment activities on DEV environment
Stepps to perform:

1) Cleanup stage_bp_ou and stage_bp_hyperion data left from development using TFS/Utilities/tfs_cleaup_data notebook. Html export of notebook run - tfs_cleanup_data.html. Preprocessed stage catalog for hyperion data doesn't exist because another temporary location was used during development.

2) Create empty delta tables and refined views for stage_bp_ou and stage_bp_hyperion using TFS/Utilities/tfs_create_empty_delta_tables notebook and TFS/tfs_view_creation SQL script. HTML export of notebook run - tfs_create_empty_delta_tables.html

3) Copy old fact_bp data into stage_bp_ou using Utilities/US234670_TFS_copy_data_into_stage_bp_ou notebook. Raw and refined tables need to be copied. HTML export of notebook run - US234670_TFS_copy_data_into_stage_bp_ou.html

4) Upload BP OU excel file into sharepoint here Input
File - bp_input_template_0232_test_file.xlsx

5) Upload BP Hyperion excel file into FP&A sherepoint folder here Input
File - bp_input_template_hyperion_0232_test_file.xlsx

6) Manually trigger LA workflow dedicated for BP ingestion. Currently LAs cant trigger synapse pipelines that are not published, so on this step we just check that files get to the correct landing locations. Landing locations are:
manual_submission/bp/ - for BP OU submissions
manual_submission/bp_hyperion/- for BP Hyperion submissions
7) Trigger BP_Hyperion_Input_Template_Ingestion pipeline first to ingest Hyperion data into stage_bp_hyperion.

8) Trigger BP_Input_Template_Ingestion pipeline next, to ingest BP OU data into stage_bp_ou and do the allocation.
Results of BP allocation are attached - BP_allocation_results.csv
Results of BP Hyperion allocation are attached - BP_Hyperion_allocation_results.csv

Explanation of correctness for bottler(SE-80395) with BPP granularity: 
a) This bottler does not participate in BP allocation, so we will have all 11 BPPs related to PB-0232 after this in stage_bp_ou. Records have 1 volume and 1 nsr and so 1 case_rate
b) During BP hyperion allocation volume of single SE-80395 record from stage_bp_hyperion, which has 11 volume and 11 nsr should be split into 11 BPPs of 1 volume and 1 nsr.

Explanation of correctness for bottler(KR-80002) with BP granularity: 
a) This bottler does participate in BP allocation. Record was submitted with 1 volume, 1 nsr and so 1 case_rate.
b) After BP allocation each BPP of this BP-0109 will have 12 BPPs with volume equal to nsr equal to BPP ratio, because

1(volume_bp)*ratio = volume_bpp 
volume_bpp*1(case_rate) = nsr
volume_bpp = nsr = ratio

c) After BP hyperion allocation, single KR-80002 record from stage_bp_hyperion, which was submitted with 1 volume and 1 nsr, will have 12 BPPs with

 volume_bpp = 1(volume_bp)*ratio*case_rate

Here ratio will be the same as during BP allocation, because we use the same fact_sales_global data to allocate the volume of hyperion record. And because case_rate, calculated from stage_bp_ou data, will be 1, we will again have volume_bpp = nsr = ratio. 

Here are fact_sales_global ratios calculated separately for KR-80002-0109 using query 0109_bpp_ratios.sql as confirmation.

9) Repeat steps 5, 6 and 7 with the same BP Hyperion excel file to emulate Hyperion resubmission and reallocation. As we will submit the same file as in step 5, actual volume and nsr for affected records should stay the same but PIPELINE_RUN_ID will be from the last BP_Hyperion_Input_Template_Ingestion run.
BP_Hyperion_resubmission_and_reallocation_results.csv
should be the same with
BP_Hyperion_allocation_results.csv
except PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP and PIPELINE_RUN_ID.

@Aliaksei Milto

@Aliaksei Milto as discussed, this is the only validation rule for bottler_cd + ctry_cd submitted in BP file:


 @Andrii Yuzhanin

@Sakshi Joshi @Andrii Yuzhanin 
I believe in case of BP we can't do №2 as well, because to determine if we need to join BOTTLER_CD_SET_HYPERION and BOTTLER_CD, we need to know value of data_src_bp.
Can we omit this check?

@Aliaksei Milto Agree. So to summarize,
  1. If ctry_cd + bottler_cd from file is not found in config, then error message
     "The country code - bottler code combination was not found in bottler blueprint. Note that if bottler is configured to use SET as BP data source, mapping between SET and NSR Datalake bottler codes should be provided in bottler blueprint. This bottler is configured to use <dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp]> for BP submission."

  2. If ctry_cd + bottler_cd from file is found in config and dim_bottler_config [data_src_bp] is null, then error message
     "Bottler's BP source was not specified in bottler blueprint. Please update BP source as Excel or SET in TFS blueprint table.."
I believe 2 should be implemented already as that was part of original user story. For 1, please make the change.
@Andrii Yuzhanin once change is available, could you run a quick test for above 2 scenarios in DEV?

@Sakshi Joshi
If we are not able to find ctry_cd + bottler_cd combination in the config, then we're not able to get data_src_bp value and can't write it to notification properly. Maybe we can just drop this sentence?

Hi @Aliaksei Milto The error message should display value of data_src_bp field. Can you please fix this?
 cc @Andrii Yuzhanin

BP testing finished on dev. There was an issue with notification for case 3, but Alex fixed it ad-hoc. 
@Aliaksei Milto I did not see task for check list, so if it is done please add it to story. Thanks! 

@Sakshi Joshi

comments:
Thank u @Nikita Tseu, no other questions from me, all tests passed and I will close the task. 😊

(cc @Andrii Yuzhanin)

Hi @Vanessa Ma!
Thank you for finding such unobvious cases.

Case 1:
In this case the value is a valid number and the percent sign is just a visual representation (so you see 20% but in fact it's 0.2). So it's allowed and processed as 0.2. However, in my sandbox testing you could find an example where percent sign was included as a text, not as a part of number. In those case the row has been rejected.

Case 2:
I agree, the result might look a bit confusing, but I still think that this result is expected. When we prepare a summary table, only bottler code and country are included into unique bottler id. So the month column should be considered just as a general data column. And in this particular case user is informed that bottler VC-80214 has an invalid row with unexpected month format.

CC: @Andrii Yuzhanin

Hi @Nikita Tseu I have two questions regarding Rebate test:

Case 1:
The record with Rebate amount = 20% (with %) passed the check and is processed to the db. According to US description is should be rejected (NO percentages or special characters). Is it expected?



Case 2: 
I tested a case where same ctry-bottler combo has 2 records in one file, w/ one valid and another invalid (see below). 

The valid record is corrected processed into the database and the invalid one is rejected. 

But in the email notif such ctry-bottler combo is shown only as "rejected". Is it expected?

title: UAT Testing
comments: Hi @Runfeng Han Can you please verify Case rate changes on UAT, using whatever data we have from FP&A?

title: Test in DEV
description:
To ensure clarity, the following rule names are introduced in this report:
  • Rule 1: Past 12 months average case rate rule.
  • Rule 2: Current month country average case rate rule.
  • Rule 3: PY country average case rate rule.

Scenario 1

Target Product: AFHL053835
Country: DE (Germany)



This scenario covers the following parts of the logic:
  1. Case rate is below 1/2 of the past 12 months average: Rule 1 not passed.
  2. Case rate exceeds 2x the past 12 months average: Rule 1 not passed.
  3. Case rate meets Rule 1.
  4. Case rate meets Rule 2.
Rule 1 Check
The past 12 months average case rate for the product is 8.0 (AVG_12m)
202504 case rate = 2.0 → 2.0 < 1/2 AVG_12m → INVALID
202503 case rate = 25.0 → 25.0 > 2 * AVG_12m → INVALID
202502 case rate = 13.0 → 1/2 AVG_12m < 13.0 < 2 * AVG_12m → VALID → proceed to Rule 2

Rule 2 Check
Country average case rate 202502 = 13.0 (AVG_CTRY)
Validation rule:
1/15 * AVG_CTRY < 13.0 < 15 * AVG_CTRY → VALID → accept the case rate.

Result
The final YTG case rate value for AFHL053835 is 13.0.



Scenario 2

Target Product: A3AY052145
Country: AE (United Arab Emirates)



This scenario covers the following parts of the logic:
  1. Rule 1 passed.
  2. Case rate is below 1/15 of the monthly country average: Rule 2 not passed, go to Rule 3.
  3. Rule 3 is passed, accept the PY case rate as YTG value.
Rule 1 Check
The past 12 months average case rate for the product is 8.0 (AVG_12m).
202504 case rate = 2.0 → 2.0 < 1/2 AVG_12m → INVALID
202503 case rate = 25.0 → 25.0 > 2 * AVG_12m → INVALID
202502 case rate = 13.0 → 1/2 AVG_12m < 13.0 < 2 * AVG_12m → VALID → proceed to Rule 2

Rule 2 Check
Product 202502 case rate = 13.0
Country 202502 case rate = 25000.0 (AVG_CTRY)
Validation rule:
13.0 < 1/15 * AVG_CTRY → INVALID → proceed to Rule 3

Rule 3 Check
Product PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
Country PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
PY (2024) case rate is VALID

Result
The final YTG case rate value for A3AY052145 is 10.0.



Case 3

Target Product: A3AY052145
Country: PL (Poland)



This scenario covers the following parts of the logic:
  1. Rule 1 passed.
  2. Case rate exceeds 15x monthly country average: Rule 2 not passed, go to Rule 3.
  3. Case rate exceeds 15x PY country average : Rule 3 not passed, assign 0.0 as YTG case rate.
Rule 1 Check
The past 12 months average case rate for the product is 8.0 (AVG_12m).
202504 case rate = 2.0 → 2.0 < 1/2 AVG_12m → INVALID
202503 case rate = 25.0 → 25.0 > 2 * AVG_12m → INVALID
202502 case rate = 13.0 → 1/2 AVG_12m < 13.0 < 2 * AVG_12m → VALID → proceed to Rule 2

Rule 2 Check
Product 202502 case rate = 13.0
Country 202502 case rate = 0.5 (AVG_CTRY)
Validation rule:
13.0 > 15 * AVG_CTRY → INVALID → proceed to Rule 3

Rule 3 Check
Product PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
Country PY (2024) case rate = 0.5
Validation rule:
10.0 > 15 * AVG_CTRY → INVALID

Result
The final YTG case rate value for A3AY052145 is 0.0.



Scenario 4

Target Product: A3AY052145
Country: TR (Türkiye)



This scenario covers the following parts of the logic:
  1. Base metric for Rule 1/2 is NULL or negative.
Rule 1 Check
The past 12 months average case rate for the product is 8.0 (AVG_12m).
202504 case rate = 2.0 → 2.0 < 1/2 AVG_12m → INVALID
202503 case rate = 25.0 → 25.0 > 2 * AVG_12m → INVALID
202502 case rate = 13.0 → 1/2 AVG_12m < 13.0 < 2 * AVG_12m → VALID → proceed to Rule 2

Rule 2 Check
Product 202502 case rate = 13.0
Country 202502 case rate < 0 → immediately go to Rule 3

Rule 3 Check
Product PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
Country PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
PY (2024) case rate is VALID

Result
The final YTG case rate value for A3AY052145 is 10.0.



Scenario 5

Target Product: A3AY052145
Country: QA (Qatar)



This scenario covers the following parts of the logic:
  1. Base metric for Rule 3 is NULL or negative.
Rule 1 Check
The past 12 months average case rate for the product is 8.0 (AVG_12m).
202504 case rate = 2.0 → 2.0 < 1/2 AVG_12m → INVALID
202503 case rate = 25.0 → 25.0 > 2 * AVG_12m → INVALID
202502 case rate = 13.0 → 1/2 AVG_12m < 13.0 < 2 * AVG_12m → VALID → proceed to Rule 2

Rule 2 Check
Product 202502 case rate = 13.0
Country 202502 case rate = 0.5 (AVG_CTRY)
Validation rule:
13.0 > 15 * AVG_CTRY → INVALID → proceed to Rule 3

Rule 3 Check
Product PY (2024) case rate = 10.0
Country PY (2024) case rate < 0 → check is considered FAILED
PY (2024) case rate is INVALID

Result
The final YTG case rate value for A3AY052145 is 0.0.

title: [Processing] [Case Rate] Cope with Innovation product
description:
Context:
FP&A requests to calculate the case rate for innovation products, which is defined by no historical data in the last 12 months.
If there is no historical data for the product in last 12 month (innovation product), check against 5x @country average.
  • If passed the check, i.e. less than 5x @country average, then it is not an outlier. Use the case rate as the future case rate
  • If failed, then it is flagged as an outlier. Assign country average as the future case rate.
To do:
Code changes required in dim_case_rate notebook
comments:
if the product only has volume in the current month, there will be no forecast values for it. It does not make sense the generate the future case rate for it. Need further discussion with FP&A.

title: [ETL] Build Logic App flow to move bottler SNSR excel file from Sharepoint to ADLS landing
description:
Background:
So far, TFS has been extracting Unit Cases and Net Sales Revenue (UC, NSR) for all bottlers from NSR Global Datalake (ADLS). However, the NSR is inaccurate in Global datalake for significant number of bottlers, due to which it cannot be used for revenue forecasting purpose in TFS.
Instead, users would like to submit excel file containing UC and NSR for such bottlers, using which TFS will compute case rate at most granular (BPP level).
The computed case rate and forecasted volume will be supplied via TFS db to dashboard team, for them to calculate revenue forecast (volume forecast X Case rate at daily-BPP level).

Logic App changes
  1. A new Logic App workflow "la-tccc-tfs-<env>-nsr-excel-ingestion" needs to be developed to drop NSR excel file from Sharepoint to Landing zone, and trigger  NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion pipeline. Where env is dev/uat/prod.
  2. LA flow will run every 1 hour on production.

  3. Source location for logic app is OU -> NSR -> Input folder on this path for each of the 9 OUs
    https://groups.coca-cola.com/sites/FinanceHub/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?csf=1&web=1&e=8zWJXf&cid=fa4b2f81%2D1eda%2D4ec3%2Db99c%2D127648a70296&FolderCTID=0x0120002281E8E9D9FBD24D934910BD09D78388&id=%2fsites%2fFinanceHub%2fShared%20Documents%2fTFS%2fNSR%20and%20Master%20Data%20Upload%2fASPOU%2fNSR%2fInput&viewid=8c55e7cf%2D7a5b%2D4720%2D89af%2Dca986f33d62f
    So LA has to recursively check NSR folder inside each of the OUs at above path.
  4. Drop location for Logic App is tfs/landing/manual_submission/nsr/

  5. When searching in sharepoint source folder, LA will pick up files with "nsr_input_template" string in file name. Files will be picked up based on the order (time) in which they were placed on sharepoint folder. Older file to be picked up first. 
    1. If file name is missing "nsr_input_template, do not drop file to landing. Instead, notify user to submit expected file name and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template.

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/NSR and Master Data Upload/ASPOU/NSR/Input

      The file was not processed due to missing "nsr_input_template" in file name . Please amend file name and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>


  6. Checks to be performed by LA:
    1. Is file format .xlsx? If not, do not drop the file on landing. Instead, notify user to submit nsr_input_template in .xlsx format and then move file to Sharepoint Archive folder for that OU. Use below email template:

      Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

      You have uploaded
      File: <original filename>
      Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/NSR and Master Data Upload/ASPOU/NSR/Input

      The file was not processed due to invalid format. Valid file format is .xlsx . Please amend and resubmit.

      The file has been moved as:
      Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>
      Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

  7. File name will be renamed as <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx before dropping it on ADLS. Where submitter email is taken from sharepoint, and timestamp is when the file was uploaded on sharepoint by user.
  8. Following email notification will be sent to submitter once file is picked up from sharepoint Input folder:
    Hello <Submitter name e.g. Sakshi Joshi>

    You have uploaded
    File: <original filename>
    Path Uploaded: <Sharepoint path> e.g. TFS/NSR and Master Data Upload/ASPOU/NSR/Input

    The file has been moved as:
    Archived File: <yyyymmddhhmmss>_<submitterEmail>_<submittedFileName>.xlsx
    Archived Folder Path: <archive path>

    The file will be processed in TFS, and valid data will be available in monthly forecast table upon next forecast run.
  9. As a very last step, Logic app flow should move the file to Archive sub-folder of that OU - NSR path. https://groups.coca-cola.com/sites/FinanceHub/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?csf=1&web=1&e=8zWJXf&cid=fa4b2f81%2D1eda%2D4ec3%2Db99c%2D127648a70296&FolderCTID=0x0120002281E8E9D9FBD24D934910BD09D78388&id=%2fsites%2fFinanceHub%2fShared%20Documents%2fTFS%2fNSR%20and%20Master%20Data%20Upload%2fASPOU%2fNSR%2fArchive&viewid=8c55e7cf%2D7a5b%2D4720%2D89af%2Dca986f33d62f

title: [Processing] Link the Case Rate Calculation Notebook with the Ingestion Pipeline
description:
This story will link NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion pipeline (developed by Nikita) with Case Rate allocation notebook (developed by Aparna). 

Every time NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion  pipeline is triggered for particular country_cd + bottler_cd + c445_month_cd combination,
  1.  (either manually or through Logic App NSR excel ingestion), the UC and NSR records from fact_sales_manual_latest for that country_cd + bottler_cd + c445_month_cd  will be passed to allocation notebook.
  2. When triggered, the case rate allocation notebook will upsert stage_case_rate_manual records for the country_cd + bottler_cd + c445_month_cd  combination

  1. NSR and UC data ingested from manual excel files will remain in fact_sales_manual_latest table - till the NSR ADLS ingestion pipeline runs.

  2. NSR ADLS ingestion pipeline will pick up ALL records from fact_sales_manual_latest, calculate case rate, perform allocation, union records (source: excel and cube) and update/insert to dim_case_rate.
