title: [ETL] Manual file ingestion: sNSR
description:
Background:
So far, TFS has been extracting Unit Cases and Net Sales Revenue (UC, NSR) for all bottlers from NSR Global Datalake (ADLS). However, the NSR is inaccurate in Global datalake for significant number of bottlers, due to which it cannot be used for revenue forecasting purpose in TFS.
Instead, users would like to submit excel file containing UC and NSR for such bottlers, using which TFS will compute case rate at most granular (BPP level).
The computed case rate and forecasted volume will be supplied via TFS db to dashboard team, for them to calculate revenue forecast (volume forecast X Case rate at daily-BPP level).


Synapse pipeline changes
  1. A new excel ingestion pipeline NSR_Input_Template_Ingestion will be built under TFS - ETL - Manual Ingestion folder on synapse workspace. 

  2. Pipeline will be triggered by Logic App, and pick up files from tfs/landing/manual_submission/nsr/ for processing.
  3. If Logic app detects multiple files inside an OU folder, it will drop them to landing and trigger Synapse pipeline to sequentially process these files, starting from oldest timestamp.

Processing and ADLS changes:
  1. nsr_input_template excel can have data for multiple countries and bottlers, which will likely belong to same OU. 

  2. "nsr_input_template" will be ingested to 2 tables on Refined zone tfs db:
    1. dbo.fact_sales_manual_latest that contains latest data uploaded for particular C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD combination
    2. dbo.fact_sales_manual_history that contains all historical data uploaded for bottler

  3. Data should be read from "SNSR" tab (case insensitive) in nsr_input_template
  4. Storage locations:

    Landing zone: tfs/landing/manual_submission/nsr/<filename>.xlsx

    Stage zone: tfs/stage/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_manual/<PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP>/<Parquet file>

    Raw zone: tfs/raw/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_manual (Delta table)

    Refined zone: tfs/refined/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_manual_latest (Delta table)
                            tfs/refined/manual_submission/nsr/fact_sales_manual_history (Delta table)

    Archive zone: tfs/archive/manual_submission/nsr/<filename>.xlsx

  5. nsr_input_template and fact_sales_manual_history schema will be as follows. 
    Reading of excel columns should be case insensitive.
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd -  similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt  - float
    7. btlr_vol  - float
    8. last_submitted_timestamp - taken from excel filename
    9. last_processed_timestamp - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App
    10. updated_by - taken from excel filename
    11. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    12. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    13. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    14. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    15. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
  6. Possible partitioning of data in fact_sales_manual_latest and fact_sales_manual_history can be on c445_month_cd. But could be revisited once we get actual data during Pilot phase in April and May, to see if we need further partitioning e.g. bottler.
    UPDATE: 
    fact_sales_manual_latest table is partitioned by C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD combination to support partition override.
    fact_sales_manual_history table is partitioned by C445_MONTH_CD.
  7.  fact_sales_manual_latest will be updated on Refined zone when C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD from excel file already exists in table. Else new record will be inserted.
  8. fact_sales_manual_history schema will be as follows. 
    1. c445_month_cd  - YYYYMM
    2. ctry_cd  - 2 character ISO code
    3. bottler_cd -  similar to dbo.dm_bottler [bottler_cd]
    4. channel_cd - should be set to "NA" during ingestion. ignore value supplied in excel.
    5. product_cd - can be code for Category or Brand or Package or BPP. e.g. AE4P050035, AE4P,  0014,  02,  CRA
    6. AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt  - float
    7. btlr_vol  - float
    8. last_submitted_timestamp - taken from excel filename
    9. last_processed_timestamp - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App
    10. updated_by - taken from excel filename
    11. pipeline_run_id - ID of the Synapse pipeline run
    12. processed_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been taken for processing
    13. submitted_timestamp - timestamp when the file has been uploaded by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
    14. submitted_by - generated when synapse ingestion pipeline was triggered by Logic App (taken from excel filename)
    15. source_file - original file name as submitted by user to SharePoint folder (taken from excel filename)
  9. Null or blank AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt  and btlr_vol  should be stored as zero in Refined.
  10. fact_sales_manual_history will be appended with new, valid records every time a new nsr_input_template excel is submitted. Records that fail validation checks will not be added there. Validation checks and user email notification will be implemented as part of separate user story.
  11. Handling of duplicate records in excel (TBC with Finance)​ UPDATE - confirmed with Finance
    1. If multiple records exist in excel for same C445_MONTH_CD + CTRY_CD + BOTTLER_CD + PRODUCT_CD, then sum up AC_btlr_net_sls_rev_amt and btlr_vol before storing in fact_sales_manual_latest  
    2. duplicated records will not be aggregated in fact_sales_manual_history. This table will contain all valid records (that pass data quality checks) from excel.
  12. After the processing the input file should be moved to the corresponding archive folder.
comments:

@Sakshi Joshi 
Thank you for the detailed description, seems that it covers all the necessary points. I have just a couple of things I'd like to propose.
  1. According to the solution design it's possible that multiple input files will be processed in a single pipeline run. To be able to track the source file for each produced record I suggest to add a SOURCE_FILE log column. In addition to this to be able to track a particular pipeline run which has produced the record we could add a PIPELINE_RUN_ID log column.

  2. Is it possible for us to consider a change of the table names? I see one particular problem with the existing naming. We use "raw" and "archive" in the table names which crates a confusion because we also have ADLS storage zones with the similar names. At least I by default think that these suffixes refer to the data storage location, which is not true at all. How about the following change:
    fact_sales_manual_raw  ---->  fact_sales_manual
    fact_sales_manual_archive  ---->  fact_sales_manual_history or fact_sales_manual_full

  3. It's a very small thing, but it's the only moment when we still could change something about this. In my opinion LAST_SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP, LAST_PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP and UPDATED_BY column names stand out from our general naming approach. In our previous projects we usually used names like SUBMITTED_TIMESTAMP, PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP and SUBMITTED_BY. Is there any specific reason why you've decided to name them in this new way?

title: [NSR ETL] Row-level identification & notification for fields with non-numeric data
description: Currently if an input NSR file contains a non-numeric value in a numeric column the whole file gets rejected with a generic error message. To provide user with more details we need to make this check row-level. However, it's not a straightforward task because the excel parser will not be able to read the file in case of such mixed data types. The goal could be achieved by adding an additional pre-processing step which will open the file by some external library like openpyxl and separate the invalid values into an additional temporary column, replacing them by a numeric placeholder in the original column. Then this pre-processed file could be consumed by the existing processing flow.

title: [ETL] Implement data validation checks for sNSR file
description:
Since sNSR excel is a manually prepared input to TFS, some data quality & schema validation checks will be done on submitted files. Users will be notified of issues that lead to partial / complete rejection of the file.
File with rejected records or records with warnings should be stored at tfs/reject/manual submission/nsr

  • Sender: Finance Hub Notification

  • Email subject: TFS-<env>-NSR_Excel_Ingestion-<status> Notification
    where env is DEV/UAT/PROD and status is "Successful" or "Failure" or "Successful with Warnings"

  • Pipeline ID: <ID>

  • Loading Details: 
    • for Schema check failures, display corresponding notification message in this section

    • for Data Quality check failures or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was processed with errors or warnings. Please refer to the attachment in this link for list of rejected records, and resubmit the file after required corrections."
      <ADLS rejected path to download the file. Replace any spaces in submitted file name with underscore _ so that link does not break>

    • for successful file loads i.e. no errors or warnings, display the message "Submitted file <filename> was successfully loaded to TFS. Data will be reflected in monthly forecast table after next forecast run."

Validation Type Validation Sub-type Expected value Status Means of notification Notification message
Schema Tab name SNSR (case insensitive) Error.

ctry_cd

product_cd

Please ensure all mandatory columns are included in SNSR tab and resubmit the file.

Reject record. 		Email attachment with "SNSR validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid month format. Should be valid YYYYMM value."
Data Quality ctry_cd Should exist in dim_bottler_config.
Cannot be blank. 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "SNSR validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid country code - bottler code combination. Should be valid code that exists in ISSCOM and Global NSR Datalake."
Data Quality bottler_cd Should exist in dim_bottler_config.
Cannot be blank. 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "SNSR validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid country code - bottler code combination. Should be valid code that exists in ISSCOM and Global NSR Datalake."
Data Quality channel_cd No validation rule needed yet as this is hardcoded as "NA" during ingestion Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "SNSR validation" tab.  -
Data Quality product_cd 1. Cannot be blank

2. Depending on dim_bottler_config [vol_nsr_granularity] for submitted  country_cd + bottler_cd:
i. For "Beverage_Category" product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [category_code]

ii. For "Brand" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 3. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Brand_Code]

iii. For "BP" -  LPAD zeroes if string length < 4. After LPAD product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [Beverage_Product_Code]

iv. For "BPP" - LPAD zeroes if string length < 10. After LPAD, product_cd should exist in dim_isscom_prod_mapping [bpp_cd] 		Error.
Reject record. 		Email attachment with "SNSR validation" tab.  Error: "Invalid product code. As per NSR granularity for bottler <bottler_cd>-<bottler_nm> in bottler blueprint, valid <Beverage Category / Brand / BP / BPP> code is expected."

Where <> = dim_bottler_config [vol_nsr_granularity]

'- Should be decimal point number, including 0 / positive / negative. 
- NO percentages or special characters.

"Warning: Bottler NSR was submitted as 0 or blank. Blank values are loaded as 0 in TFS. Please review the submitted data and resubmit if necessary"

title: [Post processing] Overwrite YTD Actual NSR with manual NSR
description:
Requirement: 
For markets that use manual approach, YTD NSR in the baseline table will be replaced with the sNSR numbers from the manual files.
Challenge: 
manual NSR data could be at a higher level than BPP, e.g. category/brand, and even BP level (BP is not in the current TFS ISSCOM dim table). We have to allocate the manual NSR from the higher level to BPP level.

Proposed solution:
We are to allocate the manual NSR from the higher level to BPP level according to the weight of the actual monthly UC from the Global Cube. 
For example, there are 4 BPPs under 1 brand, and their UC weights are 10%, 20%,50%,20%. The YTD sNSR of this brand will be allocated to each BPP according to their UC weights, and will be used to overwrite the sNSR from the Global Cube in the baseline table.

This is based on the agreement with FP&A side that we will always use the UC actual from the Global Cube in the baseline table

To do:
  1. Perform the allocation to the manually submitted monthly sNSR to BPP level, according to the granularity specified by the config table #216483  @Aparna Kanjarla you can decide where to perform this step (before or during the post-processing step)
  2. During post-processing, overwrite the BPP level monthly YTD sNSR with the allocation result

title: [ETL][Validation] Flag the records where |UC|<1 in manual NSR files as warnings
description:

We'd like to propose adding the rule: If input vol is between -1 and 1, then consider Vol as 0. This rule should be applicable to Actual SNSR, (PY and YTD months) for manual upload countries only.

To do:

"The submitted volume is between -1 , 1. It will be set to 0 in the case rate calculation process"

title: Sandbox testing
description:
All files are attached to the task.

Stage 1

To test the changes I used two files - one for SG and one for MY.

20240412013907_ntseu@coca-cola.com_nsr_input_template_ASP_SG.xlsx - SG (588 rows)
20240412234512_ntseu@coca-cola.com_nsr_input_template_ASP_MY.xlsx - MY (314 rows)

First I ingested both files in an automated mode. This means that pipeline automatically discovers all files in the landing directory and ingests them in alphabetical order.

Expectations:
  1. SG file is processed first, MY file after it.
  2. There are 588 + 314 = 902 rows in both LATEST and HISTORY table (since it's a first upload).
Indeed, the SG file has been processed first as we can see from the PROCESSED_TIMESTAMP column, and there are exactly 902 rows both in LATEST and HISTORY tables (I put only one screenshot since both tables looks the same).





Stage 2

To test the changes I used two files - SG2 and MY2.

20240415124207_ntseu@coca-cola.com_nsr_input_template_ASP_SG_2.xlsx - SG2



20240415124205_ntseu@coca-cola.com_nsr_input_template_ASP_MY_2.xlsx - MY2



These files I ingested in manual mode to test it. This means that pipeline ignores all files in the landing directory except the ones which are provided as an input prameter.

Expectations:
  1. MY file is processed first, SG file after it.
  2. All files in the Landing folder are ignored except these two.
  3. HISTORY table contains 902 + 3 + 3 = 908 rows.
  4. First two records in each of the input file are merged together in the LATEST table because they have the same PRODUCT_CD (deduplication test).
  5. For C445_MONTH_CD = 202401 LATEST table contains 2 rows for SG and 2 rows for MY (partition override logic test).
  6. LATEST table contains 902 - 196 (old 202401) - 157 (old 202401) + 4 (new 202401) = 553 rows (partition override logic test).
